original: @89a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @89a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya sapta sha ti k'a pradzny'a p'a ra mi ta t'i k'a /
analyzed: a'arya sapta sha ti k'a pradzny'a p'a ra mi ta t'i k'a /
translated: ƒÄrya-sapta≈õatikƒÅpraj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅtikƒÅ

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: Noble One, the Extensive Explanation of the Perfection of Wisdom in Seven Hundred Lines

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: kun tu gzigs phyag na autpala @89b sngon po dri ma med pa bsnams pa la rgyun du phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: kun tu gzigs phyag na autpala @89b sngon po dri ma med pa bsnams pa la rgyun du phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I constantly pay homage to the all-seeing one, who holds a stainless blue utpala flower in his hand.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / lam la log par zhugs pa rnams kyi ched du 'di brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / lam la log par zhugs pa rnams kyi ched du 'di brtsams te /
translated: This was composed for the sake of those who have entered the wrong path regarding the essence of the TathƒÅgata and the path.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to correctly teach his essence.

original: gang yang bdag gis ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang bdag gis ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: Also, One should view the TathƒÅgata just as I have seen him.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: If one practices the perfection of wisdom, one will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sdud pa pos byas pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sdud pa pos byas pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is so-called, etc. is the words of the compiler.

original: mdo sde'i don mtha' dag bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde'i don mtha' dag bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of the entire meaning of the sutra.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag las lung nod pa gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag las lung nod pa gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
translated: By I is meant that it was received from the mouth of the Bhagavat himself, not from another.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi pad mo nas mngon sum du thos par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi pad mo nas mngon sum du thos par bstan to //
translated: This shows that it was heard directly from the lotus mouth of the Bhagavat.

original: thos ba zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas rjes su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: thos ba zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas rjes su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: By heard is meant that it was experienced by the ear consciousness,

original: rtogs pa ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: rtogs pa ni ma yin te ;
translated: but not realized.

original: chos 'di lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis khong du chud pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'di lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis khong du chud pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because no one but the Tathagata has the power to comprehend such a Dharma.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig na ste /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig na ste /
translated: By at one time is meant at one time,

original: dus thams cad du mdo sde rin po che 'di lta bu dmigs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du mdo sde rin po che 'di lta bu dmigs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to encounter such a precious sutra at all times.

original: 'dis ni res 'ga' zhig yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'di rnyed par dka' bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni res 'ga' zhig yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'di rnyed par dka' bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is difficult to find, because it is taught that it exists only occasionally.

original: yang na dus gcig na bdag gis thos kyi /
analyzed: yang na dus gcig na bdag gis thos kyi /
translated: Or else, he says, ‚ÄúI heard at one time‚Äù

original: gzhan du ni chos kyi rnam grangs gzhan dang gzhan ngas thos so zhes zur gyis bdag nyid mang du thos pa yin par sman pa'i rgyal po snying rje can gyi tshul bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan du ni chos kyi rnam grangs gzhan dang gzhan ngas thos so zhes zur gyis bdag nyid mang du thos pa yin par sman pa'i rgyal po snying rje can gyi tshul bzhin du brjod do //
translated: in order to indicate that he is very learned, like a compassionate king of physicians who says, ‚ÄúI have heard this or that Dharma teaching at one time or another.‚Äù

original: kha cig ni dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni skad cig thong cig la dus gcig ces bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni skad cig thong cig la dus gcig ces bya ste /
translated: Some say: ‚ÄúAt one time‚Äù means in one moment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang gis sdud par byed pa de la mdo sde'i don mtha' dag snang ba rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang mthun pa'i rnam pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma gcig la byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang gis sdud par byed pa de la mdo sde'i don mtha' dag snang ba rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang mthun pa'i rnam pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma gcig la byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: In one moment, the entire meaning of the sutra appears to that compiler through the power of the Bhagavan, because a single moment of mental consciousness in accord with ear consciousness arises.

original: rmi lam na lha'i dbang gis dus thung ngur yang lo brgya la sogs pa dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam na lha'i dbang gis dus thung ngur yang lo brgya la sogs pa dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as through the power of a god, a hundred years and so on are perceived in a short time in a dream.

original: da nyid kyi phyir mdo sdud par mdzad pas gdul bya'i skye bo gzhan la phan gdags pa'i phyir phyis chos bstan pa mdzad pa na bar skabs su dus kun tu mnyam par gzhag pa mi srid pa dang / gal te na lung du ma bstan @90a * //
analyzed: da nyid kyi phyir mdo sdud par mdzad pas gdul bya'i skye bo gzhan la phan gdags pa'i phyir phyis chos bstan pa mdzad pa na bar skabs su dus kun tu mnyam par gzhag pa mi srid pa dang / gal te na lung du ma bstan @90a * //
translated: Now, in order to benefit other disciples, he later taught the Dharma, and it is not possible that he was not always in meditative equipoise in between.

original: pa'i yul gzhan la sems dmigs su zin kyang phyis mdo sde mtha' dag sdud pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'i yul gzhan la sems dmigs su zin kyang phyis mdo sde mtha' dag sdud pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if he focused his mind on other neutral objects, it would not contradict his later compilation of the entire s≈´tras.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis don kun rdzogs par snang ba'i shes pa de bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis don kun rdzogs par snang ba'i shes pa de bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition that appears to have completed its object arises in the same way by the power of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de ni yang chos nyan pa'i bdud rtsi'i ros ngoms pa med do //
analyzed: de ni yang chos nyan pa'i bdud rtsi'i ros ngoms pa med do //
translated: Moreover, he is never satiated by the taste of the nectar of listening to the Dharma.

original: gdul bya'i tshogs lhag ma rnams kyang de ji ltar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gdul bya'i tshogs lhag ma rnams kyang de ji ltar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: How could the remaining assemblies of disciples not be like that?

original: yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs ni de ltar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs ni de ltar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: The assembly of completely pure bodhisattvas would be like that.

original: de skad du skad cig ma gcig la shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa dag 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de skad du skad cig ma gcig la shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa dag 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: In one instant, he will go to as many world systems in the eastern direction as there are inexpressibly inexpressible world systems,üîΩand likewise in the ten directions.

original: phyogs bcur yang de bzhin du sbyar nas 'jig rten gyi khams ji srid ma lus pa dag gi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la me tog thams cad dang / bkod pa thams cad kyis mchod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcur yang de bzhin du sbyar nas 'jig rten gyi khams ji srid ma lus pa dag gi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la me tog thams cad dang / bkod pa thams cad kyis mchod par bgyi'o //
translated: He will make offerings to the Tathagatas in all the world systems without exception with all flowers and all arrays.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gang 'chad pa dang / ston pa de thams cad 'tshal bar bgyi'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gang 'chad pa dang / ston pa de thams cad 'tshal bar bgyi'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: He will know all that the Blessed Buddhas teach and explain.

original: lhag ma rnams la ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: The rest of the Buddhas do not do this,

original: khyad par can gyi skal ba med pas na de lta bu nges par 'dzin par nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi skal ba med pas na de lta bu nges par 'dzin par nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the special good fortune, and because they are not able to apprehend it in that way.

original: yang na mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i tshig tha ma 'di dang dus gcig na zhes bya ba de dang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i tshig tha ma 'di dang dus gcig na zhes bya ba de dang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Or else, the phrase ‚Äúhe dwelt at Shravasti‚Äù should be connected with the phrase ‚Äúat one time‚Äù at the beginning.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because he has conquered the four demons,

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: or because he possesses the qualities of the lord, he is the Bhagavan.

original: bzhugs pa ni 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs pa ni 'dug pa'o //
translated: He abides means he stays.

original: yang na sna tshogs kyi gdul bya'i yid 'phrog cing 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sna tshogs kyi gdul bya'i yid 'phrog cing 'dzud pa'o //
translated: Or else, he is the one who attracts and engages the minds of various disciples.

original: gzhan gyi tshe na ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe na ni /
translated: At other times,

original: rgyal po'i khab dang / yangs pa can la sogs pa gzhan du bzhugs pa yod do ;
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab dang / yangs pa can la sogs pa gzhan du bzhugs pa yod do ;
translated: he abides in other places such as Rajgir and Vaishali.

original: / ci'i phyir gang gis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa 'di rang gi don lhur mdzad pa bzhin yul gcig la chags te bzhugs she na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir gang gis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa 'di rang gi don lhur mdzad pa bzhin yul gcig la chags te bzhugs she na /
translated: Why does he abide in one place as if he were devoted to his own purpose, when he is engaged in benefiting others?

original: yul de yang de'i phyir mchod par bya ba yin no zhes mdo sdud pas shugs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: yul de yang de'i phyir mchod par bya ba yin no zhes mdo sdud pas shugs kyis bstan to //
translated: The sutra's summary implicitly teaches that that place is also to be worshipped for that reason.

original: mnyan du yod pa de yangs phyogs mang du yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa de yangs phyogs mang du yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Since Shravasti is in a vast region,

original: rgyal po rgyal byed ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyal po rgyal byed ces bya ba smos te /
translated: it is called the city of the victorious king.

original: gzhon nu ma dang 'dres pa'i tshal gyi nang du mgon med zas sbyin khyim bdag gis nyos pa'i kun dga' ra ban ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma dang 'dres pa'i tshal gyi nang du mgon med zas sbyin khyim bdag gis nyos pa'i kun dga' ra ban ste /
translated: In the forest of the young women, Anathapindika the householder bought the pleasure grove.

original: yul gyi dbye ba la sogs pa mdo sdud pas de dag bstan pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul gyi dbye ba la sogs pa mdo sdud pas de dag bstan pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The Buddha taught these worldly distinctions in order to conform with the world.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams @90b rtsod par gyur na brda phrad par 'dod pa dag gis yul la sogs pa'i dbye ba brjod pas shags 'gyed pa rnams brda sprod par snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams @90b rtsod par gyur na brda phrad par 'dod pa dag gis yul la sogs pa'i dbye ba brjod pas shags 'gyed pa rnams brda sprod par snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For when worldly people argue, those who wish to communicate their meaning use expressions such as ‚Äúcountry‚Äù and ‚Äútown‚Äù to settle the dispute.üîΩHe was dwelling together with a great community of monks.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes bya ba 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs bar blta bar bya ba dang / yon tan gyi bdag nyid che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes bya ba 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs bar blta bar bya ba dang / yon tan gyi bdag nyid che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great community of monks is to be seen as having abandoned the afflictive obstructions and as having great excellence of good qualities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dge 'dun zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dge 'dun zhes bya ste /
translated: For that very reason it is called the community.

original: bdud la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba rnams kyis dbyer mi nus pa'i phyir dang / dgos pa gcig la gnas pa la brtan por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba rnams kyis dbyer mi nus pa'i phyir dang / dgos pa gcig la gnas pa la brtan por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cannot be divided by demons and other adversaries, and because they are firm in their single purpose.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams phyis bka' stsal /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams phyis bka' stsal /
translated: Why are the bodhisattvas, the great beings, mentioned last?

original: ji tsam du bu thu bor gyur pa de dag ni dang por smos pa'i rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam du bu thu bor gyur pa de dag ni dang por smos pa'i rigs so zhe na /
translated: It would be logical to mention first those who are the eldest sons.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni rtag pa'i phyir dang por bshad do gzhan dag ni dus thams cad du 'dug pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyis bstan te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni rtag pa'i phyir dang por bshad do gzhan dag ni dus thams cad du 'dug pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyis bstan te /
translated: The community of monks is mentioned first because it is permanent; the others are mentioned later because they are not always present.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni mdo sde zab mo rin po che dpag tu med pa nyan par byed pas na 'di ltar dge ba dag 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par gshegs kyi nyan thos bya ba byas pa dag ni de lta ma
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni mdo sde zab mo rin po che dpag tu med pa nyan par byed pas na 'di ltar dge ba dag 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par gshegs kyi nyan thos bya ba byas pa dag ni de lta ma
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas, who are good in that they go to innumerable world systems to hear the innumerable precious scriptures, are not like the disciples who have done what had to be done,

original: yin no // byang chub la bsam pa byas pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: yin no // byang chub la bsam pa byas pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is one who has the intention to attain enlightenment.

original: gzhan gyi don la bsam pa brtan pas de dag sems dpa' chen po yin bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la bsam pa brtan pas de dag sems dpa' chen po yin bar dgongs so //
translated: He thinks that they are great beings because they are firm in their intention to benefit others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang dang gzhan gyi don la go bgos pas go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang dang gzhan gyi don la go bgos pas go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bshad do //
translated: For this very reason, he explains that they are clad in great armor because they are armored for the benefit of self and other.

original: de dag gi theg pa 'chad pa'i phyir 'dus pa mang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi theg pa 'chad pa'i phyir 'dus pa mang ngo //
translated: The assembly is large because they are expounding the vehicle.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni phan pa dang bde ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ba la gzigs nas nyi ma 'char ba la yang ma bsdad par shin tu bzhed nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas su gshegs so //üîΩskya reng ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni phan pa dang bde ba mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ba la gzigs nas nyi ma 'char ba la yang ma bsdad par shin tu bzhed nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas su gshegs so // skya reng ni snang ba'o //
translated: Noble Manjusri, seeing that much benefit and well-being would arise, went to the Tathagata's abode, not staying even for the rising of the sun, because he was very eager.üîΩDawn is light.

original: de shar ba ni byung ba'o //
analyzed: de shar ba ni byung ba'o //
translated: Its rising is its appearance.

original: de nyid dus so //
analyzed: de nyid dus so //
translated: That itself is time.

original: ci'i phyir gang gis 'di da ltar tshe zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang gis 'di da ltar tshe zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called present by which it is present?

original: tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the domain of convention.

original: des na de ni tha snyad pa'i dus yin gyi gzegs zan pas btags pa'i dus rtag pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de ni tha snyad pa'i dus yin gyi gzegs zan pas btags pa'i dus rtag pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is the time of convention, but not the eternal time imagined by Kanada.

original: gcig gi ngo bo de ni snga dro la sogs pa'i dbye ba mi 'thad ba'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo de ni snga dro la sogs pa'i dbye ba mi 'thad ba'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
translated: because it is not tenable that the nature of one thing is divided into morning and so on.

original: rang gi gnas nas byung ste phyogs gang na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa nang du @91a * //
analyzed: rang gi gnas nas byung ste phyogs gang na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa nang du @91a * //
translated: Having arisen from his own abode, he went to the place where the palace of the BhagavƒÅn TathƒÅgata was, the place where the BhagavƒÅn TathƒÅgata was in the house of right meditative equipoise.

original: yang dag 'jog pa'i khang ba der song nas phyin pa dang / pho brang gi sgo'i phyi rol na 'dug go //
analyzed: yang dag 'jog pa'i khang ba der song nas phyin pa dang / pho brang gi sgo'i phyi rol na 'dug go //
translated: Having arrived, he remained outside the door of the palace.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rang gi gnas 'bras bur gyur pa nas langs te /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rang gi gnas 'bras bur gyur pa nas langs te /
translated: Or, the bodhisattva arose from his own abode, which is the fruition,

original: lam gang nas gshegs pa'i pho brang du phyin par 'gyur ba de nas song ba de ni lam der zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lam gang nas gshegs pa'i pho brang du phyin par 'gyur ba de nas song ba de ni lam der zhugs pa'o //
translated: and went to the palace by the path along which he would go.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i chos kyi sku'i pho brang gi sgo'i phyi rol na 'dug go zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang dang nye ba na 'dug pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i chos kyi sku'i pho brang gi sgo'i phyi rol na 'dug go zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang dang nye ba na 'dug pa bstan to //
translated: The palace of the Tathagata is the door of the palace of the Dharma Body endowed with all aspects.

original: blta ba dang zhes bya ba ni mig gis so //
analyzed: blta ba dang zhes bya ba ni mig gis so //
translated: To see means with the eye.

original: phyag bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rab tu 'dud pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: phyag bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rab tu 'dud pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: To bow means to bow with body, speech, and mind.

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba zhes bya ba ni rang gis bkur sti bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba zhes bya ba ni rang gis bkur sti bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To serve means to serve with one's own hands.

original: gzhan yang nyan thos chen po rnams zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos chen po rnams zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the great sravakas means the noble Sariputra and so on.

original: rang rang gi gnas nas byung ste /
analyzed: rang rang gi gnas nas byung ste /
translated: From their own abodes means from their own places.

original: phyogs gang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang yod pa der song ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang yod pa der song ba'o //
translated: To the place where the palace of the Tathagata is means to the place where the palace of the Tathagata is.

original: bya ba byas pa yin du zin kyang bka' drin gzo nas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba la sogs pa'i don du son te /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyi gnas kyi phyi rol phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa yin du zin kyang bka' drin gzo nas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba la sogs pa'i don du son te / bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas kyi phyi rol phyogs gcig ste /
translated: Even though they have performed their duties, they have come to the Blessed One in order to see him, etc.,üîΩin one place outside the dwelling of the Blessed One.

original: sa phyogs gcig tu gnas so //
analyzed: sa phyogs gcig tu gnas so //
translated: They stand in one place outside the dwelling of the Blessed One.

original: yang na nang gi gnas kyi phyogs su yang rang gi khyad par ji lta ba dag las langs nas gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa thabs su gyur te /
analyzed: yang na nang gi gnas kyi phyogs su yang rang gi khyad par ji lta ba dag las langs nas gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa thabs su gyur te /
translated: Or else, they rise up from their own particular places in the inner court, and the means for realizing the selflessness of the person is

original: rjes su mthun pa'i thabs gang gis bdag med pa gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas mngon du byed pa'i thabs de mngon du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i thabs gang gis bdag med pa gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas mngon du byed pa'i thabs de mngon du byed pa yin no //
translated: the means by which they realize the state of the TathƒÅgata, which is the characteristic of the two kinds of selflessness.

original: mngon du gyur nas bdag med pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas kyi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: mngon du gyur nas bdag med pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas kyi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: Having realized it, they stand in one place in the state of the TathƒÅgata, which is the essence of the two kinds of selflessness,

original: gang zag la bdag med pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir 'di la 'khod do //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir 'di la 'khod do //
translated: because they have realized the selflessness of the person.

original: de ltar 'dug pa de yang de dag bdag med pa gnyis ston pa'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa'i 'os su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dug pa de yang de dag bdag med pa gnyis ston pa'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa'i 'os su gyur pa yin no //
translated: And they are worthy to hear the perfection of wisdom, which is the essence of the teaching of the two kinds of selflessness.

original: 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs ni thugs byang chub la gzhol ba yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang gi nang du gshegs par dgongs par rigs na /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs ni thugs byang chub la gzhol ba yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang gi nang du gshegs par dgongs par rigs na /
translated: It is reasonable that the noble Manjusri, whose mind is devoted to enlightenment, should think of entering the Tathagata's palace,

original: nyan thos chen po dag go ci zhes dgongs te gshegs de dag gis byang chub chen po nam yang thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: nyan thos chen po dag go ci zhes dgongs te gshegs de dag gis byang chub chen po nam yang thob par mi nus te /
translated: but why should the great disciples? They will never be able to attain great enlightenment,

original: nyon mongs pa'i @91b shing bsregs pa nyid kyis 'khor ba gcig nas gcig tu byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i @91b shing bsregs pa nyid kyis 'khor ba gcig nas gcig tu byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the wood of their defilements has been burned up, and without completing the accumulations for enlightenment in one cyclic existence after another, they cannot attain it.

original: de dag la sa bon med cing byang chub chen po la 'bad pa log pa yin du zin kyang de'i tshe chos zab mo mnyan pa la gus pas 'ongs pas na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de dag la sa bon med cing byang chub chen po la 'bad pa log pa yin du zin kyang de'i tshe chos zab mo mnyan pa la gus pas 'ongs pas na nyes pa med do //
translated: Even though they have no seed of it and have given up striving for great enlightenment, they have no fault, because they came out of respect for the profound Dharma.

original: gzhan dag sems pa ni de dag ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsgyur ba can yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag sems pa ni de dag ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsgyur ba can yin te /
translated: Others think that they are transformed into great enlightenment,

original: de thos par bya ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de thos par bya ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis 'ong ba yin no //
translated: because they have the intention to hear it.

original: nyon mongs pa bsregs su zin kyang de dag 'gro ba de dang der skye ba len pa 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bsregs su zin kyang de dag 'gro ba de dang der skye ba len pa 'gal ba med de /
translated: Even though their afflictions are burned up, it is not contradictory that they take birth in this and that realm.

original: 'di ltar lung las shi ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par sems mnyam par bzhag bzhin du pad mo la sogs pa'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar lung las shi ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par sems mnyam par bzhag bzhin du pad mo la sogs pa'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is said in the scriptures that immediately after death, they are born in a pure buddha-land, in the womb of a lotus, and so on, while remaining in meditative equipoise.

original: de ltar na de dag la sangs rgyas kyi 'od zer gyis bskul te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag la sangs rgyas kyi 'od zer gyis bskul te /
translated: Thus, they are urged by the light rays of the Buddha,

original: rim gyis dbang po so sor thob nas gang dang gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba de dang der skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis dbang po so sor thob nas gang dang gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba de dang der skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and gradually they attain the individual vehicles, and they are born wherever they see the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de bas na theg pa gcig pa'i tshul gyi rjes su 'brang zhing 'chad pa rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa gcig pa'i tshul gyi rjes su 'brang zhing 'chad pa rigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is reasonable to follow and explain the way of the One Vehicle.

original: de ltar byas na theg pa ni gcig ste gnyis su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa dam pa'i chos pad ma dkar po la sogs pa las gsungs pa dang shin tu mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na theg pa ni gcig ste gnyis su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa dam pa'i chos pad ma dkar po la sogs pa las gsungs pa dang shin tu mthun pa yin no //
translated: that there is only one vehicle, not two.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa yin du zin kyang rim pa de dag gis byang chub chen por yongs su bsgyur ba yin gyi rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa la 'jug pas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa yin du zin kyang rim pa de dag gis byang chub chen por yongs su bsgyur ba yin gyi rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa la 'jug pas ni ma yin la /
translated: Even though there are different lineages of sravakas, etc., they are transformed into the great enlightenment by those stages, but not by entering the stages of joy, etc.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gal ba med do //
translated: And there is no contradiction in saying that one has the lineage of a sravaka, etc.

original: de dag kyang skya reng shar ba'i dus kyi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi pho brang du 'khod par phan tshun dus byas pa yin par mngon no //
analyzed: de dag kyang skya reng shar ba'i dus kyi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi pho brang du 'khod par phan tshun dus byas pa yin par mngon no //
translated: And it is evident that they all assembled in the palace of the Lord at the time of dawn and passed away.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos par 'os pa'i 'khor 'dus pa la gzigs nas gzhan la phan par mdzad pa la gcig tu mkhas pa dag rang gi gnas ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas bzang po dag nas byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos par 'os pa'i 'khor 'dus pa la gzigs nas gzhan la phan par mdzad pa la gcig tu mkhas pa dag rang gi gnas ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas bzang po dag nas byung ngo //
translated: The Lord, seeing that the assembly was ready to hear the perfection of wisdom, came out from his excellent dwelling of concentration, in order to benefit others, being skilled in that.

original: 'di yang ngo bo de lta bu la zhen pa'i gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams kyi bsam pa'i ngor byas te bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang ngo bo de lta bu la zhen pa'i gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams kyi bsam pa'i ngor byas te bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: This is taught in terms of the thoughts of beings to be trained who are attached to such an essence.

original: ston pa ni dus thams cad du mnyam par bzhag pa dang ldan pa yin pas bzhengs pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni dus thams cad du mnyam par bzhag pa dang ldan pa yin pas bzhengs pa mi mnga'o //
translated: But the Teacher is always endowed with meditative equipoise, so he does not arise.

original: de la 'ongs shing zhes bya ba ni nang gi gnas su 'jug pa'i thabs su'o //
analyzed: de la 'ongs shing zhes bya ba ni nang gi gnas su 'jug pa'i thabs su'o //
translated: There means in the inner dwelling, and came is the means of entering.

original: lhags te zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gnas kyi phyogs gcig tu'o//
analyzed: lhags te zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gnas kyi phyogs gcig tu'o//
translated: Having come means in the outer dwelling, in one place.

original: @92a * // nyan thos chen po 'dus par zhes bya ba 'dir nyan thos smos pa ni mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: @92a * // nyan thos chen po 'dus par zhes bya ba 'dir nyan thos smos pa ni mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The great hearers assembled here, the mention of hearers is an illustration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattvas also assembled there.

original: yang na gang dag nyan pa de dag kyang 'dir nyan thos yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang dag nyan pa de dag kyang 'dir nyan thos yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Or else, those who listen to it are also considered to be ≈õrƒÅvakas here.

original: 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nga rgyal bcom pas mgu bar bya mi dgos par bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen gyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nga rgyal bcom pas mgu bar bya mi dgos par bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen gyi /
translated: The Blessed One knew that the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, having destroyed non-afflictive pride, did not need to be gladdened.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nga rgyal yod pas mgu bar bya dgos so snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nga rgyal yod pas mgu bar bya dgos so snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: But he thought that the noble ≈öƒÅriputra, having non-afflictive pride, did need to be gladdened.

original: sh'a ri'i bu khyod ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas thog mar dris so //üîΩci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs sam /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu khyod ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas thog mar dris so // ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs sam /
translated: Therefore, he first asked, Why is it, ≈öƒÅriputra? and so on.

original: yul gang nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yul gang nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why means for what reason or from what place.

original: 'di ltar rgyu med par ni khyed cag 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba yid du 'ong ba spangs nas rings pa nyid du dus ma yin par 'ong bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu med par ni khyed cag 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba yid du 'ong ba spangs nas rings pa nyid du dus ma yin par 'ong bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, he thought, It is not reasonable for you to abandon the pleasant bliss of such a samƒÅdhi as this and come so quickly and at an inappropriate time without a reason.

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang bdag dang por mchis pa ma lags kyi /üîΩ'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di nyid dang por rings par mchis pa lags so zhes snga ma'i tshul brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang bdag dang por mchis pa ma lags kyi / 'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di nyid dang por rings par mchis pa lags so zhes snga ma'i tshul brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: The Venerable Sariputra also said, I did not come first.üîΩThis Manjusri came first.

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi thog ma nyid du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi thog ma nyid du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: In order to explain the former way, the Lord said, Manjusri, the youth, was the first of all to come to the Tathagata's abode.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang gi sgo gnyis yang 'jug pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang gi sgo gnyis yang 'jug pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: The two doors of the Tathagata's abode are also the means of entry.

original: 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Manjusri, you have come to see the Tathagata.

original: sgor 'dug pa bden nam zhes bya ba'i bar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal dbyangs la 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: sgor 'dug pa bden nam zhes bya ba'i bar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal dbyangs la 'dri ba'o //
translated: Up to Is it true that you are standing at the door? is the Blessed One's question to Manjushri.

original: bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jam dpal gyis kyang 'ongs pa'i dgos pa brjod pa'i phyir smras pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jam dpal gyis kyang 'ongs pa'i dgos pa brjod pa'i phyir smras pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, it is so and so on, Manjushri also said in order to explain the purpose of coming.

original: lan gnyis smos pa ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir ram dga' ba'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis smos pa ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir ram dga' ba'o //
translated: The repetition is for the sake of emphasis or delight.

original: blta ba la sogs pa ni 'ong ba'i rgyu yin par rigs kyi /
analyzed: blta ba la sogs pa ni 'ong ba'i rgyu yin par rigs kyi /
translated: It is proper that seeing, etc. are the causes of coming,

original: chos kyi de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa ni ma yin par mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa ni ma yin par mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: but it is not proper that the ascertainment of the reality of things is not.

original: blta ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i sgo nyid nas de srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blta ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i sgo nyid nas de srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is possible by means of the very explanation of seeing, etc.

original: de ltar yang de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: de ltar yang de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: And thus, it will be explained below that ‚Äúthe Tathagata should be seen in terms of suchness, etc.‚ÄùüîΩIf the stores are complete, what need is there for seeing, etc.?

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa yin na blta ba la sogs pa bya ci dgos @92b she na zhes bya ba ni de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dri ba'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa yin na blta ba la sogs pa bya ci dgos @92b she na zhes bya ba ni de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dri ba'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: This is the thought behind the question, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar bdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar bdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavan, it is because I am not satisfied with seeing, etc.‚Äù

original: ma ngoms pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba'i bar du lan yin no //
analyzed: ma ngoms pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba'i bar du lan yin no //
translated: is the answer.

original: ma ngoms pa yang de'i yon tan 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ngoms pa yang de'i yon tan 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and also because of the desire for the virtues of the Tathagata.

original: blta ba la sogs pa la 'chel na sems can gyi don nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: blta ba la sogs pa la 'chel na sems can gyi don nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: Thinking, If one is attached to seeing and so forth, is it not the case that the welfare of sentient beings is neglected?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar bdag de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang zhes bya ba nas sems can thams cad kyi don gyi slad du ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar bdag de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang zhes bya ba nas sems can thams cad kyi don gyi slad du ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the Lord said, Thus, O Lord, I wish to see the Tathagata...for the sake of the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: ci gzhan dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar 'dod pa kun kyang sems can la phan pa byed 'dod nas de dag kyang khyod kho na ltar blta ba la sogs pa byed dam /
analyzed: ci gzhan dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar 'dod pa kun kyang sems can la phan pa byed 'dod nas de dag kyang khyod kho na ltar blta ba la sogs pa byed dam /
translated: If others also wish to fully awaken to unexcelled, perfect enlightenment, then, desiring to benefit sentient beings, do they also see and so forth like you alone?

original: 'on te gzhan du yin zhes de ltar dogs pa la blta ba la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan du drang thad thabs nyid yin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du yin zhes de ltar dogs pa la blta ba la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan du drang thad thabs nyid yin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Or is it otherwise? In order to dispel such doubts, in order to show that seeing and so forth are not otherwise, he said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Lord said, If, Subhuti, you see anything...

original: gal te rigs kyi bu myur du sangs rgyas nyid thob par brtson pa'i blo can 'jig rten la phan pa byed 'dod pa kha cig gis de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bya na 'di ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rigs kyi bu myur du sangs rgyas nyid thob par brtson pa'i blo can 'jig rten la phan pa byed 'dod pa kha cig gis de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bya na 'di ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: If some son or daughter of good family, who is endowed with a striving mind, who desires to benefit the world, and who is intent on quickly attaining Buddhahood, should wish to see the Tathagata, he should see him in this way.

original: de ltar ji ltar bya zhe na ji ltar bdag gis mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar bya zhe na ji ltar bdag gis mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: How should he see him? He should see him as I have seen him, etc.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar blta zhe na /
translated: Why should he see him in this way?

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because, etc.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúhi‚Äù.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba 'di nyid yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba 'di nyid yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this right view itself leads to all the perfections of virtue.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs kyi don mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs kyi don mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, etc. is the conclusion of the section.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúhi‚Äù.

original: gzhan dag ni go rims bsnor te bdag dang sems can thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi don du'o zhes bsdu ba'i don yin no zhes kyang 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni go rims bsnor te bdag dang sems can thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi don du'o zhes bsdu ba'i don yin no zhes kyang 'chad do //
translated: Others, however, reverse the order, and explain the meaning of the summary as follows: ‚ÄúFor the sake of the gnosis of omniscience, both myself and all sentient beings.‚ÄùüîΩHow do you see the Tathagata?

original: khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar mthong zhe na /üîΩde bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa dang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar mthong zhe na / de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa dang zhes gsungs te /
translated: In the aspect of suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos po ni de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos po ni de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: The reality of the Tathagata should be understood as suchness, emptiness.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du bcom ldan 'das @93a * //üîΩblta bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du bcom ldan 'das @93a * // blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The Blessed One should be seen as the nature of nondual gnosis.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na brtags pas dben pa ni gnyis kyis dben pa'i ye shes las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na brtags pas dben pa ni gnyis kyis dben pa'i ye shes las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because the emptiness of the imagined, which is the emptiness of the duality of subject and object, is not different from the emptiness of the dependent and the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: dper na bum pas dben pa ni bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du gnyis kyis dben pa'i ye shes las kyang gnyis kyis dben pa gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pas dben pa ni bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du gnyis kyis dben pa'i ye shes las kyang gnyis kyis dben pa gzhan ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the emptiness that is empty of duality is not different from the wisdom that is empty of duality.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa mthong na de'i tshe khyod ni 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzung ba yin pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa mthong na de'i tshe khyod ni 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzung ba yin pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If you see the TathƒÅgata, then at that time, since you are the grasper, and since the TathƒÅgata is the grasped, because the grasped and grasper exist, would you not contradict emptiness?

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa dang mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni phan tshun nang 'gal bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa dang mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni phan tshun nang 'gal bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: And it would also be mutually contradictory to say, ‚ÄúI see the aspect of suchness.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa ni gnyis las dben pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa ni gnyis las dben pa yin la /
translated: The aspect of suchness is empty of duality.

original: mthong ba ni myong bar byed pa yod na skye ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ni myong bar byed pa yod na skye ba yin no //
translated: And seeing arises when there is experience.

original: de bas na 'di ni nga'i ma mo gshom yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig de dang mtshungs par smras pa yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni nga'i ma mo gshom yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig de dang mtshungs par smras pa yin no zhe na ;
translated: Therefore, this is like the statement, ‚ÄúThis is my barren woman‚Äôs son.‚Äù

original: de la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase in a manner of non-apprehension is stated.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa spros pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ma lus par spangs pa'i sems skye ba'i phyir dang / chos mnyam pa nyid rang rig pa mngon sum du byed pa nyid na brtags pa'i dra ba mtha' dag mi dmigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa spros pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ma lus par spangs pa'i sems skye ba'i phyir dang / chos mnyam pa nyid rang rig pa mngon sum du byed pa nyid na brtags pa'i dra ba mtha' dag mi dmigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: The intention here is that because the mind arises free from all the characteristics of the manifest clinging to the elaborations of grasping, etc., and because it is the direct perception of the self-awareness of the sameness of phenomena, the non-apprehension of all the nets of conceptual thought is the seeing of the Tathagata.üîΩAs it is said,üîΩNot seeing anything is seeing reality.

original: ji skad du ci yang ma mthong ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji skad du ci yang ma mthong ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: chos nyid du ni sangs rgyas blta //
analyzed: chos nyid du ni sangs rgyas blta //
translated: The Buddha is to be seen as reality.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo las ma 'das pa ma skyes pa dang / thog ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dngos po med pa zhes 'byung ba thams cad kyang rnam pa'i bar du zhes bya bas bsdus te bstan to //üîΩde bzhin du mi skye ba'i rnam par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don tha dad pa ma yin du zin yang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo las ma 'das pa ma skyes pa dang / thog ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dngos po med pa zhes 'byung ba thams cad kyang rnam pa'i bar du zhes bya bas bsdus te bstan to // de bzhin du mi skye ba'i rnam par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don tha dad pa ma yin du zin yang /
translated: The expressions unborn, peaceful from the beginning, naturally in a state of nirvƒÅ·πáa, and nonexistent that occur in the statement ...in the same way, the reality of all phenomena is unborn... are included in the phrase ...in the same way, the reality of all phenomena is... and are taught.

original: la la las kha cig grags pa yin pas ji ltar rigs par chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos nyid mnyam pa'i tshig gis phye ste bstan to //
analyzed: la la las kha cig grags pa yin pas ji ltar rigs par chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos nyid mnyam pa'i tshig gis phye ste bstan to //
translated: In the same way, the expressions unborn, etc., are not different in meaning, but are taught by means of the words equality of reality in order to introduce the dharma-dhƒÅtu in whatever way is appropriate, since they are well known to some, but not to others.

original: der yang kun brtags kyi ngo bos stong pa yin no //
analyzed: der yang kun brtags kyi ngo bos stong pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the reality of all phenomena is empty of the imagined nature.

original: ji skad du /üîΩbrtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: As it is said:üîΩAll phenomena are unborn

original: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa //üîΩgzhan gyi dbang la brten nas @93b ni ;
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa // gzhan gyi dbang la brten nas @93b ni ;
translated: By virtue of the imagined nature.

original: / mi rnams kyi ni rnam rtog skye //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / mi rnams kyi ni rnam rtog skye //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: The conceptual thoughts of people ariseüîΩIn dependence on the relative nature.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la'ang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la'ang sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to other things.

original: gzhan dag 'chad pa 'bras bu skye na rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i rgyu las sam /üîΩgzhan du gyur pa las sam /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'chad pa 'bras bu skye na rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i rgyu las sam / gzhan du gyur pa las sam /
translated: Others explain that if an effect arises, does it arise from a cause that is the same as itself?üîΩOr is it different from it?

original: gnyi ga las sam /
analyzed: gnyi ga las sam /
translated: Or both?

original: rgyu'i byed pa la mi ltos par skye grang /
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa la mi ltos par skye grang /
translated: Or does it arise without depending on the activity of a cause?üîΩOr does a single cause give rise to a single effect?üîΩOr does a single cause give rise to many effects?üîΩOr do many causes give rise to a single effect?üîΩOr do many causes give rise to many effects?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is existent, nonexistent, both, or neither?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is permanent or impermanent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent?

original: yod pa'am med pa'am gnyi ga'i ngo bo 'am rgyu yang du mas 'bras bu gcig gi ngo bo skyed par byed dam gang yang du ma'i ngo bo skyed par byed grang /
analyzed: yod pa'am med pa'am gnyi ga'i ngo bo 'am rgyu yang du mas 'bras bu gcig gi ngo bo skyed par byed dam gang yang du ma'i ngo bo skyed par byed grang /
translated: Or does an effect arise from a cause that is the same as itself?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is different from itself?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is both the same as and different from itself?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is neither the same as nor different from itself?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is permanent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is impermanent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is existent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is nonexistent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is both existent and nonexistent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is neither existent nor nonexistent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is the same as itself?

original: yang na gcig gis gcig gi ngo bo 'am //üîΩyang na du ma'i ngo bos bskyed grang /üîΩyang rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu skye'am /
analyzed: yang na gcig gis gcig gi ngo bo 'am // yang na du ma'i ngo bos bskyed grang / yang rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu skye'am /
translated: Or does an effect arise from a cause that is different from itself?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is both the same as and different from itself?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is neither the same as nor different from itself?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is permanent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is impermanent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent?üîΩOr does an effect arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent?

original: ma zhig pa las skye grang /üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i phyogs ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang gzhan dag gi phyogs la rjes su chags pas byas pa ni rtog pa'i snying po tsam yin par mngon no //
analyzed: ma zhig pa las skye grang /üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i phyogs ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang gzhan dag gi phyogs la rjes su chags pas byas pa ni rtog pa'i snying po tsam yin par mngon no //
translated: Or does an effect arise from a cause that is existent?üîΩOr does

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo 'bras bu yin na rgyu bzhin du skyes zin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo 'bras bu yin na rgyu bzhin du skyes zin pa nyid yin no //
translated: If the essence of the cause is the effect, then like the cause, it would already have arisen.

original: de bas na de las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it does not arise from itself,

original: skyes zin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: because it already exists, like the essence of the cause.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa la yang dngos po la ltos te brjod na 'dir gnyis pa dngos po yin na go 'bras bu de ni rgyu yod pa'i dus na med la /
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa la yang dngos po la ltos te brjod na 'dir gnyis pa dngos po yin na go 'bras bu de ni rgyu yod pa'i dus na med la /
translated: If you assert that the effect arises from something other than the cause, then if you speak in terms of an entity, the second alternative is an entity. But if the effect does not exist at the time when the cause exists,

original: de yod pa'i tshe ni rgyu yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de yod pa'i tshe ni rgyu yod pa ma yin na /
translated: and if the cause does not exist at the time when the effect exists,

original: de gang la ltos te de gnyis gzhan nyid yin par don dam pas khas blang bar bya /
analyzed: de gang la ltos te de gnyis gzhan nyid yin par don dam pas khas blang bar bya /
translated: in dependence on what would the two be different?

original: yang rgyur mngon par 'dod pa ni 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang rgyur mngon par 'dod pa ni 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is asserted to be a cause does not give rise to that which is asserted to be an effect,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
translated: because they are different, like any other entity.

original: gnyi ga'i phyogs las skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i phyogs las skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical that the effect arises from both itself and something other than itself.

original: phyogs gnyi gar brjod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar brjod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error that is expressed in both ways would follow.

original: gzhan yang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas gcig tu gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas gcig tu gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the two natures of difference and non-difference are characterized by mutual exclusion, and so it is impossible for them to exist in one thing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga'i dngos po'i phyogs rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga'i dngos po'i phyogs rung ba ma yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the position of both natures is not tenable.

original: ma brtags pa'i dngos po yin na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i dngos po yin na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: If it were an unexamined entity, the conceptualization of difference and non-difference would not occur.

original: gang yin pa de 'di ma yin te zhes byas na ngo bo nyid bsal ba de nyid rnam par log pa yin na de bkag pa nyid rnam par ma log pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam pa gzhan dag ga la yod par 'gyur /üîΩrgyu med pa las @94a * //
analyzed: gang yin pa de 'di ma yin te zhes byas na ngo bo nyid bsal ba de nyid rnam par log pa yin na de bkag pa nyid rnam par ma log pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam pa gzhan dag ga la yod par 'gyur / rgyu med pa las @94a * //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThat which is, is not this,‚Äù the very exclusion of its nature is its negation, so how could there be any other words?

original: kyang skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kyang skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it logical that it arises causelessly.

original: rtag tu yod pa dang med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa dang med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would always exist or not exist.

original: yod pa yang skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang skye ba ma yin te /
translated: An existent does not arise,

original: dngos po grub zin pa la skye ba'i don mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus phyi ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po grub zin pa la skye ba'i don mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus phyi ma bzhin no //
translated: because it is not tenable that an already established thing arises, like a later time.

original: gzhan yang gal te yod pa skye bar 'gyur na ni skyes zin pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te yod pa skye bar 'gyur na ni skyes zin pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if an existent were to arise, then what has already arisen would arise.

original: med pa yang skye bar rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang skye bar rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable that a nonexistent arises,

original: ngo bo nyid med pas ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pas ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, being devoid of intrinsic reality, it is untenable that it arises, like the horn of an ass.

original: de lta ma yin na med pa thams cad dngos po gang yang rung ba 'ga' las skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bur nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na med pa thams cad dngos po gang yang rung ba 'ga' las skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bur nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then it would follow that all nonexistents would arise from any existent whatsoever, and thus there would be no certainty of cause and effect.

original: nus pa so sor nges pa yod pas de ltar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nus pa so sor nges pa yod pas de ltar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not so, because there is a specific determination of potency.

original: 'di ltar de dang de la nus pa nges pa yod pa'i dngos po de las dngos po 'ga' kho na skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang de la nus pa nges pa yod pa'i dngos po de las dngos po 'ga' kho na skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus, if you think that a certain thing is produced from a certain thing because of the restriction of its potentiality,

original: med pa yin par khyad par med du zin kyang thams cad ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: med pa yin par khyad par med du zin kyang thams cad ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: and that it is not produced from all things, because of the absence of such a restriction,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then that is not logical.

original: gal te rkyen rnams 'bras bu dang ma 'brel ba'i lus can yin na /
analyzed: gal te rkyen rnams 'bras bu dang ma 'brel ba'i lus can yin na /
translated: If conditions are not related to their effects,

original: de'i tshe de dag 'bras bu dang so sor 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu gang la nus pa so sor nges pa yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag 'bras bu dang so sor 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu gang la nus pa so sor nges pa yod /
translated: then, because they are not related to their effects, how can they be restricted to specific effects?

original: de bas na nus pa so sor nges pa med par gnas pa yin pas thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: de bas na nus pa so sor nges pa med par gnas pa yin pas thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka'o //
translated: Therefore, since they are not restricted to specific effects, it is difficult to avoid the consequence that everything would be produced from everything.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la bstan pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang skye bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la bstan pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang skye bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: And because of the consequence of the faults that have been demonstrated in the positions of existence and nonexistence, it is not tenable that something arises from both itself and another.

original: gcig la gnyis kyi ngo bo yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la gnyis kyi ngo bo yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that something that exists as one thing is two things.

original: gnyis dang gcig gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis dang gcig gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because two and one are mutually exclusive.

original: rgyu dang pos kyang 'bras bu gcig gi ngo bo gang yin pa skyed par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang pos kyang 'bras bu gcig gi ngo bo gang yin pa skyed par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the first cause generates the entity of a single effect,

original: de lta na ni rgyu rang gi ngo bo lhan cig byed pa du mas kyang 'bras bu gcig skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rgyu rang gi ngo bo lhan cig byed pa du mas kyang 'bras bu gcig skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: then in that case, the cause itself does not generate a single effect through many cooperating causes,

original: rgyu tha dad pas tha dad par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pas tha dad par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect would be different due to the difference of the causes.

original: de ltar na tha dad pa ma yin pa yang tha dad pa ma yin pa byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na tha dad pa ma yin pa yang tha dad pa ma yin pa byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, that which is not different would not make that which is not different,

original: rgyu tha dad pa yin du zin kyang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa yin du zin kyang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if the causes are different, they would not be different.

original: gal te tha dad pa las kyang tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa las kyang tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If that which is different becomes different from that which is different,

original: tha dad pa med pa las kyang tha dad pa med pa yin na rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa las kyang tha dad pa med pa yin na rigs pa yin te /
translated: and that which is not different becomes not different from that which is not different, then that is logical,

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no error.

original: 'dir ni de lta ma yin pas tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa mtha' dag rgyu med pa can du 'gyur @94b ro ;
analyzed: 'dir ni de lta ma yin pas tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa mtha' dag rgyu med pa can du 'gyur @94b ro ;
translated: But that is not the case here, therefore all that is different and not different would be without a cause.

original: / dngos po 'ga' yang de las gud na med pas dngos po thams cad gzhan gyi dbang las skye ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / dngos po 'ga' yang de las gud na med pas dngos po thams cad gzhan gyi dbang las skye ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no entity apart from that, it follows that no entity arises from another.

original: gal te 'di snyam du rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa las 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa skye ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa las 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa skye ba yin te /
translated: If you think that the nature of the effect arises from the difference in the nature of the cause,

original: rgyu'i byed pas byas pa'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ma 'chol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pas byas pa'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ma 'chol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then the nature of the effect is not confused with the nature of the cause, since the effect is produced by the activity of the cause.

original: 'di ltar yid la byed pa las ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid la byed pa las ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Thus, from mental activity, the nature of the realization of visual consciousness arises.

original: dmigs pa'i bdag nyid de nyid mig gi dbang po las ni yul 'dzin pas so sor nges pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bdag nyid de nyid mig gi dbang po las ni yul 'dzin pas so sor nges pa'o //
translated: From the eye faculty, it arises as the nature of the object‚Äôs appearance, since it apprehends the object.

original: yul las ni de dang 'dra ba yin gyi gzhan las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul las ni de dang 'dra ba yin gyi gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: From the object, it arises as the same, but not from anything else.

original: rgyu'i byed pa bye brag sna tshogs yod du zin kyang 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa bye brag sna tshogs yod du zin kyang 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Even though the activity of the cause is various, the distinction in the nature of the effect is not different.

original: gcig gi ngo bo de ltar dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo de ltar dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the nature of one is observed in that way.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical,

original: 'bras bu gcig gi ngo bo dang bye brag rnams de dang tha mi dad par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig gi ngo bo dang bye brag rnams de dang tha mi dad par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: because how could the nature and the particulars of one effect be undifferentiated from it?

original: de lta yin na ni sna tshogs su yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni sna tshogs su yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would not be diverse.

original: sna tshogs dang gcig gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs dang gcig gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because diversity and singularity are mutually exclusive.

original: yul snang ba la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin par ji ltar yul la sogs pas byed pa de bzhin du de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo la sogs par byed pa yid la byed pa la
analyzed: yul snang ba la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin par ji ltar yul la sogs pas byed pa de bzhin du de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo la sogs par byed pa yid la byed pa la
translated: Just as objects such as appearance are not different from consciousness, in the same way, that which is not different from it is engaged by the nature of realization, etc., and is engaged by mental attention, etc.

original: sogs pas kyang byed pas de ltar na 'chol bar 'gyur ba la lan ma btab pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pas kyang byed pas de ltar na 'chol bar 'gyur ba la lan ma btab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the objection that it is a jumbled mess is not answered.

original: 'on te skyon der mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir bye brag rnams 'bras bu las tha dad pa nyid du 'dod na ni de lta na yang rgyu'i byed pa de dag nyid la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te skyon der mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir bye brag rnams 'bras bu las tha dad pa nyid du 'dod na ni de lta na yang rgyu'i byed pa de dag nyid la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you assert that the particulars are different from the effect in order to avoid that error, then in that case, because the activity of the cause is applied to those very particulars, the effect would be without a cause.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du ma las rnam par log pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu dang rjes su mthun par chos tha dad par rtog pas bzhag nas de'i byed pa'i yul tha dad par rtog pas 'jog par byed do zhe na /üîΩyang 'jog la rag ste /üîΩrgyu'i byed pa de ni rtog pa'i bzos byas pa la byed pas rtog pas bzhag pa yin gyi yang dag par ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta na yang 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /üîΩrgyu'i byed pa brtags pa'i bdag nyid la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du ma las rnam par log pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu dang rjes su mthun par chos tha dad par rtog pas bzhag nas de'i byed pa'i yul tha dad par rtog pas 'jog par byed do zhe na /üîΩyang 'jog la rag ste /üîΩrgyu'i byed pa de ni rtog pa'i bzos byas pa la byed pas rtog pas bzhag pa yin gyi yang dag par ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta na yang 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /üîΩrgyu'i byed pa brtags pa'i bdag nyid la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //

object than the cause, and you posit the activity of the cause as having a different object than the cause, and you posit the activity of the cause as

original: ci ste 'bras bu dngos su tha dad pa ma yin yang bye brag rnams tha dad na /üîΩde lta na ni chos can dang @95a * //
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu dngos su tha dad pa ma yin yang bye brag rnams tha dad na / de lta na ni chos can dang @95a * //
translated: But if the effect is not actually different, and the particulars are different,

original: chos can dngos su tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos can dngos su tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: then the substratum and the attribute would be actually different.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they would exist with a nature that is both different and not different.

original: de lta na yang sngar smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang sngar smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case, the previously mentioned error would occur.

original: 'on te bye brag de dag brtags pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'on te bye brag de dag brtags pa kho na yin na /
translated: But if those particulars are only imagined,

original: de lta na yang rgyu rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa las bye brag tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa las bye brag tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is not reasonable to say that the particulars are different because the cause is different,

original: rtog pas byas pa'i tha dad pa ni rgyu'i byed pa la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pas byas pa'i tha dad pa ni rgyu'i byed pa la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference that is created by imagination does not depend on the activity of a cause.

original: gal te rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo gcig gis 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo gcig skyed par byed do zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo gcig gis 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo gcig skyed par byed do zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that a single cause generates a single effect,

original: de lta na yang long ba dang 'on pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang long ba dang 'on pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that the blind and the deaf, etc.,

original: mig la sogs pas rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma phyi ma nyid skyed pa yin na ni rnam par shes pa skyed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma phyi ma nyid skyed pa yin na ni rnam par shes pa skyed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the eye and so on generates only the subsequent moment of its own type, it is not tenable that it generates consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skyed par byed na yang rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma phyi ma mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed par byed na yang rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma phyi ma mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it generates consciousness, it does not link with the subsequent moment of its own type.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu du ma byed par smras pa yang tshad ma thams cad dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu du ma byed par smras pa yang tshad ma thams cad dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The assertion that a single cause such as ƒ™≈õvara generates many effects contradicts all valid knowledge,

original: tshogs pa dang rim gyis 'bras bu skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang rim gyis 'bras bu skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is evident that effects arise from a collection and in sequence.

original: gal te 'bras bu yang rgyu zhig pa las skye na ni de'i tshe rgyu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu yang rgyu zhig pa las skye na ni de'i tshe rgyu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If an effect arises from the disintegration of its cause, then it follows that it would arise from what is not its cause,

original: zhig pa ni rgyu nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig pa ni rgyu nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for disintegration to be a cause.

original: 'on te ma zhig pa las skye na ni de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus mnyam par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te ma zhig pa las skye na ni de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus mnyam par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it arises from what has not disintegrated, then in that case it follows that cause and effect would be simultaneous.

original: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon rgyu dang 'bras bur mi 'thad pa bzhin du de yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon rgyu dang 'bras bur mi 'thad pa bzhin du de yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is untenable that the right and left horns of an ox are cause and effect, and you do not assert that.

original: 'on te phyis 'bras bu skyes pa dang dus mnyam pa de nyid du 'dod pas dus gcig pa mi 'gal lo zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te phyis 'bras bu skyes pa dang dus mnyam pa de nyid du 'dod pas dus gcig pa mi 'gal lo zhes zer na /
translated: But if you say that it is not contradictory for them to be simultaneous because you assert that the effect arises at the very time when the cause ceases,

original: de lta na yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur bar 'bras bu skye ba shin tu rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur bar 'bras bu skye ba shin tu rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is utterly illogical for the effect to arise because it would contradict the statement that it disintegrates immediately after it arises.

original: 'on te rgyu 'jig pa'i tshe 'bras bu skyes pas 'di la nyes pa med do zhes lan 'debs par byed na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu 'jig pa'i tshe 'bras bu skyes pas 'di la nyes pa med do zhes lan 'debs par byed na /
