translated: But if you reply that this fault does not arise because the effect arises when the cause ceases,

original: de la yang brjod par bya ste rgyu 'jig pa 'di gang yin /
analyzed: de la yang brjod par bya ste rgyu 'jig pa 'di gang yin /
translated: then we would say this: What is the cessation of the cause?

original: ci rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Is it the intrinsic reality of the cause?üîΩIf you say that it is, then as it is said, ‚ÄúThings that are momentary by nature disintegrate,‚Äù so what is the point of saying that they disintegrate?

original: ji skad du dngos po skad cig ma gnas pa'i chos kho na 'jig pa yin no zhes zer ba lta bu 'am ci rgyu zhig ste med pa la bya ci nyes /
analyzed: ji skad du dngos po skad cig ma gnas pa'i chos kho na 'jig pa yin no zhes zer ba lta bu 'am ci rgyu zhig ste med pa la bya ci nyes /
translated: Or is it that the cause ceases because it becomes nonexistent?

original: gal te rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo la bya na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo la bya na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the nature of the cause that is meant, then it follows that cause and effect would be simultaneous.

original: 'on te rgyu zhig ste med pa la bya na de @95b lta na yang 'bras bu dang dus mnyam pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu zhig ste med pa la bya na de @95b lta na yang 'bras bu dang dus mnyam pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is the cause that has ceased, that is, is non-existent, that is meant, then it is not simultaneous with the effect,

original: rang gi ngo bo med pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that that which is non-existent by its very nature is occasional.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid yin na ni dngos po nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid yin na ni dngos po nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is occasional, then it follows that it is a thing,

original: rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like consciousness.

original: de bas na skye ba'i dngos po rnams la ji lta ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa de lta de ltar 'thad pa bzod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skye ba'i dngos po rnams la ji lta ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa de lta de ltar 'thad pa bzod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, with regard to things that arise, the more they are analyzed, the less they are able to withstand rational justification.

original: de tshad ma dang 'gal ba med du zin kyang /
analyzed: de tshad ma dang 'gal ba med du zin kyang /
translated: Even if it is not contradictory to valid cognition,

original: 'on kyang de nges pas bya ba'i thabs ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nges pas bya ba'i thabs ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: nevertheless, there is no method by which it can be ascertained.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni phal cher mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas sgrub par byed pa yin na /üîΩmngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gnyis kyang rnam pa med pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni phal cher mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas sgrub par byed pa yin na / mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gnyis kyang rnam pa med pa 'am /
translated: Thus, the entities of cause and effect are established for the most part by means of perception and nonperception.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pas de 'dzin par 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pas de 'dzin par 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not tenable that perception and nonperception apprehend their objects either without aspects or with aspects.

original: yul gyis byas pa'i snang ba med cing don nye ba'i rgyu mtshan med par ni 'dis myong ngo zhes rnam par bzhag pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyis byas pa'i snang ba med cing don nye ba'i rgyu mtshan med par ni 'dis myong ngo zhes rnam par bzhag pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable to posit that this consciousness experiences its object in the absence of an appearance produced by the object and in the absence of a reason for the presence of the object.

original: rnam pa'i dngos po yang don med pa can rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa dngos pos khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dngos po yang don med pa can rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa dngos pos khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the entity of an aspect is not without an object, because the aspect of a consciousness, like that of a dream consciousness, is not pervaded by an entity.

original: shes pa gcig la rag las pa dang sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'byung ba rnams yang dag pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gcig la rag las pa dang sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'byung ba rnams yang dag pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that a single consciousness, which is dependent on something else and which has various aspects, is real.

original: de ltar skye ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu 'di bsgrub tu mi rung ba yin pas rnam pa gzhan bsam dgos so //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu 'di bsgrub tu mi rung ba yin pas rnam pa gzhan bsam dgos so //
translated: Thus, since arising is not established by direct perception or non-apprehension, it is not suitable to establish cause and effect. Therefore, another aspect must be considered.

original: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pas kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid 'di cung zad tsam yang gsal bar mi mkhyen mi spyod de /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pas kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid 'di cung zad tsam yang gsal bar mi mkhyen mi spyod de /
translated: Therefore, even the Omniscient One does not clearly know or engage in the slightest bit of this characteristic of dependent origination of cause and effect.

original: de ltar skye ba ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such arising contradicts valid cognition.

original: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang bas ni skye ba med pa'i rnam bar blta bar ni skyon mtha' dag dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid ston pas gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang bas ni skye ba med pa'i rnam bar blta bar ni skyon mtha' dag dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid ston pas gsungs te /
translated: Those who follow reasoning should view the absence of arising as taught by the Teacher, whose nature is wisdom, free from all faults.

original: rtag tu skye med chos ni de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rtag tu skye med chos ni de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is the Dharma that is always non-arisen.

original: chos rnams kun kyang bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
analyzed: chos rnams kun kyang bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
translated: All phenomena are like the Sugata.

original: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa dag //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa dag //
translated: Those with childish minds who grasp at characteristics

original: 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
translated: Engage in phenomena that do not exist in the world.

original: 'di rgya cher dpyad pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar dpyad pa yin pas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di rgya cher dpyad pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar dpyad pa yin pas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: Since this is a vast topic, it is analyzed in the context of dependent origination, so for now, let us leave the matter.

original: gal te skyob pa spros pa thams cad dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te skyob pa spros pa thams cad dang bral ba yin te /
translated: If the protector is free from all conceptual elaborations

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa gzigs pa yin na de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpar gyur @96a * //üîΩnas phyis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs par ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa gzigs pa yin na de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpar gyur @96a * // nas phyis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs par ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: and perceives the aspect of thatness, then since he is of the nature of thatness, how could the bodhisattva who has accumulated the collection of wisdomüîΩlater become the Bhagavan, the Tathagata?

original: sangs rgyas su gyur nas kyang mes shing bsregs te zad pa bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i gnas skabs na yang yul de dang der gnas pa dang ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang de ltar byung ba'i bde bar gshegs pa rnam par gzhag par bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su gyur nas kyang mes shing bsregs te zad pa bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i gnas skabs na yang yul de dang der gnas pa dang ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang de ltar byung ba'i bde bar gshegs pa rnam par gzhag par bya /
translated: And if he becomes a buddha, then like a fire that has consumed its fuel, he would pass into parinirvana, and how could the Sugata be posited as past, future, and present in the context of not passing into parinirvana?

original: ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par bzhag pas shes bya'i mtshan nyid gnyis rnam par bzhag / gzhan yang sems tsam gyi rang gi ngo bo mthong bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i rnam par bzhag
analyzed: ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par bzhag pas shes bya'i mtshan nyid gnyis rnam par bzhag / gzhan yang sems tsam gyi rang gi ngo bo mthong bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i rnam par bzhag
translated: Moreover, since the nature of mind-only is seen, it is presented as nondual because it is free from the duality of apprehended and apprehender.üîΩBy what is the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified presented as the two states of the sugata and the non-sugata?

original: / bde bar gshegs pa dang bde bar gshegs pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs gnyis su kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gang gis rnam par bzhag ces bya ba de dag ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de'i nang nas kha cig dogs pa skyes pa
analyzed: / bde bar gshegs pa dang bde bar gshegs pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs gnyis su kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gang gis rnam par bzhag ces bya ba de dag ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de'i nang nas kha cig dogs pa skyes pa
translated: Those are the doubts that arose in the minds of some in that retinue.

original: yin no // dogs pa'i dra ba de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin nyid la gud nas 'byung ba ma mchis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: yin no // dogs pa'i dra ba de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir / de bzhin nyid la gud nas 'byung ba ma mchis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: In order to completely abandon those doubts,

original: de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar du lan 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar du lan 'debs pa yin te /
translated: the reply is given from ‚ÄúSuchness does not arise elsewhere‚Äù up to ‚ÄúSuchness is unborn and unceasing.‚Äù

original: 'di'i bsam pa ni gal te de bzhin nyid ni sngar ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang mi 'byung na ni de ltar na 'gyur ba med pa'i don du mnyam pa ma yin pas mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i bsam pa ni gal te de bzhin nyid ni sngar ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang mi 'byung na ni de ltar na 'gyur ba med pa'i don du mnyam pa ma yin pas mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If suchness were to arise from what did not exist previously and, having arisen, not arise again, then it would not be the same in the sense of being immutable, and it would follow that it would be impermanent.

original: de ni 'di ltar 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'dod pa yin te /
translated: This is what they believe.

original: ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes kyang rung /
analyzed: ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes kyang rung /
translated: As it is said, whether or not a tathagata has arisen,

original: ma skyes kyang rung chos nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la sogs pa de ni gnas pa kho na yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma skyes kyang rung chos nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la sogs pa de ni gnas pa kho na yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: the reality, the perfect end, the inconceivable element, and so on, remain just as they are.

original: gal te 'di ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin na ye shes bzhin du lus med pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin na ye shes bzhin du lus med pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the nature of wisdom, then like wisdom it would be nonphysical and would not abide in a place.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i rgyal ba yin par ji ltar gdags /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i rgyal ba yin par ji ltar gdags /
translated: And how can it be designated as the victor of the past and so on if it is devoid of arising and disintegration?

original: ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni de'i bdag nyid yin na yang gnyis su gyur pas stong pa nyid dang mi 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni de'i bdag nyid yin na yang gnyis su gyur pas stong pa nyid dang mi 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: The Teacher, the Omniscient One, is of that nature, but how could he be non-contradictory with emptiness, since he is dual?

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin na yang skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyis @96b rtogs pa na gang gis gnyis su thal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin na yang skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyis @96b rtogs pa na gang gis gnyis su thal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Even though he is of the nature of non-dual exalted wisdom, when he is realized by those with good fortune, how could the error of duality arise?

original: sngar kun nas nyon mongs la phyis rnam par byang ba yin na yang rnam par byang ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar kun nas nyon mongs la phyis rnam par byang ba yin na yang rnam par byang ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though he is defiled at one time and later is purified, he is endowed with purification.

original: 'di de lta yin na yang gal te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs kyi tshe na ni gnyis kyi bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di de lta yin na yang gal te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs kyi tshe na ni gnyis kyi bdag nyid yin la /
translated: Even though this is so, if at the time of the occasion of defilement he is of the nature of duality,

original: 'di ltar de phyis sngon med pa'i gnyis su med par gyur pas rnam par byang ba yin na ni 'dus ma byas ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de phyis sngon med pa'i gnyis su med par gyur pas rnam par byang ba yin na ni 'dus ma byas ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and if later he becomes non-dual in a way that he was not before, then he would not be uncompounded.üîΩIn order to respond to this, it says in the root text:

original: 'di'i lan glan pa'i ched du rkyen 'dus pa las de bzhin nyid la kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: 'di'i lan glan pa'i ched du rkyen 'dus pa las de bzhin nyid la kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not arise from conditions.

original: de bzhin nyid ni sngon med pa'i ngo bo 'byung ba yang ma lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni sngon med pa'i ngo bo 'byung ba yang ma lags so //
translated: Suchness is not the origination of a previously nonexistent entity.

original: mi 'dra ba'i rnam pa 'jig pa yang ma lags so //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i rnam pa 'jig pa yang ma lags so //
translated: It is not the destruction of a different kind.

original: yul ni yul sa'o //
analyzed: yul ni yul sa'o //
translated: A place is a region.

original: phyogs ni grong la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs ni grong la sogs pa'o //
translated: A direction is a town, etc.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa ni dus so //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa ni dus so //
translated: The past, etc. are times.

original: gnyis la sogs pa ni gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gnyis la sogs pa ni gnas skabs so //
translated: Two, etc. are occasions.

original: skye ba ni rgyun gyis so //
analyzed: skye ba ni rgyun gyis so //
translated: Birth is by continuity.

original: de med pas mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de med pas mi skye ba'o //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no birth.

original: 'gag pa ni rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the interruption of continuity.

original: de med pas mi 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: de med pas mi 'gag pa ste /
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no cessation.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Lord is in a nirvana that is not a resting place.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning here is this:

original: de bzhin nyid ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni /
translated: Suchness

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon med pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon med pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: is not the producer of a previously nonexistent entity of a Tathagata.

original: 'on kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i skyon mtha' dag sbyangs pas dri ma med pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i skyon mtha' dag sbyangs pas dri ma med pa thob pa yin te /
translated: However, it is the attainment of stainlessness by the purification of all faults of unreal adherence.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi snga rol du gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i ling tog stug pos de khebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi snga rol du gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i ling tog stug pos de khebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is covered by the thick cataract of the manifest adherence to the apprehended object and apprehending subject prior to the intuition of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de ma rtogs pa yod pa yang de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de snga nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma rtogs pa yod pa yang de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de snga nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the existence of that non-realization is due to the prior existence of that unreal imagination.

original: dus phyis ni lan mang du thabs mang pos yun ring por chos bdag med pa'i ye shes goms par byas pas bsgom pa khyad par du gyur nas rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag rgyun chad de de kho na nyid kyi ye shes byung ba dang sgro 'dogs pa'i
analyzed: dus phyis ni lan mang du thabs mang pos yun ring por chos bdag med pa'i ye shes goms par byas pas bsgom pa khyad par du gyur nas rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag rgyun chad de de kho na nyid kyi ye shes byung ba dang sgro 'dogs pa'i
translated: Later, after a long time, by means of many methods, the intuition of the selflessness of dharmas is cultivated, and, as a result of the special development of meditation, the stream of all imaginations is interrupted.

original: bag la nyal thams cad kyi gnas kyang med par gyur to //
analyzed: bag la nyal thams cad kyi gnas kyang med par gyur to //
translated: When the intuition of reality arises, the abode of all the latent impressions of superimposition is destroyed.

original: de'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bu ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bu ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The TathƒÅgata, who is of that nature, is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, fulfilling the aims of all transmigrators.

original: de bzhin nyid 'di ni 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yang yin te /üîΩyod pa dang med par mngon par zhen pa gnyis dang ldan @97a * //üîΩpa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di ni 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yang yin te / yod pa dang med par mngon par zhen pa gnyis dang ldan @97a * // pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This suchness is also thusness, because it is the suchness of all phenomena.üîΩThis suchness is also reality, because it is the object of the knowledge of reality.

original: 'di nyid 'di ltar rnam par dag pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'di ltar rnam par dag pa yang yin te /
translated: This suchness is also the perfect limit, because it is the limit of the real.üîΩThis suchness is also the ultimate, because it is the object of ultimate knowledge.üîΩThis suchness is also the signless, because it is the object of the signless.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid dang bcas pa'i sems gang la mngon par zhen pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid dang bcas pa'i sems gang la mngon par zhen pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'o //
translated: This suchness is also the inconceivable, because it is the object of the inconceivable.üîΩThis suchness is also the inexpressible, because it is the object of the inexpressible.üîΩThis suchness is also the unconditioned, because it is the object of the unconditioned.üîΩThis suchness is also the unarisen, because it is the object of the unarisen.üîΩThis suchness is also the undestroyed, because it is the object of the undestroyed.üîΩThis suchness is also the unstained, because it is the object of the unstained.üîΩThis suchness is also the unattached, because it is the object of the unattached.üîΩThis suchness is also the unfettered, because it is the object of the unfettered.üîΩThis suchness is also the unobscured, because it is the object of the unobscured.

original: de rnam par dag pa yang rim gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa yang rim gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: This suchness is also the uncompounded, because it is the object of the uncompounded.üîΩThis suchness is also the unarisen, because it is the object of the unarisen.üîΩThis suchness is also the undestroyed, because it is the object of the undestroyed.üîΩThis suchness is also the unstained, because it is the object of the unstained.üîΩThis suchness is also the unattached, because it is the object of the unattached.üîΩThis suchness is also the unfettered, because it is the object of the unfettered.üîΩThis suchness is also the unobscured, because it is the object of the unobscured.

original: 'das pa la sogs par rnam par bzhag pa ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa gang du gnas pa dang gshegs pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa kho na yin no //üîΩ'on kyang 'jig rten pa dag de'i dbang gis de lta bur snang ba skye ba gang yin pa'i ngor byas nas de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs par rnam par bzhag pa ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa gang du gnas pa dang gshegs pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa kho na yin no //üîΩ'on kyang 'jig rten pa dag de'i dbang gis de lta bur snang ba skye ba gang yin pa'i ngor byas nas de skad du bshad do //
translated: This suchness is also the uncompounded, because it is the object of the uncompounded.üîΩThis suchness is also the unarisen, because it is the object of the unarisen.üîΩThis suchness is also the undestroyed, because it is the object of the undestroyed.üîΩThis suchness is also the unstained, because it is the object of

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni ci'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni ci'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the Bhagavat Buddha said to be non-abiding nirvana?

original: de rigs pa dang lung gis yin te /
analyzed: de rigs pa dang lung gis yin te /
translated: It is by reason and by scriptural authority.

original: gang dag gnas pa'i rgyu tshogs pa de dag ni gnas pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag gnas pa'i rgyu tshogs pa de dag ni gnas pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those things that are a collection of causes for abiding do not cease to abide,

original: dper na du ba la sogs pa gnas pa'i rgyu me dang shing la sogs pa tshang bar tshogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du ba la sogs pa gnas pa'i rgyu me dang shing la sogs pa tshang bar tshogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, the causes for the abiding of smoke, such as fire and fuel, are a collection.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang 'khor ba ji srid par bar ma chad par gnas pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang 'khor ba ji srid par bar ma chad par gnas pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddha also has causes for abiding for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: gnas pa rnam par 'jig pa la khyab par byed pa ni gnas pa'i rgyu nyid tshogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa rnam par 'jig pa la khyab par byed pa ni gnas pa'i rgyu nyid tshogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The cause for the destruction of abiding is not a collection of causes for abiding.

original: de ni 'dir 'gal bar bstan pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir 'gal bar bstan pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the pervasion is shown to be contradictory, and so there is the perception of a contradictory pervasion.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni du ba la sogs pa rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni du ba la sogs pa rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: The dissimilar instance is the cessation of the continuum of smoke, etc.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa ni 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rigs pa 'gal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa ni 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rigs pa 'gal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The absence of a complete cause contradicts the arising of an effect.

original: gtan tshigs ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How is the reason established?

original: bshad pa / gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba ni sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir dang / snying rje chen po dang bral ba'i phyir dang / tshe'i 'du byed bzhag pa'i dbang med pa'i phyir dang / srog gi dbang po rnam par smin pa'i las yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: bshad pa / gnas pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba ni sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir dang / snying rje chen po dang bral ba'i phyir dang / tshe'i 'du byed bzhag pa'i dbang med pa'i phyir dang / srog gi dbang po rnam par smin pa'i las yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang /
translated: It is said: Because of the incompleteness of the cause of abiding, there is no ability to accomplish the welfare of sentient beings, because of being devoid of great compassion, because of not having the power to set aside the formative factors of life, and because of the complete exhaustion of the karma that is the ripening of the life faculty.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can med pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can med pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are those sentient beings who are not to be trained by the Buddha.

original: de dag las bzlog pa de ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin no ;
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa de ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin no ;
translated: The opposite of those is the cause of abiding.

original: / de la ston pa ni ye shes kyi nus pa thogs pa mi mnga' bar zhal gyis bzhes pas rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: / de la ston pa ni ye shes kyi nus pa thogs pa mi mnga' bar zhal gyis bzhes pas rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: Regarding that, the Teacher does not have the first conception because he accepts the unimpeded ability of wisdom.

original: de la gzhan du yin na ni bse ru lta bu la sogs pa dang bye brag ci yod /
analyzed: de la gzhan du yin na ni bse ru lta bu la sogs pa dang bye brag ci yod /
translated: If it were otherwise, what would be the difference between the rhinoceros-like and the bodhisattva?

original: bram ze gcang sbra can gyis mi thod can yun ring du bsten pas skyug mi bro ba bzhin @97b du de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir thugs brtse ba ni 'bad pa ma byas par nyams pa med do //
analyzed: bram ze gcang sbra can gyis mi thod can yun ring du bsten pas skyug mi bro ba bzhin @97b du de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir thugs brtse ba ni 'bad pa ma byas par nyams pa med do //
translated: Like a brahmin who is so used to the smell of his own body that he is not disgusted by it, his compassion is not lost without effort, because he has become of that very nature.

original: 'bad pa yang skyon du ma mthong bar mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'bad pa yang skyon du ma mthong bar mi 'byung ngo //
translated: And effort does not occur without seeing many faults.

original: de yang 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so in this case.

original: yon tan gyi rang gi ngo bo yin pa ci'i phyir de nyid la blo lhag par phyogs pa'i phyir yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rang gi ngo bo yin pa ci'i phyir de nyid la blo lhag par phyogs pa'i phyir yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: Because it is the very nature of his virtues, his mind is not inclined to that, so it is not like the second conception.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa mthar phyin par song ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gsum pa yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa mthar phyin par song ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gsum pa yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: And the third conception is not reasonable either, because he has perfected the cultivation of the bases of miraculous action.

original: de skad du kun dga' bo gang yang rung bas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan cing bsgoms te lan mang du byas na ni 'dod na bskal pa 'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du kun dga' bo gang yang rung bas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bstan cing bsgoms te lan mang du byas na ni 'dod na bskal pa 'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Ananda, whoever demonstrates the bases of psychic power, cultivates them, and practices them frequently, can, if he wishes, remain for an eon or more than an eon.

original: 'bras bu srog gi las zad pa yang bskal ba mi nyung bar srog gcod pa spangs pa bsags shing goms pa mtha' yas pa'i thabs sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba'i bla ma la srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu srog gi las zad pa yang bskal ba mi nyung bar srog gcod pa spangs pa bsags shing goms pa mtha' yas pa'i thabs sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba'i bla ma la srid pa ma yin no //
translated: The exhaustion of the karma of life, which is the result, is not possible for the master of the world who possesses the perfections such as generosity, which is the means of abandoning killing for many eons, and who is accustomed to and has accumulated that abandonment.

original: rgyu mchog tu gyur pa gang yin pa'i 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa ma yin pa yin na 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mchog tu gyur pa gang yin pa'i 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa ma yin pa yin na 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyi chos yin no //
translated: The result is the best when the cause is the best, and the result is not the best when the cause is not the best. This is the nature of cause and result.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: rgyu mchog tu gyur pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa ma yin pa las 'bras bu de ltar mi 'gyur na ni 'bras bu dang de byed pa'i dngos por ma gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mchog tu gyur pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa ma yin pa las 'bras bu de ltar mi 'gyur na ni 'bras bu dang de byed pa'i dngos por ma gyur pa yin te /
translated: If a supreme or non-supreme cause does not result in a supreme or non-supreme effect, then the effect and the entity that produces it would not exist,

original: de'i bye brag la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bye brag la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not depend on its specific cause.

original: ston pa la yang srog de'i rgyu gzhan gyis srog gcod pa la sogs pa kha na ma tho ba med pa dpag tu med pa yod pa yang ma yin na des ji ltar 'di gnas pa med pa yin /
analyzed: ston pa la yang srog de'i rgyu gzhan gyis srog gcod pa la sogs pa kha na ma tho ba med pa dpag tu med pa yod pa yang ma yin na des ji ltar 'di gnas pa med pa yin /
translated: Also, the Teacher does not have immeasurable non-transgressions such as taking life, which are the cause of that life, so how could he be without life?

original: de kun gyi 'bras bu ni thams cad mkhyen pa 'di yin no zhe na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de kun gyi 'bras bu ni thams cad mkhyen pa 'di yin no zhe na yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is omniscience the result of all of them,

original: srog yun ring du yod par dngos su bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: srog yun ring du yod par dngos su bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is directly taught that life is long.

original: srog gcod pa spangs pa dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyi 'bras bu tshe rabs mi nyung ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spangs pa dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyi 'bras bu tshe rabs mi nyung ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The result of abandoning taking life and the perfection of generosity is taught to be many lifetimes.

original: gang yang dngos su gang gi rgyu yin par bstan pa de yongs su rgyas shing rkyen nye bar gyur pa na de skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang yang dngos su gang gi rgyu yin par bstan pa de yongs su rgyas shing rkyen nye bar gyur pa na de skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Whatever is taught to be the cause of something, when that is fully developed and conditions are present, it produces that.

original: gal te gzhan gyi rgyu nyid du yang 'gyur na de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi rgyu nyid du yang 'gyur na de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod /
translated: If it also becomes the cause of something else, what is wrong with that?

original: gzhan yang chos de kho na nyid goms pa'i dbang gis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos de kho na nyid goms pa'i dbang gis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, by the power of cultivating the reality of phenomena, omniscience is accomplished.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni de'i gnas khyad par du gyur @98a * //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni de'i gnas khyad par du gyur @98a * //
translated: The accumulation of merit is the special basis for that,

original: bas na rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bas na rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: so it is compatible with it.

original: 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pas gdul bar bya ba'i sems can med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pas gdul bar bya ba'i sems can med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata has attained complete nirvƒÅ·πáa because there are no sentient beings to be trained,‚Äù

original: 'dir bsam par bya ste /üîΩci sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can med pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir bsam par bya ste / ci sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can med pa'am /
translated: in this regard, you should consider the following:üîΩAre there no sentient beings to be trained by the form of a buddha?

original: ci gzhan gyi gzugs kyis gdul bar bya ba yang med pa yin /
analyzed: ci gzhan gyi gzugs kyis gdul bar bya ba yang med pa yin /
translated: Or are there also none to be trained by other forms?

original: gal te phyogs snga ma yin na ni de'i che brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs bstan pas gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo yod pa'i phyir de'i gzugs kyis ci'i phyir mi bzhugs /
analyzed: gal te phyogs snga ma yin na ni de'i che brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs bstan pas gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo yod pa'i phyir de'i gzugs kyis ci'i phyir mi bzhugs /
translated: If the former, then since there are beings to be trained who can perceive the form of ≈öakra and so on, why does he not remain in that form?

original: thugs rje dang ldan pa rnams ni 'gro ba'i phan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir khyad par gzhan la yang bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: thugs rje dang ldan pa rnams ni 'gro ba'i phan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir khyad par gzhan la yang bstan par mdzad de /
translated: The compassionate do manifest in other forms in order to benefit beings.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the BhagavƒÅn manifested in the form of a cakravartin.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo med du zin kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na de dpag tu med pa yod pa'i phyir ci'i phyir 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'da' //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo med du zin kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na de dpag tu med pa yod pa'i phyir ci'i phyir 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'da' //
translated: Moreover, even if there are no beings to be trained by a buddha in one world system, since there are countless beings in other world systems, why would he enter parinirvƒÅ·πáa?

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kyang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn himself said:

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan mi 'da' ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan mi 'da' ste //
translated: Buddhas do not enter parinirvƒÅ·πáa

original: chos kyang nub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyang nub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the Dharma also does not disappear.

original: sems can yongs su smin bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings,

original: mya ngan 'da' bar bstan pa yin //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar bstan pa yin //
translated: And demonstrated nirvana.üîΩ

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: He has shown the transcendence of suffering.

original: shin tu spros pas chog gis skabs nyid brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu spros pas chog gis skabs nyid brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Enough with too much verbiage. Let us begin the topic itself.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang / phyag bgyis pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skabs kyi don mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang / phyag bgyis pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skabs kyi don mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Thus, seeing the Tathagata, making obeisance, and so on, is the conclusion of the topic.

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam pa las bzlog ste rnam pa gzhan du mngon par zhen pas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba don yod do snyam du kha cig dogs pa la 'jam dpal khyod kyis de ltar bltas na ci zhig mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam pa las bzlog ste rnam pa gzhan du mngon par zhen pas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba don yod do snyam du kha cig dogs pa la 'jam dpal khyod kyis de ltar bltas na ci zhig mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Some, thinking, The seeing of the Tathagata is meaningful, conceive of it in a way contrary to the way it was taught. To them, Manjushri said, If you see in that way, what do you see?

original: 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is the question.

original: de ltar bltas na mthong ba ci yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni lan yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bltas na mthong ba ci yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni lan yin te /
translated: The answer is, If you see in that way, you do not see anything at all.

original: rang khong du chud pa tsam las ma gtogs par zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang khong du chud pa tsam las ma gtogs par zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that it is only for the sake of one's own understanding.

original: gzhan dag 'di snyam du dogs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'di snyam du dogs te /
translated: Others suspect the following.

original: 'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di ni don dka' ba'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di ni don dka' ba'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te /
translated: This Manjushri is engaged in a difficult matter.

original: gang yang mthong ba med pa'i tshul gyis gnas la /
analyzed: gang yang mthong ba med pa'i tshul gyis gnas la /
translated: He abides in a way that is free from seeing

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang mthong ba dang / sems can gyi khams mtha' dag la khyab par byed pa'i byams pa'i dgongs pa'i rtsa ba can @98b byang chub kyi sems sngon du song ba'i brtson 'grus kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang mthong ba dang / sems can gyi khams mtha' dag la khyab par byed pa'i byams pa'i dgongs pa'i rtsa ba can @98b byang chub kyi sems sngon du song ba'i brtson 'grus kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par mdzad pa dang /
translated: and, with the root of the intention of love that pervades the entire realm of sentient beings, he has completed the accumulations of merit and wisdom through the effort that is preceded by the thought of awakening.üîΩHe engages in that without apprehending sentient beings through nonconceptual wisdom and without clinging through conceptual thought.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis sems can yang mi dmigs pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pas kyang mngon par zhen pa med par de la 'jug pa ni re zhig 'dis kyang shin tu don dka' ba yin par srid na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis sems can yang mi dmigs pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pas kyang mngon par zhen pa med par de la 'jug pa ni re zhig 'dis kyang shin tu don dka' ba yin par srid na /
translated: This is a very difficult matter, to say the least.

original: bdag 'dra bas lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes de skad du dogs pa 'di brjod pa la /
analyzed: bdag 'dra bas lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes de skad du dogs pa 'di brjod pa la /
translated: What need is there to mention someone like me?‚Äù

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod kyis de ltar mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod kyis de ltar mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The noble Sariputra said to Manjusri, ‚ÄúYou see the Tathagata in this way, and so on up to

original: sems can thams cad kyi ched du go cha chen po bgos pa de ni khyod dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi ched du go cha chen po bgos pa de ni khyod dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúYou are a doer of what is hard, in that you have girded on the armor for the great battle for the sake of all beings.‚Äù

original: byams pa chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyis bskul te sems can thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba skyed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyis bskul te sems can thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba skyed 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat love‚Äù means the desire to generate irreproachable happiness in all beings, inspired by the thought of awakening.

original: gzhan dag na re dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is love without an object.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir zhugs kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gro la phan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog ces byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir zhugs kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gro la phan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog ces byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough he has set out for the complete nirvana of all beings‚Äù means that he has generated the thought of awakening, thinking, ‚ÄúMay I become a buddha for the benefit of the world.‚Äù

original: go cha zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid 'gro ba gdon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: go cha zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid 'gro ba gdon par spro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArmor‚Äù means the enthusiasm for the liberation of the world, which has the nature of effort.

original: go cha de yang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis yin no //
analyzed: go cha de yang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis yin no //
translated: And that armor is in the manner of the object, etc.

original: ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dman pa la mos pa'i skye bo la 'tsham pa ma yin pa'i chos la rjes su spyod pa'i phyir dka' ba mdzad pa nyid yin par zhal gyis bzhes so //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dman pa la mos pa'i skye bo la 'tsham pa ma yin pa'i chos la rjes su spyod pa'i phyir dka' ba mdzad pa nyid yin par zhal gyis bzhes so //
translated: As it is said, It is just as you say, he acknowledges that it is a difficult deed, because it is the practice of a Dharma that is not suitable for beings who are devoted to the inferior.

original: sems can mi dmigs pa yin yang sems can mya ngan las 'da' ba'i go cha mi 'gal bar bstan pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir go cha 'di yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i gnas skabs su bgos pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pa yin yang sems can mya ngan las 'da' ba'i go cha mi 'gal bar bstan pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir go cha 'di yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i gnas skabs su bgos pa yin no //
translated: Although sentient beings are not perceived, he shows that it is not contradictory to armor oneself for the nirvana of sentient beings: This armoring is for the complete nirvana of all sentient beings, and it is armored in the stage of conduct through devotion.

original: bdag la sems can du dmigs pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sems can du dmigs pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no perception of sentient beings at all in me is because of the abandonment of the characteristics of grasped and grasper.

original: de ni yang dag pa yin no zhe na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa yin no zhe na yang ma yin te /
translated: If you think, That is correct, it is not.

original: de med du zin kyang sems can sgro 'dogs pas 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de med du zin kyang sems can sgro 'dogs pas 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: Even if that does not exist, sentient beings are deluded by reification.üîΩWhy is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: sems can du mngon par zhen pa bdag la gang yang med par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can du mngon par zhen pa bdag la gang yang med par gyur pa yin te /
translated: I have no reification at all of sentient beings,

original: sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because I abide like a magician.

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma mkhan ni sgyu ma'i glang po che la @99a * //üîΩsogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma mkhan ni sgyu ma'i glang po che la @99a * // sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Thus, a magician has no reification of illusory elephants,üîΩand so on.üîΩIn the same way, I have no reification of sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sems can du dmigs pa de yang de bzhin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can du dmigs pa de yang de bzhin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the condensed meaning:

original: byams pa chen pos brgyan cing byang chub chen po'i dgongs pa can mngon par zhen pa thams cad spangs pa rnams kyis thog ma nyid du de bsgom pa ni yid kyi chos yin pa'i phyir kun tu rgyu mi thod can skyug bro ba bzhin du /
analyzed: byams pa chen pos brgyan cing byang chub chen po'i dgongs pa can mngon par zhen pa thams cad spangs pa rnams kyis thog ma nyid du de bsgom pa ni yid kyi chos yin pa'i phyir kun tu rgyu mi thod can skyug bro ba bzhin du /
translated: Those who are adorned with great love, who have the intention of great awakening, and who have abandoned all reifications should first meditate on that, because it is a mental phenomenon, like a disgusted naked ascetic.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtha' dag spangs pa na gsal ba kho nar 'gyur bas lhag pa'i bsam pa mi g-yo ba rnams la dka' ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtha' dag spangs pa na gsal ba kho nar 'gyur bas lhag pa'i bsam pa mi g-yo ba rnams la dka' ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: When all the causes of discursive thought are abandoned, it becomes clear. Therefore, there is not the slightest difficulty for those whose superior intention is unshakeable.

original: bsgom pa'i sbyor ba la sdar ba rnams la ni mtha' dag shin tu dka' bar snang ngo //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i sbyor ba la sdar ba rnams la ni mtha' dag shin tu dka' bar snang ngo //
translated: But for those who are slow in the practice of meditation, it seems to be very difficult.

original: spro ba 'di yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i sems can go rims bzhin du nyung ba nyid dang / yongs su mang ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir brtsams pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: spro ba 'di yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i sems can go rims bzhin du nyung ba nyid dang / yongs su mang ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir brtsams pa ma yin nam /
translated: And this enthusiasm is not undertaken in order to make the number of sentient beings belonging to samsara and nirvana respectively either smaller or larger.

original: ji ltar na sems can du dmigs pa dang ; mngon par zhen pa de med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can du dmigs pa dang ; mngon par zhen pa de med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can there be no reference to sentient beings and no attachment to them?

original: de'i phyir / de ltar ma dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ltar ma dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúIt is not so intended.‚Äù

original: ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: 'di ltar bdag gis sems can gyi khams bri ba 'am gang bar bya zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis sems can gyi khams bri ba 'am gang bar bya zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said: ‚ÄúI should diminish or fill the realm of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: go cha de lta bu yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: go cha de lta bu yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault if one has such an armor?

original: de'i phyir / btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu yongs su brtags pa nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu yongs su brtags pa nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, if you apprehend a person,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: you should apprehend a bodhisattva as such.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs bstan pa ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan pa ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: The reason is stated: ‚Äúbecause of the emptiness of inherent nature.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúif you apprehend.‚Äù

original: gang bar mngon pa med do zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang bar mngon pa med do zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no person to be found‚Äù means ‚Äúthere is no apprehension.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dri ba'i don gtan tshigs gang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dri ba'i don gtan tshigs gang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù means ‚Äúwhat is the reason?‚Äù

original: ci mthong ba'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir yod kyang mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci mthong ba'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir yod kyang mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Is it because of the absence of the cause of seeing, so that although it exists, it is not apprehended,

original: mun rum gyi nang na bum pa la sogs pa 'dug pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: mun rum gyi nang na bum pa la sogs pa 'dug pa bzhin nam /
translated: like a pot, etc. in a dark place?

original: med pa'i phyir rta'i rva la sogs pa bzhin nam zhe na /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir rta'i rva la sogs pa bzhin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is it because of non-existence, like the horn of a donkey?

original: 'dir lan du rnam par rtog pa ni sems can dben pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'dir lan du rnam par rtog pa ni sems can dben pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Here, the answer is stated: ‚Äúbecause of the emptiness of inherent nature.‚Äù

original: sems can zhes bya ba ni srog chags te /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba ni srog chags te /
translated: ‚ÄúSentient being‚Äù means living being.

original: de dag gi tshogs rgyun gyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi tshogs rgyun gyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor brtags pa'o //
translated: They are imagined to be the entities of the apprehended, etc., in the specific states of the continuum of that collection.

original: sems can med pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa ni med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo sentient beings‚Äù means ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: sems can dngos po med pa @99b yin na byang chub pa'i gnas skabs na khyod ji ltar chos 'chad pa 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can dngos po med pa @99b yin na byang chub pa'i gnas skabs na khyod ji ltar chos 'chad pa 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If sentient beings are nonexistent, how can you, at the time of enlightenment, explain the Dharma?

original: mo gsham gyi bu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos 'chad pa smra bar nus pa'i mkhas pa med par ston to zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos 'chad pa smra bar nus pa'i mkhas pa med par ston to zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: This shows that there is no wise person who can explain the Dharma in order to make the son of a barren woman understood.

original: 'jam dpal gal te sems can dben ba dang sems can sems can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgol ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gal te sems can dben ba dang sems can sems can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgol ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, if sentient beings are isolated, and sentient beings are not sentient beings,‚Äù and so on, is the objection.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said to the venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang gi tshe sems can shin tu mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang gi tshe sems can shin tu mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan 'debs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, when sentient beings are not apprehended at all‚Äù and so on is the answer.

original: sems can shin tu mi dmigs pa ni gzung ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can shin tu mi dmigs pa ni gzung ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sentient beings are not apprehended at all because there is no object to be grasped and so on.

original: de'i tshe 'gro ba su zhig mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'gro ba su zhig mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: At that time, what sentient being would fully awaken to perfect buddhahood? None at all.

original: 'tshang rgya ba po dang / 'ga' zhig 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / 'tshang rgya ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba po dang / 'ga' zhig 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / 'tshang rgya ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Because there is no one who would awaken, no one who would awaken to anything, and no awakening.

original: bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni chos gang zhig bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni chos gang zhig bshad par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat should be taught‚Äù means what Dharma should be explained.

original: bshad par bya ba'i chos spyi'i rnam pa dang bshad pa'i sgra'i spyi'i bdag nyid dang de 'dzin par byed pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i chos spyi'i rnam pa dang bshad pa'i sgra'i spyi'i bdag nyid dang de 'dzin par byed pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no general form of the Dharma to be explained, no general nature of the words of the explanation, and no one to apprehend it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni nyan par byed pa'i sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di tshig gi don yin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni nyan par byed pa'i sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di tshig gi don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the question why is it so? is the reason because sentient beings who listen are not apprehended.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: chos thams cad rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gzung ba la sogs pa shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gzung ba la sogs pa shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are utterly nonexistent as subject and object in one's own and others' continuums.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar bstan pa'i tshig gi don gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar bstan pa'i tshig gi don gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This because all phenomena are utterly unapprehendable clarifies the meaning of the words as they were taught.

original: rang nyid kyis dris pa ni gzhan gyi 'dri ba la sdod na /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis dris pa ni gzhan gyi 'dri ba la sdod na /
translated: One asks oneself because if one hesitates to answer others' questions,

original: rgyun mi 'chad par chos 'chad par byed pa bar chad pa la mi dga' bar 'gyur ba med par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dri ba po yang mi shes pa'am spobs pa med de 'dri bar mi byed pa la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par chos 'chad par byed pa bar chad pa la mi dga' bar 'gyur ba med par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dri ba po yang mi shes pa'am spobs pa med de 'dri bar mi byed pa la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one will not be able to teach the Dharma uninterruptedly, and one will not be able to help those who do not ask questions due to ignorance or lack of confidence.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi tshig de dag gis sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spang ba byas pa de'i dgongs pa'i don khong du ma chud nas shin tu sems can la sogs pa med par khong du chud nas skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar lhung ba mngon du gyur pa dang
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi tshig de dag gis sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spang ba byas pa de'i dgongs pa'i don khong du ma chud nas shin tu sems can la sogs pa med par khong du chud nas skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar lhung ba mngon du gyur pa dang
translated: Not understanding the intended meaning of that, they understood that sentient beings and so on are utterly nonexistent, and they fell into the extreme of deprecation.

original: / de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gang gi @100a * //
analyzed: / de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gang gi @100a * //
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn said to Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´,

original: tshe chos thams cad shin tu mi dmigs pa de'i tshe ci sems can du yang 'dogs sam zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe chos thams cad shin tu mi dmigs pa de'i tshe ci sems can du yang 'dogs sam zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen all phenomena are utterly non-apprehensible, at that time, do you designate them as sentient beings?‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the purpose of teaching?

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras sngon gyi thugs rje dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs rnams kyang bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras sngon gyi thugs rje dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs rnams kyang bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes previous compassion and the accumulations of the perfections.

original: 'dogs pa nyid byed pa ma lags so zhe na /
analyzed: 'dogs pa nyid byed pa ma lags so zhe na /
translated: If you say that designation itself is not the agent,

original: mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste /
translated: that is not correct.

original: de gdags pa ni gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gdags pa ni gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that designation must be done without doubt.

original: 'di ltar gal te yang 'ga' zhig sems can ji snyed yod ces de skad 'dri na zhes bya ba ni mthar lhung bar gyur cing the tshom za ba'i blo can dag sems can ji snyed yod ces de skad 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te yang 'ga' zhig sems can ji snyed yod ces de skad 'dri na zhes bya ba ni mthar lhung bar gyur cing the tshom za ba'i blo can dag sems can ji snyed yod ces de skad 'dri ba'o //
translated: in this way, one who has fallen into an extreme and has a doubting mind would ask, ‚ÄúHow many sentient beings are there?‚Äù

original: de skad 'dri ba la ji skad brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de skad 'dri ba la ji skad brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one answer such a question?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed pa de snyed do zhes lan gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed pa de snyed do zhes lan gdab par bya ste /
translated: One should answer, ‚ÄúAs many as the Buddha natures.‚Äù

original: sems can mtha' med pa dang / gnyis su med par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can mtha' med pa dang / gnyis su med par ston pa yin te /
translated: This shows that sentient beings are limitless and nondual.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed pa rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad dang bral ba de snyed kyi sems can gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed pa rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad dang bral ba de snyed kyi sems can gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that sentient beings are as many as the Buddha natures, which are free from all nets of conceptual thought, and are of the nature of nondual sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi khams kyi tshad ji tsam zhes bya ba ni 'di'i tshad ji tsam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi tshad ji tsam zhes bya ba ni 'di'i tshad ji tsam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHow great is the realm of sentient beings?‚Äù means ‚ÄúWhat is its extent?‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi tshad ji tsam zhes bya ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi tshad ji tsam zhes bya ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHow great is the domain of the Buddha?‚Äù is the same.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The domain of the Buddha is the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: de ni thams cad du song ba yin pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni thams cad du song ba yin pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa yin no //
translated: It is immeasurable because it extends everywhere.

original: dpe rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis kyang de kho na nyid gnyis su med pa rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis kyang de kho na nyid gnyis su med pa rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: These two examples express the non-duality of reality.

original: yan lag dang yan lag can tsam brjod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas 'dri ba snga phyi gnyis kyi don dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can tsam brjod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas 'dri ba snga phyi gnyis kyi don dbye ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the two questions is distinguished by the desire to express merely the whole and its parts.

original: yan lag dang yan lag can tha dad pa med du zin yang 'on kyang 'dri ba po'i bsam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas don gcig po gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can tha dad pa med du zin yang 'on kyang 'dri ba po'i bsam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas don gcig po gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gnyis bstan to //
translated: Although the whole and its parts are not distinguished, nevertheless, in order to clarify the one meaning by way of the various intentions of the questioner, two are taught.

original: de ltar na sems can dpag tu med pa yod pa'i phyir chad pa'i mtha' rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can dpag tu med pa yod pa'i phyir chad pa'i mtha' rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: Thus, because immeasurable sentient beings exist, the extreme of annihilation is not reasonable. This is the summarized meaning.

original: 'jam dpal khyod la gal te yang 'ga' zhig 'di skad du sems can gyi khams gang du gtogs zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba ni de ltar gal te sems can gyi khams gdon mi za bar yod pa yin na rang gi ngo bo 'ga' zhig dang gzhi yang
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod la gal te yang 'ga' zhig 'di skad du sems can gyi khams gang du gtogs zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba ni de ltar gal te sems can gyi khams gdon mi za bar yod pa yin na rang gi ngo bo 'ga' zhig dang gzhi yang
translated: If the realm of sentient beings definitely exists, then its own nature and basis must exist.

original: yod par bya dgos pas na bdag nyid gang yin /
analyzed: yod par bya dgos pas na bdag nyid gang yin /
translated: Therefore, what is its self?

original: gnas kyang gang yin /
analyzed: gnas kyang gang yin /
translated: And what is its abode?

original: de'i bdag gang du 'du zhes bya ba'i don de ni 'dri ba'i bsam @100b pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag gang du 'du zhes bya ba'i don de ni 'dri ba'i bsam @100b pa yin no //
translated: To which do its beings belong? This is the meaning of the question.

original: bdag gis 'di skad du skye ba med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang du gtogs par gtogs so zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang du gnas pa'i ngo bo der sems can gyi khams gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di skad du skye ba med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang du gtogs par gtogs so zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang du gnas pa'i ngo bo der sems can gyi khams gnas pa yin no //
translated: I would say, They belong to the inconceivable realm of non-arising. The realm of sentient beings abides in the nature of that which abides in the inconceivable and non-arising.

original: skye ba med pa ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: Non-arising should be understood as emptiness according to the previously explained method.

original: de nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: That itself is inconceivable.

original: bsam pa thams cad kyi gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad kyi gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the basis of any thoughts.

original: gnas par byed pa'i ngo bo gang du gnas she na /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'i ngo bo gang du gnas she na /
translated: In what nature of abiding does it abide?

original: 'di skad du skye ba med pa'i khams ci la gnas pa de la sems can gyi khams gnas so zhes bgyi ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du skye ba med pa'i khams ci la gnas pa de la sems can gyi khams gnas so zhes bgyi ste /
translated: In this way, the realm of sentient beings abides in that which the realm of non-production abides in.

original: gang du yang gnas pa mchis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang du yang gnas pa mchis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of ‚Äúabiding in that which is not a basis of abiding.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu rtog pa ma gtogs par ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu rtog pa ma gtogs par ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, apart from unreal imagination, nothing else exists.

original: kun brtags pa skye bar rnam par rtog pa yang de las logs shig na med do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa skye bar rnam par rtog pa yang de las logs shig na med do //
translated: Imagination of production also does not exist apart from that.

original: dben pa ni rnam par dben pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa ni rnam par dben pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because emptiness is the nature of emptiness itself.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: dben pa las de log pa'i ngo bor yod pa yin na ni stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dben pa las de log pa'i ngo bor yod pa yin na ni stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if it existed as the opposite of emptiness, it would contradict emptiness.

original: tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na yang gzhi dang gnas pa med de 'di'i gnas ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na yang gzhi dang gnas pa med de 'di'i gnas ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are not different, then there is no basis or support, because its support is its own different nature.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems can gyi khams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems can gyi khams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the realm of sentient beings, which is the nature of unreal imagination.

original: de bas na 'di'i gnas ni ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i gnas ni ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no basis for it at all.

original: de bas na gnas skabs de lta bu de la sems can gyi khams gnas pa'i tshig gi don ma rtogs nas gnas dang gnas shes par byed pa'i dngos po ni yang dag pa kho na yin par brgya la 'ga' zhig sems shing smra ba gnas dang gnas par
analyzed: de bas na gnas skabs de lta bu de la sems can gyi khams gnas pa'i tshig gi don ma rtogs nas gnas dang gnas shes par byed pa'i dngos po ni yang dag pa kho na yin par brgya la 'ga' zhig sems shing smra ba gnas dang gnas par
translated: Therefore, not understanding the meaning of the words ‚Äúthe realm of sentient beings abides in such a state,‚Äù someone might think and say that the thing that causes the knowledge of the basis and the abiding is real.

original: byed pa ni dngos su yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: byed pa ni dngos su yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúBut isn‚Äôt the basis and the abiding real?‚Äù

original: de las gzhan ci zhig med pa yin na dam pa gang yin pa bsgom bar bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid bsgom pa ston zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan ci zhig med pa yin na dam pa gang yin pa bsgom bar bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid bsgom pa ston zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat else is there besides that? If it is asked why emptiness is taught to be cultivated in order to cultivate the highest,

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, when you cultivate the perfection of wisdom, at that time‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe bdag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de'i tshe mi gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pas don ci bstan zhe na /üîΩmi gnas par zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas la sogs pa med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang @101a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de'i tshe mi gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pas don ci bstan zhe na / mi gnas par zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas la sogs pa med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang @101a * //
translated: What is the meaning of the passage beginning, ‚ÄúWhen I cultivate the perfection of wisdom, at that time I do not stand in‚Ä¶‚Äù?

original: 'dzin pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa med par bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not stand‚Äù means that, because there is no object or subject, etc., one should not cling to the notions of object and subject, etc.

original: mngon par zhen pa med na yang bsgom pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med na yang bsgom pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If one does not cling, then what is there to cultivate?

original: 'di ltar bsgom pa ni yang nas yang du goms par byed pa yin la /üîΩde yang rnam par rtog pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgom pa ni yang nas yang du goms par byed pa yin la / de yang rnam par rtog pa yin /
translated: Cultivation is the repeated practice of something.üîΩAnd that is conceptual thought.

original: de yang mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: And that is clinging.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi snang ba la don med bzhin du don du mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro snyam pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi snang ba la don med bzhin du don du mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro snyam pa de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is because of the thought that the intrinsic appearance of conceptualization is meaningless, yet one engages in manifest clinging to it as meaningful,

original: 'jam dpal mi gnas pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom du yang ci yod ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal mi gnas pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom du yang ci yod ces gsungs so //
translated: that it is said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, what is there to cultivate in the perfection of wisdom that does not abide?‚Äù

original: gang ci la yang mi gnas pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
analyzed: gang ci la yang mi gnas pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever does not abide anywhere‚Äù and so on is the reply.

original: gang ci la yang mi gnas pa de nyid ces bya ba ni bsgom pa gang yin pa ni ci la yang mngon par zhen par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang ci la yang mi gnas pa de nyid ces bya ba ni bsgom pa gang yin pa ni ci la yang mngon par zhen par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever does not abide anywhere‚Äù means that whatever is cultivated does not cause manifest clinging to anything.

original: gzhung gzhan las gang ci la yang mi gnas te zhes 'byung ba der ni gzung ba dang gnas pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhung gzhan las gang ci la yang mi gnas te zhes 'byung ba der ni gzung ba dang gnas pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In another text, ‚Äúdoes not abide anywhere‚Äù means that there is no manifest clinging to apprehended objects, abodes, and so on.

original: thog mar bsgom pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thog mar bsgom pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: At the beginning, when cultivating, conceptualization arises.

original: yun ring du goms par byas pas gong na med par song zhing mchog tu gsal ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na gcig kho nar de rgyu ba med do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: yun ring du goms par byas pas gong na med par song zhing mchog tu gsal ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na gcig kho nar de rgyu ba med do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: When it has become supreme clarity through long cultivation, it is the state of being unsurpassed, and it is said that it does not move from just that. This is the summarized meaning.üîΩNow, if the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is free from all attachment, then how does the cultivator increase the roots of virtue and decrease the roots of nonvirtue?

original: 'o na gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral ba yin na de ji ltar sgom pa pos dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bri bar byed ces 'ga' zhig dogs pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de'i tshe khyod kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang 'phel ba 'am 'bri bar 'gyur zhes dris
analyzed: 'o na gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral ba yin na de ji ltar sgom pa pos dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bri bar byed ces 'ga' zhig dogs pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de'i tshe khyod kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang 'phel ba 'am 'bri bar 'gyur zhes dris
translated: The Blessed One asked Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, ‚ÄúWhen you cultivate the perfection of wisdom, do your roots of virtue increase or decrease?‚Äù

original: so // 'am zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phyogs 'di bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so // 'am zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phyogs 'di bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù includes the side of nonvirtuous roots.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i tshe bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang 'phel ba 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i tshe bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang 'phel ba 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, at that time, whatever roots of virtue increase for me, etc. is the reply.
