original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;üîΩsmras pa / 'di ltar gang las zhes bya ba 'dzin par byed pa bdag la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par byed pas gang dang 'brel pa'i chos dge ba 'am mi dge ba 'ga' zhig 'phel zhing rgyas par
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ; smras pa / 'di ltar gang las zhes bya ba 'dzin par byed pa bdag la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par byed pas gang dang 'brel pa'i chos dge ba 'am mi dge ba 'ga' zhig 'phel zhing rgyas par
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gyur ba'am / 'bri zhing 'grib par 'gyur @101b bar byed pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'am / 'bri zhing 'grib par 'gyur @101b bar byed pa ma mchis so //
translated: It is said: In this way, the one who holds the view of a self, etc. does not see any virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena that increase and expand, or decrease and diminish, in any way, by cultivating the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di skad du bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan te /
translated: It is taught like this:

original: sems can gang dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dge ba 'phel bar byed pa dang 'grib par byed pa'i sgom pa po ni dge ba'i chos de las logs shig na 'ga' yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: sems can gang dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dge ba 'phel bar byed pa dang 'grib par byed pa'i sgom pa po ni dge ba'i chos de las logs shig na 'ga' yang ma mchis so //
translated: The one who cultivates the increase and decrease of virtue by the power of cultivating the roots of virtue with powerful strength does not exist anywhere apart from those virtuous phenomena.

original: 'on kyang de nyid la brten nas sgro btags pa de byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid la brten nas sgro btags pa de byed pa po yin no //
translated: But it is on the basis of that that the superimposition is made that it is the agent.

original: byed pa po'i tha snyad tsam thams cad kyang de lta bu'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po'i tha snyad tsam thams cad kyang de lta bu'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And all the conventions of agent are of that kind.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo rjes su 'gro ba ni don byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo rjes su 'gro ba ni don byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature that is imagined does not perform a function.

original: de lta mod kyi 'di bsgom pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'di bsgom pa yang yin te /
translated: Nevertheless, this is cultivated,

original: 'di gnyis 'phel ba dang rgyas par bya ba'i ched du 'jug pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'di gnyis 'phel ba dang rgyas par bya ba'i ched du 'jug pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is engaged in for the sake of increasing and expanding these two.

original: / gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na /
translated: And because that is so, it is said:

original: gang yang chos 'ga' zhig 'phel ba'i slad du 'am 'bri ba'i slad du nye bar gnas pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yang chos 'ga' zhig 'phel ba'i slad du 'am 'bri ba'i slad du nye bar gnas pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever exists for the sake of increasing or decreasing some phenomenon . . .‚Äù

original: gal te mi dge ba 'am dge ba 'bri ba'am rgyas par bya ba'i don du 'di 'jug pa ma yin na de ji ltar go rims bzhin du so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba 'am dge ba 'bri ba'am rgyas par bya ba'i don du 'di 'jug pa ma yin na de ji ltar go rims bzhin du so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar 'gyur /
translated: If it is not engaged for the sake of increasing or decreasing the unwholesome and the wholesome, then how does it abandon the passions of ordinary beings, in order, as they are described?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa len par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa len par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you think that one would then take up the qualities of a buddha, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses,

original: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das gang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang mi spong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das gang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang mi spong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: then the BhagavƒÅn says, ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn does not abandon the qualities of ordinary beings,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: ci shin tu bsgoms pa'i dbang gis so so'i skye bo'i chos spong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bskyed pa med pa nyid kyis spong ba med pa dang / len pa med pa zhes brjod dam /
analyzed: ci shin tu bsgoms pa'i dbang gis so so'i skye bo'i chos spong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bskyed pa med pa nyid kyis spong ba med pa dang / len pa med pa zhes brjod dam /
translated: Is it that one is said to not abandon and not take up because one does not abandon the qualities of ordinary beings and generate the qualities of a buddha through the power of thorough cultivation?

original: 'on te mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shin tu bsgoms pa las byung ba'i 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang pos gang gi tshe rtsal gyur pa de'i tshe rtsol ba med par yang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shin tu bsgoms pa las byung ba'i 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang pos gang gi tshe rtsal gyur pa de'i tshe rtsol ba med par yang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Or is it that when one has the power of the ƒÅrya‚Äôs wisdom arisen from thorough cultivation through the method of nonapprehending, at that time one abandons the qualities of ordinary beings without effort,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang mngon sum du 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang mngon sum du 'gyur /
translated: and the qualities of a buddha manifest?

original: de dag ni rang las ma gtogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir spong ba med pa dang / len pa med pa zhes brjod ces bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yongs su 'dri ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rang las ma gtogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir spong ba med pa dang / len pa med pa zhes brjod ces bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yongs su 'dri ba'i don yin no //
translated: Because they do not apprehend anything other than themselves, they are said to be without abandonment and without appropriation. This is the meaning of the question regarding the reason.

original: de la 'dir nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir phyogs dang po ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir phyogs dang po ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is not the case that the first position is untenable because it would lead to the absence of the occasion of affliction and purification.

original: 'on kyang 'og ma ltar yin pas /üîΩbcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes @102a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'og ma ltar yin pas / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes @102a * //
translated: However, it is as follows.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Bhagavan, it is like this: the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom...

original: chos gang rnam par byang ba 'am kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs pas chos gang la yang mi gnas pa ni so so'i skye bo dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos go rims bzhin du spang pa 'am blang ba rnams gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gang rnam par byang ba 'am kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs pas chos gang la yang mi gnas pa ni so so'i skye bo dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos go rims bzhin du spang pa 'am blang ba rnams gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not dwelling on any dharma due to the apprehension of purification or affliction is free from the characteristic of grasping the abandonment or adoption of the dharmas of ordinary beings and buddhas, respectively.

original: gal te de dag 'ga' la yang dmigs pas mi gnas na /
analyzed: gal te de dag 'ga' la yang dmigs pas mi gnas na /
translated: If they do not abide in the observation of any of these,

original: 'o na ji ltar srid ba'i nyes pa brgal ba la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / de dang bral ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dmigs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar srid ba'i nyes pa brgal ba la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / de dang bral ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dmigs she na /
translated: then how do they observe the faults of cyclic existence and the virtues of nirvana, which are the things to be rejected and adopted?

original: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das gang 'khor ba'i skyon du yang mchi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das gang 'khor ba'i skyon du yang mchi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavan is said to be ‚Äúnot observed as the fault of cyclic existence,‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'khor ba'i skyon dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan du mchi ba dang / nye bar dmigs pa dang / rtog pa'i bar du ma lags pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan du mchi ba dang / nye bar dmigs pa dang / rtog pa'i bar du ma lags pa'o //
translated: He is not observed as the fault of cyclic existence and the virtue of nirvana, nor is he imagined as such.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa gang gis smras /üîΩci med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa gang gis smras / ci med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Is it because he does not exist?

original: 'on te yod kyang dmigs par mi rung ba'i phyir yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yod kyang dmigs par mi rung ba'i phyir yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it because, although he exists, he is not a suitable object of observation?

original: rtog pa dang po ltar na ni nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar rnam par gzhag pa de nyid mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang po ltar na ni nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar rnam par gzhag pa de nyid mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the first case, then the presentation of affliction and purification is not tenable.

original: rtog pa gnyis pa ltar na ni rigs pa min pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa gnyis pa ltar na ni rigs pa min pas de'i phyir /
translated: In the second case, it is not reasonable. Therefore,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar 'khor ba nyid kyang mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar 'khor ba nyid kyang mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThus, if even sa·πÉsƒÅra is not seen . . .‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this:

original: 'dod chags la sogs nyon mongs bsgos //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs nyon mongs bsgos //
translated: The afflictions such as attachment are cultivated.

original: sems nyid dag ni 'khor ba yin //
analyzed: sems nyid dag ni 'khor ba yin //
translated: The mind itself is sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de nyid de dang bral ba na //
analyzed: de nyid de dang bral ba na //
translated: When it is free from that,

original: srid pa'i mtha' zhes rab tu bshad //
analyzed: srid pa'i mtha' zhes rab tu bshad //
translated: it is explained to be the end of existence.

original: de bas na mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin goms pa'i rgyu des 'khor ba'i bdag nyid 'bad pa med par rnam par log ste /üîΩdu ma dang gcig la sogs par spros pa'i tshogs dang bral te rab tu zhi bar zhugs pa'i rgyun bar ma chad pa ji srid 'khor ba ma lus pa'i srid pa'i rgya mtshor bying ba'i 'gro ba gdon pa la mkhas pa byung ba ni mya ngan las 'das
analyzed: de bas na mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin goms pa'i rgyu des 'khor ba'i bdag nyid 'bad pa med par rnam par log ste / du ma dang gcig la sogs par spros pa'i tshogs dang bral te rab tu zhi bar zhugs pa'i rgyun bar ma chad pa ji srid 'khor ba ma lus pa'i srid pa'i rgya mtshor bying ba'i 'gro ba gdon pa la mkhas pa byung ba ni mya ngan las 'das
translated: Therefore, by the cause of cultivating the samƒÅdhi of nonobservation, the nature of sa·πÉsƒÅra is effortlessly reversed.

original: pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Free from the collection of elaborations such as many and one, it is the stream of entry into peace. As long as there are beings remaining in the ocean of existence of the entire realm of sa·πÉsƒÅra, the arising of the skill in delivering beings is called nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de bas na sems las ma gtogs par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis dang / de'i skyon dang yon tan dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sems las ma gtogs par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis dang / de'i skyon dang yon tan dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, apart from mind, neither cyclic existence nor nirvana, nor the faults and virtues of those two, are perceived.

original: rang rig pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by self-awareness.

original: rang rig pas yin na @102b ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por gyur pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang rig pas yin na @102b ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por gyur pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it were by self-awareness, it would be a thing that is the object of apprehension and apprehender, and that is not correct.

original: de lta na gdul bya 'khor ba'i nang nas ji lta ji ltar dogs pa'i yid skye ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis dngos su lan glan zin kyang de'i dogs pa skye ba'i rgyun rnams la dogs pa skyed cing dogs pa bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na gdul bya 'khor ba'i nang nas ji lta ji ltar dogs pa'i yid skye ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis dngos su lan glan zin kyang de'i dogs pa skye ba'i rgyun rnams la dogs pa skyed cing dogs pa bsal bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the way in which the minds of disciples are generated with doubts about cyclic existence has been directly answered in the manner explained above. Nevertheless, the continuums of those who have doubts will generate doubts about the causes of those doubts and will be cleared of those doubts.

original: de lta ma yin na thog ma nyid du gzhag pa kho nas dogs pa'i skabs ma lus pa med pas bshad pa phyi ma rnams brtsam mi dgos par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thog ma nyid du gzhag pa kho nas dogs pa'i skabs ma lus pa med pas bshad pa phyi ma rnams brtsam mi dgos par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, since there would be no occasion for doubt at all from the very beginning, it would follow that it would be unnecessary to compose the later explanations.

original: srid pa'i skyon dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan ma mthong na bsgom pa 'dis ji ltar mthong ba'i lam skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: srid pa'i skyon dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan ma mthong na bsgom pa 'dis ji ltar mthong ba'i lam skyed par byed cing /
translated: If one does not see the faults of cyclic existence and the virtues of nirvana, how can this meditation generate the path of seeing?

original: bsgom pa'i lam 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam 'dzin par byed /
translated: And how can it maintain the path of meditation?

original: de gnyis kyis sgrib pa thams cad la nges par 'byin pa sgrub par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩ'dir bcom ldan 'das chos gang la yang blang ba 'am /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis sgrib pa thams cad la nges par 'byin pa sgrub par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / 'dir bcom ldan 'das chos gang la yang blang ba 'am /
translated: And how can those two establish definite emergence from all obscurations?üîΩHere the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúIn this, there is nothing to be taken up or grasped,

original: gzung ba'am / dor ba ma mchis pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzung ba'am / dor ba ma mchis pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and nothing to be rejected.‚Äù

original: dor ba ni spangs pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dor ba ni spangs pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRejection‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúdefinite emergence.‚Äù

original: chos gang la yang zhes bya ba ni gang las kyang zhes bya bas rnam par dbye ba bsgyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yang zhes bya ba ni gang las kyang zhes bya bas rnam par dbye ba bsgyur bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this‚Äù means ‚Äúfrom anything.‚Äù

original: len par byed pa'i byed pa po dang 'dzin par byed pa'i bdag nyid mi srid pa'i phyir blang ba'am ste ;
analyzed: len par byed pa'i byed pa po dang 'dzin par byed pa'i bdag nyid mi srid pa'i phyir blang ba'am ste ;
translated: Because there is no agent who takes up or a self that grasps, there is nothing to be taken up or grasped.

original: blang bar bya ba 'am gzhan du yang rung mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba 'am gzhan du yang rung mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is impossible to take up or to put down.

original: de bas na /üîΩmthong bsgom chos kyi ngo bo yi //
analyzed: de bas na / mthong bsgom chos kyi ngo bo yi //
translated: Therefore,üîΩthis perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa 'di //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa 'di //
translated: the essence of the Dharma of seeing and meditation,

original: goms pa 'phel bar gyur na ni //
analyzed: goms pa 'phel bar gyur na ni //
translated: when it is cultivated and increases,

original: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa yin /üîΩ// /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa yin / // /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: it is the relinquishment of all obscurations.üîΩThe Extensive Explanation of the Perfection of Wisdom

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Sutra in Seven Hundred Lines

original: 'ga' zhig yang srid pa'i skyon bsal ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos bskyed par go rims bzhin du de bzhin nyid 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba mngon par zhen nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yang srid pa'i skyon bsal ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos bskyed par go rims bzhin du de bzhin nyid 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba mngon par zhen nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Some, having conceived of the decrease and increase of suchness in order, respectively, to eliminate the faults of existence and to generate the qualities of purification, think as follows:

original: blang ba dang gzung ba dang dor ba gal te med na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i sems can gyi khams de 'grib pa dang 'phel bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: blang ba dang gzung ba dang dor ba gal te med na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i sems can gyi khams de 'grib pa dang 'phel bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If there is no taking up, no grasping, and no putting down, how could the realm of sentient beings belonging to cyclic existence and nirvana decrease and increase?

original: sgrib pa dang spangs pa yod na ni gdags su rung ngo zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang spangs pa yod na ni gdags su rung ngo zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If there were obscuration and abandonment, then designation would be tenable.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang 'grib pa dang zhes @103a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang 'grib pa dang zhes @103a * //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúWhatever dharma does not diminish‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes 'dis khungs 'dri ba'i bsam ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes 'dis khungs 'dri ba'i bsam ba ci zhe na /
translated: This question is asked with the intention of inquiring into the source.

original: ci rig par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: ci rig par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'am /
translated: Is it because the object of knowledge is not endowed with the characteristic of being perceived, or

original: 'on te de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩde la rnam par rtog pa dang po ni rang rig pas de dmigs pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no // de la rnam par rtog pa dang po ni rang rig pas de dmigs pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: is it because it does not exist?

original: rig par bya ba la brtags na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig par bya ba la brtags na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the first case, if the object of knowledge is examined, it does not exist.

original: de bas na 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ltar 'dod pa yin pa'i rigs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ltar 'dod pa yin pa'i rigs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, here the second case is accepted. The reasoning is as follows.

original: bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúNon-arising‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: skye ba med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Non-arising is emptiness.

original: skye ba med pa de'i tshul gyis na 'grib pa dang 'phel ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa de'i tshul gyis na 'grib pa dang 'phel ba ma mchis te /
translated: By that way of non-production, there is no decrease or increase,

original: dus thams cad du ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the one essence at all times.

original: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba de ni rgyas pa dang 'phel bar brtags pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba de ni rgyas pa dang 'phel bar brtags pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: That decrease and increase is the essence imagined as expansion and increase.

original: brtags pa ni lan 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa ni lan 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Imagination never exists.

original: yod pa gang yin pa sngon du song ba yin na ni bri ba yin te /
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa sngon du song ba yin na ni bri ba yin te /
translated: If what exists is prior, then it is diminished,

original: de ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba tsam yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba tsam yin par bstan to //
translated: and that is taught to be merely the separation from adventitious defilement.üîΩBlessed One, that meditation is the meditation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar sgom pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so zhes tshig lan du mar smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar sgom pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so zhes tshig lan du mar smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it mentioned as an answer to the words?

original: bsgom pa gces par bstan pas sgrub pa po rnams kyi brtson 'grus 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa gces par bstan pas sgrub pa po rnams kyi brtson 'grus 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to increase the effort of the practitioners by teaching the importance of meditation.

original: byed pa po la sogs pa med na stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'i yon tan skye ba dang / sgrib pa thams cad spang ba 'di la ji ltar brtson par byed ce na /
analyzed: byed pa po la sogs pa med na stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'i yon tan skye ba dang / sgrib pa thams cad spang ba 'di la ji ltar brtson par byed ce na /
translated: If there is no agent, etc., how can one strive for the arising of the qualities of the powers, the limbs of enlightenment, etc., and the abandonment of all obscurations?

original: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang yang skye ba 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang yang skye ba 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúIf there is no arising of any dharma, etc.‚Äù

original: byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no agent and because there is no cause for destruction.

original: gzhan du gyur pa'i byed pas stong zhing rkyen 'di pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'i byed pas stong zhing rkyen 'di pa tsam yin no //
translated: It is empty of the activity of transformation and is merely this condition.

original: 'gag pa dang skye ba'i dngos po med na nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i yan lag rnams 'bri ba dang rgyas pa nyid du ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'gag pa dang skye ba'i dngos po med na nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i yan lag rnams 'bri ba dang rgyas pa nyid du ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: If there is no entity that ceases and arises, how can the limbs of affliction and purification be diminished and increased?

original: byed pa med pas na /
analyzed: byed pa med pas na /
translated: Because there is no agent,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang 'grib pa 'am rgyas par mi bgyid pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang 'grib pa 'am rgyas par mi bgyid pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúIf there is no diminishing or increasing of any dharma, etc.‚Äù

original: byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: because there is no activity and because there is no cause for destruction.

original: @103b gal te de ltar spros pa med pa yin na ji ltar stobs bcu dang / sa gong nas gong du gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang 'brel ba'i yon tan rnams de tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: @103b gal te de ltar spros pa med pa yin na ji ltar stobs bcu dang / sa gong nas gong du gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang 'brel ba'i yon tan rnams de tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: If it is free from conceptual elaboration in this way, how does it seek the ten powers and the qualities associated with the bodhisattvas who are situated on the higher spiritual levels?

original: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos la yang mi smon cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos la yang mi smon cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Hence, the Lord declares, ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti, he does not even aspire to the inconceivable Dharma.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa dag par gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa dag par gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The inconceivable Dharma is that which is endowed with all the aspects of the qualities of the TathƒÅgata and is well-established.

original: nyi tshe ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
translated: The limited is the bodhisattva;

original: dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun gyi cha nyi tshe ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun gyi cha nyi tshe ste /
translated: because he is only a part of the stream of stainless intuition,

original: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because he is devoid of the abandonment of all the obscurations.

original: ci'i phyir mi smon zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi smon zhe na /
translated: Why does he not aspire to it?

original: de'i phyir 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das gang la smon pa dang gang gis smon pa de nyid kyang ma mchis pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das gang la smon pa dang gang gis smon pa de nyid kyang ma mchis pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagav√•n said, ‚ÄúBut that which is aspired to and that by which it is aspired to do not exist.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: ‚Äú But‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he teaches the reason.

original: de yang las dang byed pa por gyur pa'i dngos po go rims bzhin du smon par bya ba gang yin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang las dang byed pa por gyur pa'i dngos po go rims bzhin du smon par bya ba gang yin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the thing that is the agent and the thing that is aspired to do not exist, respectively.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni byed pa po la sogs pa thams cad phan tshun bye brag bsgrubs pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni byed pa po la sogs pa thams cad phan tshun bye brag bsgrubs pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: Here, the reason is indicated by ‚Äúall such as the agent are established as mutually distinct,‚Äù and so forth.

original: gal te bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / nyi tshe pa'i chos yod pa ma yin na de ji ltar go rims bzhin du mchog nyid dang / tha ma nyid du mthong zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / nyi tshe pa'i chos yod pa ma yin na de ji ltar go rims bzhin du mchog nyid dang / tha ma nyid du mthong zhe na /
translated: If inconceivable and limited phenomena do not exist, then how can they be seen as supreme and inferior, respectively?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni mchog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni mchog go //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat's cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is as follows: One does not abide, thinking, These phenomena are supreme,

original: chos 'di dag ni tha ma'o zhes bgyi bar nye bar mi gnas shing zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni tha ma'o zhes bgyi bar nye bar mi gnas shing zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: these phenomena are inferior.

original: sbyor ba'i dus na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dus na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is, At the time of application.

original: gal te phyis 'jug pa na dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na yang /
analyzed: gal te phyis 'jug pa na dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na yang /
translated: If one thinks, Later, when one enters, there will be an object,

original: chos gang dag mchog dang tha mar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos gang dag mchog dang tha mar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the Bhagavat says, Those phenomena that would be supreme or inferior are not apprehended.

original: rig par bya ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rig par bya ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is, Because it is not reasonable to cognize them.

original: kyang gi sgra ni gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir yang yin no //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir yang yin no //
translated: The word also indicates a reason.

original: 'o na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams phan tshun ltos nas gnas dman pa nyid du ji ltar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams phan tshun ltos nas gnas dman pa nyid du ji ltar mthong zhe na /
translated: Well, if the phenomena of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas are mutually dependent, how are they seen as inferior?

original: dmigs pa can de dag gi lan ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa can de dag gi lan ni /
translated: The answer for those with objects is:

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'i rnal 'byor la zhes @104a * //üîΩbya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'i rnal 'byor la zhes @104a * // bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the yoga of the perfection of wisdom meditation, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i chos bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i chos bzhi yin no //
translated: Thus means the four dharmas of the Buddha and Bodhisattva.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The yoga of the perfection of wisdom meditation itself is samadhi.

original: de la brtson pa ni goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la brtson pa ni goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Striving in that is cultivation.

original: rigs kyi bu'i sgra ni mchod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'i sgra ni mchod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word son of noble family is a word of worship.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i'o //
translated: All dharmas means those associated with the Sravakas, etc.

original: mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pas kyang nyams su ma myong ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pas kyang nyams su ma myong ba'o //
translated: One does not apprehend means that one does not experience even non-conceptually.

original: de bas na de nyid kyi phyir de sngon du song ba can gyi rtog pas kyang mi rtog go //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid kyi phyir de sngon du song ba can gyi rtog pas kyang mi rtog go //
translated: Therefore, because of that, one does not conceptualize even with conceptualization that has that as its antecedent.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyams su myong ba med du zin kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi rtog pa rang dbang can go ci ste mi 'byung /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba med du zin kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi rtog pa rang dbang can go ci ste mi 'byung /
translated: Even if there is no experience, why would an autonomous conceptual thought not occur?

original: de gang du 'jug pa na dngos po gang la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de gang du 'jug pa na dngos po gang la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: When it engages, does it not engage with any thing?

original: lan ni / bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no ;
analyzed: lan ni / bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no ;
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, in non-arising‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: / rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa thams cad dang bral pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa thams cad dang bral pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: In the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom free from all connection with conceptuality, the nature of conceptuality does not exist. This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: skye ba med pa la med du zin kyang chos thams cad la yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la med du zin kyang chos thams cad la yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if it does not exist in non-arising, it does not exist in all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir / de bzhin nyid de'i bdag nyid dang chos thams cad kyi bar du ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de bzhin nyid de'i bdag nyid dang chos thams cad kyi bar du ste /
translated: Therefore, that suchness is the nature of all phenomena up to the end of all phenomena.

original: de'i ngo bo la yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo la yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It also does not exist in its nature.

original: bar la zhes smos pas ni yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: bar la zhes smos pas ni yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase and so on includes the limit of reality, signlessness, the ultimate, and so on.

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir smos /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir smos /
translated: Why does he mention non-production, etc.?

original: skabs la mkho ba yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad smos pa ni rigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skabs la mkho ba yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad smos pa ni rigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is reasonable to mention all things because they are needed in this context.

original: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: de kho na nyid bsgoms pa ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa 'di sngon du byas te 'jug pa yin pas rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'thad pa de ni rnam par rtog pa 'di'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsgoms pa ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa 'di sngon du byas te 'jug pa yin pas rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'thad pa de ni rnam par rtog pa 'di'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the cultivation of reality is preceded by this non-production, etc., that is, since it is engaged in, the objection and the misconception are not tenable, because there is no occasion for this misconception.

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pa rnams ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par brten pa la 'chel ba 'di dag rang dbang dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pa rnams ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par brten pa la 'chel ba 'di dag rang dbang dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not understand non-production, etc., as they are, are attached to the conceptual elaborations of grasping, etc., and they become independent.

original: yang na 'bri ba'i bsam ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'bri ba'i bsam ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Or, the thought of the objection is this:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos mi dmigs pa de ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos mi dmigs pa de ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable that the buddhas and bodhisattvas do not objectify the Dharma,

original: de @104b dag ni dmigs pa'i tshogs mtha' dag dang mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de @104b dag ni dmigs pa'i tshogs mtha' dag dang mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: because they are not in accord with the entire collection of objectifications.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pas de dag gi mi dmigs pa ji ltar yin zhe na /üîΩbcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la mchog gam /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pas de dag gi mi dmigs pa ji ltar yin zhe na / bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la mchog gam /
translated: But it is not so for the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. So how is it that they do not objectify?

original: tha ma zhes bgyi ba gang yang ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: tha ma zhes bgyi ba gang yang ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Because, Blessed One, there is no highest or lowest in non-production.

original: dmigs pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúobjectification exists‚Äù is a remainder.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs dang mi mthun ba med pa yin na dmigs par mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa yod pa yin mod ce na /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs dang mi mthun ba med pa yin na dmigs par mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa yod pa yin mod ce na /
translated: If the dharmas of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. are not in conflict with the collection of conceptual thoughts, then it is indeed the case that the adherence to objectification is active.

original: dmigs par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the objectified does not exist.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'grub pa'i rigs pa ni thams cad du mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'grub pa'i rigs pa ni thams cad du mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning in brief is this: the reason that the characteristics of the apprehended are not established is in agreement with all of these.

original: tshig lhag ma dang bcas te bshad par bya ba 'di ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma dang bcas te bshad par bya ba 'di ni nges pa yin no //
translated: This is a definitive explanation that is not to be taken literally.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: mchog dang tha ma'i rang gi mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog dang tha ma'i rang gi mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the positions of defilement and purification would be undermined, since there would be no supreme and inferior characteristics.

original: de ltar dogs pa ngan pa 'phros pa rnams rim gyis bsal du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar dogs pa ngan pa 'phros pa rnams rim gyis bsal du zin kyang /
translated: Although these kinds of bad doubts have been gradually dispelled,

original: kha cig yang bstan pa'i dogs pa skyes pa /
analyzed: kha cig yang bstan pa'i dogs pa skyes pa /
translated: some still have doubts about the teaching.

original: gal te nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos dmigs su yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos dmigs su yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the dharmas of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on are not apprehended,

original: ji ltar de la ltos nas sangs rgyas kyi chos mchog yin par rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de la ltos nas sangs rgyas kyi chos mchog yin par rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: then how can the supreme dharmas of the Buddha be posited in dependence on them?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Therefore the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mchog ma yin nam zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mchog ma yin nam zhes gsungs te /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, are not the qualities of the Buddha supreme?

original: zur gyis ston to //
analyzed: zur gyis ston to //
translated: He teaches indirectly.

original: lan du gzung du ma mchis pa'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni mchog lags so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du gzung du ma mchis pa'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni mchog lags so zhes gsungs te /
translated: The reply is, ‚ÄúBecause they are ungrasped, the qualities of the Buddha are supreme.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddha has abandoned all the superimpositions of duality and all obscurations.

original: de lta ma yin na nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos las mchog yin par bstan du ci zhig yod ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos las mchog yin par bstan du ci zhig yod ;
translated: Otherwise, what would be the point of teaching that they are supreme over the qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on?

original: gal te gtan tshigs yod pa'i phyir gzung du med pa kho na yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs yod pa'i phyir gzung du med pa kho na yin na ni /
translated: If they are ungrasped only because of the existence of a reason,

original: 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mchog yin par gang gis gzhag par bya /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mchog yin par gang gis gzhag par bya /
translated: then by what are the qualities of the Buddha established as supreme?

original: re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pas ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not established as supreme by the TathƒÅgata,

original: yul de la dri ma med pa'i ye shes mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin @105a * //
analyzed: yul de la dri ma med pa'i ye shes mi srid pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin @105a * //
translated: because it is impossible for him to have stainless wisdom with regard to that object.

original: gshegs pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gshegs pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not establish them as supremeüîΩbecause he has no conceptualization.

original: de'i rang rig pa tsam gyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa na mchog la sogs par rnam par rtog pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes de ltar 'og nas 'byung ba'i don gyi de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang rig pa tsam gyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa na mchog la sogs par rnam par rtog pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes de ltar 'og nas 'byung ba'i don gyi de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to clarify the meaning of the suchness that will be explained below,

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad stong par de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags sam zhes zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad stong par de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags sam zhes zhus so //
translated: the question is asked, ‚ÄúBhagavan, is it the case that the Tathagata fully and completely realized all phenomena to be empty?‚Äù

original: 'dir mdor na 'di yin te /üîΩstong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de 'dra ba yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa dag bsod nams dang ldan pas rnyed par 'gyur ro
analyzed: 'dir mdor na 'di yin te / stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de 'dra ba yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa dag bsod nams dang ldan pas rnyed par 'gyur ro
translated: In brief, this is the meaning here:üîΩThose who possess merit will find such conceptions as ‚Äúall phenomena are empty‚Äù to be the cause for engaging in reality, which has the nature of emptiness.

original: // de dag kyang chos thams cad stong pa yin par ston pas thugs su chud do zhes lhag par zhen to //
analyzed: // de dag kyang chos thams cad stong pa yin par ston pas thugs su chud do zhes lhag par zhen to //
translated: They also think, ‚ÄúThe Tathagata realized that all phenomena are empty,‚Äù and they cling to that.

original: de bas na de dag gi lhag par zhen pa'i dor byas te /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi lhag par zhen pa'i dor byas te /
translated: Therefore, one should discard their excessive attachment.

original: dang po sbyor ba na mnyan pa la sogs pas yid la byed pa dang mthun par de skad bstan to //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba na mnyan pa la sogs pas yid la byed pa dang mthun par de skad bstan to //
translated: When one first practices, one should teach them in that way, in accordance with their mental activity, such as listening.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid rnam par rtog pas ma sbags pa nyid mngon par byang chub pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid rnam par rtog pas ma sbags pa nyid mngon par byang chub pa yin no //
translated: Enlightenment is the state of emptiness, which is the nature of mere self-awareness, uncontaminated by conceptualization.

original: gal te de lta yin na de'i phyir stong pa nyid la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bdag nyid dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid dag gdags shing dmigs te /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na de'i phyir stong pa nyid la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bdag nyid dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid dag gdags shing dmigs te /
translated: If that is so, then the nature of the Buddha's qualities and the nature of the qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. are designated and observed in emptiness.

original: rtog pa thams cad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because all conceptualization does not exist, that is the meaning.

original: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du mchog tu dga' ba'i don bstan pas 'jam pa'i dbyangs la gus pa skyes pa rnams kyi dang ba 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du mchog tu dga' ba'i don bstan pas 'jam pa'i dbyangs la gus pa skyes pa rnams kyi dang ba 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, by teaching the meaning of supreme joy in every way, the BhagavƒÅn spoke ‚ÄúExcellent, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, excellent!‚Äù and so forth in order to increase the faith of those who have developed respect for Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: tshig gi don 'di thams cad gsal bar spyod yul ma yin du zin kyang smra bar byed pas mngon sum du rtogs pa bzhin du brjod pa la ngo mtshar du gyur nas yang legs so zhes smras so //
analyzed: tshig gi don 'di thams cad gsal bar spyod yul ma yin du zin kyang smra bar byed pas mngon sum du rtogs pa bzhin du brjod pa la ngo mtshar du gyur nas yang legs so zhes smras so //
translated: Although all these meanings of the words are not objects of clear experience, since they are expressed, they are stated as if directly realized.

original: yang na rang gis smra bar 'dod pa gsal bar brjod pa'i phyir rab tu dgyes ches te yin no //
analyzed: yang na rang gis smra bar 'dod pa gsal bar brjod pa'i phyir rab tu dgyes ches te yin no //
translated: Or, it is because he is extremely pleased to clearly express what he himself wishes to say.

original: yang na 'di dag la legs par smras pa yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i ched du yang yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'di dag la legs par smras pa yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i ched du yang yin no //
translated: Or, it is also for the purpose of ascertaining that these are well-spoken.

original: de ltar gsal bar bstan du zin kyang kha cig gi blo 'khyog pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di skyes pa ni mchog nyid yin par bcom ldan @105b 'das kyis kyang ma mkhyen na ji ltar bla na med pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar gsal bar bstan du zin kyang kha cig gi blo 'khyog pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di skyes pa ni mchog nyid yin par bcom ldan @105b 'das kyis kyang ma mkhyen na ji ltar bla na med pa yin /
translated: Although it is taught in this way, some people have the following crooked thought: ‚ÄúIf even the Lord did not know what is supreme, how could it be unsurpassed?

original: bla na yod pa kho nar 'gyur te mchog nyid du mi mngon pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: bla na yod pa kho nar 'gyur te mchog nyid du mi mngon pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos bzhin no zhe na /
translated: It would be only surpassed, because it is not seen to be supreme, like the teachings of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bla na med pa yin nam zhes gsungs so//
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bla na med pa yin nam zhes gsungs so//
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, are the qualities of the Buddha unsurpassed?‚Äù

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ replied,

original: de de ltar lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúYes, that is so, and so on.‚Äù

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i brjod par bzhed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i brjod par bzhed pa gang zhe na /
translated: Why is that? What is meant by this question?

original: gleng ba'i gnas skabs de kho na bzhin te /
analyzed: gleng ba'i gnas skabs de kho na bzhin te /
translated: It is the same as the topic of discussion.

original: cung zad kyang lan ma glan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad kyang lan ma glan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that he did not answer at all.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gi dgongs pa ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gi dgongs pa ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavat, it is thus‚Äù and so on shows his own intention.

original: cung zad tsam yang ste phra mo tsam yang chos bla na med pa la sogs par rnam par bzhag pa'i rnam par rtog pa sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag la ma mchis te /
analyzed: cung zad tsam yang ste phra mo tsam yang chos bla na med pa la sogs par rnam par bzhag pa'i rnam par rtog pa sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag la ma mchis te /
translated: There is not even the slightest, not even the subtlest conceptual thought in those Buddha dharmas, which are posited as the unexcelled dharmas and so on.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma dmigs te /
translated: Because the Bhagavat does not apprehend them.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has abandoned all the seeds of conceptual thought.

original: sa bon dang mi ldan pa'i rgyu des na de dag ni bla na med pa sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid kyi chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon dang mi ldan pa'i rgyu des na de dag ni bla na med pa sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid kyi chos zhes bya ste /
translated: By that cause of being seedless, they are called the unexcelled dharmas of the Buddha nature.

original: de'i gong na mchog cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i gong na mchog cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: There is not even the slightest superior to that.

original: gzhan dag yang rnam par rtog pa bsgom pa 'di gal te rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba yin na de ji ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsgrub pa'i ched du
analyzed: gzhan dag yang rnam par rtog pa bsgom pa 'di gal te rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba yin na de ji ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsgrub pa'i ched du
translated: Others again think: If this cultivation of conceptualization is free from all conceptualization, then how does it engage

original: 'jug par bgyid /
analyzed: 'jug par bgyid /
translated: in order to accomplish the qualities of a Buddha on the stage of devoted engagement, the period of the aids to penetration?

original: spyod par bgyid ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: spyod par bgyid ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: How does it practice?

original: ji ltar yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis so so'i skye bo'i chos dag rtsa nas gdon pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos nye ba rnams mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis so so'i skye bo'i chos dag rtsa nas gdon pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos nye ba rnams mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa lags /
translated: How does it engage on the ten bodhisattva stages, in order to eradicate the qualities of ordinary beings by means of both the path of insight and the path of cultivation, and in order to manifest the proximate qualities of a Buddha?

original: 'dul ba ni nye ba rnams mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni nye ba rnams mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Subjugation is the manifestation of the proximate qualities.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu 'od la mngon du gyur pa rnams 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir dang / kun tu bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu 'od la mngon du gyur pa rnams 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir dang / kun tu bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa lags /
translated: How does it engage in order to grasp the manifest qualities on the Buddha stage of Universal Light, and in order to protect them?

original: 'di skad bstan te /üîΩnges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams su nye bar ma gyur pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / nye bar gyur @106a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams su nye bar ma gyur pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / nye bar gyur @106a * //
translated: This is taught:

original: pa rnams mngon du bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon du byas pa rnams 'dzin cing bskyang ba'i phyir mchog tu brtson pa 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa rnams mngon du bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon du byas pa rnams 'dzin cing bskyang ba'i phyir mchog tu brtson pa 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because of the absence of supreme effort to generate those not yet arisen in the paths of preparation, learner, and nonlearner, to actualize those that are arisen, and to maintain and protect those that are actualized.üîΩBecause of being nonconceptual, like the continuum of mind that has just arisen in the present.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir da lta bur byung ma thag pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyun bzhin no zhe na 'di'i lan go rims bzhin du gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir da lta bur byung ma thag pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyun bzhin no zhe na 'di'i lan go rims bzhin du gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: To answer this, in order, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sgrub par yang mi bgyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sgrub par yang mi bgyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Bhagavan, moreover, those who do not practice the qualities of the Buddha...

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover means again.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni byed pa po la sogs pa thams cad kyi bye brag ni phan tshun nye bar bsgrubs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni byed pa po la sogs pa thams cad kyi bye brag ni phan tshun nye bar bsgrubs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin pa'o //
translated: The argument here is that all distinctions of the agent and so on are mutually established.

original: 'on te 'phags pa rang nyid kyis ci'i phyir gtan tshigs ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'on te 'phags pa rang nyid kyis ci'i phyir gtan tshigs ma gsungs she na /
translated: But why did the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna not state the argument?

original: nye ba na gnas pa'i gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas rnam par rtog pa'i ched du 'di brtsams pa yin la /
analyzed: nye ba na gnas pa'i gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas rnam par rtog pa'i ched du 'di brtsams pa yin la /
translated: This treatise was composed for the purpose of conceptualizing the absence of error in dependence on the distinctions of disciples who are nearby.

original: gdul bya de yang skyon med pa'i dngos po bstan pa la gtan tshigs bstan pa med par yang the tshom med par phyin ci ma log pa'i don yang dag par rtogs par 'gyur bar dgongs nas rigs pa bstan par ma byas kyi gzhan du ni bstan pa khoüîΩna yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya de yang skyon med pa'i dngos po bstan pa la gtan tshigs bstan pa med par yang the tshom med par phyin ci ma log pa'i don yang dag par rtogs par 'gyur bar dgongs nas rigs pa bstan par ma byas kyi gzhan du ni bstan pa khoüîΩna yin no //
translated: And the master thought that the disciple would understand the nonerroneous meaning without doubt even without the statement of the argument in the teaching of the absence of error, but he did not teach the argument elsewhere.

original: gzhan dag rnam par rtog pa 'di dag la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba yin na mnyan pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis don rnam par shes par byed pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis de nyid sems par byed pa dang /üîΩbsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis de nyid yang yang du goms par byed pa dang / yod ming gnyis don yul can ni //üîΩmnyam las byung ba'i blo sogs yin //
analyzed: gzhan dag rnam par rtog pa 'di dag la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba yin na mnyan pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis don rnam par shes par byed pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis de nyid sems par byed pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis de nyid yang yang du goms par byed pa dang / yod ming gnyis don yul can ni // mnyam las byung ba'i blo sogs yin //
translated: If these conceptions are free from the aspects of apprehendeds and apprehenders, how could it be tenable that they are consciousnesses of things, in the manner of being consciousnesses arisen from hearing, that think of things, in the manner of being consciousnesses arisen from thinking, that repeatedly familiarize with things, in the manner of being consciousnesses arisen from meditation, and that are the supreme of all consciousnesses?

original: zhes bya ba de ji ltar rung /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ji ltar rung /
translated: It is not tenable that they are consciousnesses of things, in the manner of being consciousnesses arisen from hearing, that think of things, in the manner of being consciousnesses arisen from thinking, that repeatedly familiarize with things, in the manner of being consciousnesses arisen from meditation, and that are the supreme of all consciousnesses.

original: mchog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir snang byed bzhin du gcig pu kho na smra'o zhe na /
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir snang byed bzhin du gcig pu kho na smra'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is just one because it is supreme, like a lamp,

original: 'dir lan du /
analyzed: 'dir lan du /
translated: in response to that,

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang chos gang la yang mi sems la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang chos gang la yang mi sems la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMoreover, if one does not think about any phenomenon at all,‚Äù and so on.

original: mnyan pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs na ni ming la sogs pa la mngon par ma zhen pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
analyzed: mnyan pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs na ni ming la sogs pa la mngon par ma zhen pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
translated: At the stage of listening and reflection, one abides in the name, etc., without being attached to them.

original: bsgoms pas ni nyi ma re re lus rnam par byang ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pas ni nyi ma re re lus rnam par byang ste /
translated: By cultivation, one purifies the body day by day.

original: rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag @106b spangs nas 'khor ba'i mtha' ji tsam par bzhugs pa'i nyi tshe la ming ngam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag @106b spangs nas 'khor ba'i mtha' ji tsam par bzhugs pa'i nyi tshe la ming ngam /
translated: Having abandoned all conceptualization, one abides for as long as cyclic life lasts, and there is no name,

original: don nam rnam par shes pa 'am /
analyzed: don nam rnam par shes pa 'am /
translated: meaning, consciousness,

original: sems pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: sems pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: or thought whatsoever. This is the summarized meaning.

original: gzhan dag kyang 'di la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa skyes pa gal te chos 'di sems par mi byed na 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos de ji ltar sems par
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang 'di la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa skyes pa gal te chos 'di sems par mi byed na 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos de ji ltar sems par
translated: Others, who have generated false imagination, think, ‚ÄúIf one does not think about these phenomena, then how can the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, who is the embodiment of the perfections, think about the qualities of perfect buddhahood?‚Äù

original: byed tsen / de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mi sems sam zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byed tsen / de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mi sems sam zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, do you not think about the qualities of a Buddha?‚Äù

original: lan du gal te bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su grub par mthong na ni bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la sems pa lags so zhes gsol te /
analyzed: lan du gal te bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su grub par mthong na ni bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la sems pa lags so zhes gsol te /
translated: He replied, ‚ÄúIf I saw the qualities of a Buddha as real, then I would think about the qualities of a Buddha.

original: ji tsam du mthong ba ma mchis na de ji ltar bsam par bgyi zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du mthong ba ma mchis na de ji ltar bsam par bgyi zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: But since I do not see them at all, how can I think about them?‚Äù

original: yongs su grub pa ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni yod pa'o //
translated: The real is the existent.

original: don yongs su grub par ma mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don yongs su grub par ma mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The nonseeing of the real is twofold:

original: bsgom pa dang dus phyis dag pa 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs na yang yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa dang dus phyis dag pa 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs na yang yin te /
translated: in the state of the pure mundane perfection of wisdom, and in the state of the pure supramundane perfection of wisdom.

original: chos dang chos can du dbye ba med pa kho na yin pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ni 'di dag go zhes dbye bar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos can du dbye ba med pa kho na yin pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ni 'di dag go zhes dbye bar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no distinction of dharma and dharmin, one does not understand the distinction, ‚ÄúThese are the qualities of a Buddha.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na yang gzhan dmigs pa med pa kho na yin te 'di 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na yang gzhan dmigs pa med pa kho na yin te 'di 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even in the state free from the fault of discursive thought, it is only the non-apprehension of another, because there is no basis for such discursive thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: it is said that the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is ‚Äúthese are the dharmas of ordinary people,‚Äù up to

original: chos gang la yang rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: chos gang la yang rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äúit does not dwell in any dharma through discursive thought.‚Äù

original: chos dang chos can gyi dngos po dang / de dang 'brel pa'am 'du ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi dngos po dang / de dang 'brel pa'am 'du ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because discursive thought does not operate in the nature of the relation or connection, etc., of the dharma and the possessor of the dharma.

original: 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: As for the statement ‚Äúthese are the dharmas of ordinary people,‚Äù etc.,

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos la sogs pa smos pa ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos la sogs pa smos pa ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the mention of the dharmas of ordinary people, etc., is for the purpose of excluding other discursive thoughts.

original: de lta ma yin na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kho na zhig brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di nyid la the tshom @107a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kho na zhig brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur te / 'di nyid la the tshom @107a * //
translated: Otherwise, only the Dharma of the Perfectly Enlightened One would be the subject matter,üîΩbecause one would be doubtful

original: za ba zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: za ba zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: about this very thing.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa ci zhe na /
translated: Why is that? What is the intention of the question?

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa na ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag nye bar mi gnas pa yin na byis pa so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa dang bse ru lta bu dag dang 'brel
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa na ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag nye bar mi gnas pa yin na byis pa so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa dang bse ru lta bu dag dang 'brel
translated: If, when cultivating the perfection of wisdom, the conceptual thoughts as taught do not occur, then how can the Dharma connected with the foolish ordinary beings, the trainees, the non-trainees, and the rhinoceros-like

original: pa'i chos de ma 'dres par ji ltar ston /
analyzed: pa'i chos de ma 'dres par ji ltar ston /
translated: be taught without mixing them?

original: dmigs pa med par ni tshig 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ni tshig 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Words do not arise without an object.

original: de bas na ji lta ba bzhin du 'chad pa ni bshad par bzhed pa med na med pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na ji lta ba bzhin du 'chad pa ni bshad par bzhed pa med na med pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the explanation exists only when there is the desire to explain,

original: bshad par bzhed pa yang rjes su myong ba mi 'khrul ba can yin no //
analyzed: bshad par bzhed pa yang rjes su myong ba mi 'khrul ba can yin no //
translated: and the desire to explain is not mistaken with regard to the experience.

original: rjes su myong ba chos can dang chos la sogs pa la thug pa yin pas don sgrub pa grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su myong ba chos can dang chos la sogs pa la thug pa yin pas don sgrub pa grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Since the subsequent experience is based on the subject and the object, etc., the establishment of the object is established.

original: lan du rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bus chos de nyid kyang mi dmigs te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bus chos de nyid kyang mi dmigs te zhes gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúThe son of noble family who is diligent in yoga does not even observe that phenomenon.‚Äù

original: chos zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa'i chos can gyi don la bya'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa'i chos can gyi don la bya'o //
translated: The so-called phenomenon should be taken to refer to the object that is the subject posited as an ordinary being, and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa ni chos can gang yin pa dang 'brel ba nyid du brtag pa dmigs par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni chos can gang yin pa dang 'brel ba nyid du brtag pa dmigs par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot observed‚Äù means that the object to be observed, which is connected to whatever subject, does not exist.

original: chos de nyid kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nyid ces bya ba bsnan pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos de nyid kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nyid ces bya ba bsnan pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: As for ‚Äúthat phenomenon is also not observed,‚Äù etc., what is the point of adding ‚Äúthat‚Äù?

original: re zhig chos can de nyid kyang mi dmigs na gang ston par byed pa de'i chos lta dmigs su ga la yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: re zhig chos can de nyid kyang mi dmigs na gang ston par byed pa de'i chos lta dmigs su ga la yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If even that subject is not observed, how could the phenomenon of that teacher be observed?

original: mtha' las 'das pa'i chos can lags pas chos de mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i slad du'o zhes bya ba tha mar smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa'i chos can lags pas chos de mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i slad du'o zhes bya ba tha mar smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it said at the end, ‚ÄúBecause that dharma is not apprehended and is not seen correctly, because it is a dharmin beyond extremes‚Äù?

original: slob pa la sogs pa'i tshig dang po nas re re dang sbyar ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: slob pa la sogs pa'i tshig dang po nas re re dang sbyar ba'i don yin te /
translated: The meaning is that each of the terms ‚Äúlearner,‚Äù etc., is to be applied to each of the terms ‚Äúnot apprehended,‚Äù etc.

original: 'dis ci yang bstan pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ci yang bstan pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that nothing is taught.

original: de yang dmigs pa med pa la spyod pa'i dbang gis chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig snang ba'i shes pa bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams la skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa med pa la spyod pa'i dbang gis chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig snang ba'i shes pa bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams la skye ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the cognition of the appearance of the words that express the selflessness of persons and phenomena arises in the fortunate ones by the power of practicing nonapprehension.

original: gzhan dag 'di la yang dag pa ma yin par rtog pa dmigs pa med pa yin du zin na /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'di la yang dag pa ma yin par rtog pa dmigs pa med pa yin du zin na /
translated: If others think that the nonapprehension of the unreal is apprehension,

original: rigs kyi bu dag 'di la brten nas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings dang / spangs pa'i dbyings dang / 'gog pa'i dbyings dag ji ltar mngon sum du byed ce na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag 'di la brten nas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings dang / spangs pa'i dbyings dang / 'gog pa'i dbyings dag ji ltar mngon sum du byed ce na /
translated: Sons of good family, on the basis of this, how do you actualize the realm of detachment, the realm of abandonment, and the realm of cessation, in order to abandon the afflictions of the three realms?

original: @107b de'i phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bu 'di ni 'dod pa'i khams so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: @107b de'i phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bu 'di ni 'dod pa'i khams so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therefore, here the Blessed One said, The son of good family who is diligent in the yoga of cultivating the perfection of wisdom does not think, 'This is the desire realm,' up to 'This is the cessation of the desire realm.'üîΩHe does not think, 'This is the form realm,' up to 'This is the cessation of the form realm.'

original: 'di ni 'gog pa'i dbyings so zhes bgyi ba'i bar du yang mi shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa'i dbyings so zhes bgyi ba'i bar du yang mi shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: He does not think, 'This is the formless realm,' up to 'This is the cessation of the formless realm.'

original: de la 'dod chags spangs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings so //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags spangs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings so //
translated: In that, the abandonment of attachment is the realm of detachment.

original: de las gzhan pa zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni spangs pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni spangs pa'i dbyings so //
translated: The abandonment of afflictions other than that, such as aversion, is the realm of abandonment.

original: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i dngos po spangs pa ni 'gog pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i dngos po spangs pa ni 'gog pa'i dbyings so //
translated: The object of abandonment, which is the thing that is completely liberated from the defilements, is the element of cessation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'dod chags bral ba 'dod chags zad //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba 'dod chags zad //
translated: The state of being free from desire, the exhaustion of desire,

original: gzhan dag spangs pas spangs pa'i dbyings //üîΩ'gog par brjod pa dngos po spangs //
analyzed: gzhan dag spangs pas spangs pa'i dbyings // 'gog par brjod pa dngos po spangs //
translated: The abandonment of other things is the element of abandonment.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: The expression ‚Äúcessation‚Äù is the abandonment of a thing.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni cig la te med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni cig la te med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Why is that? Because of the non-existence of that.

original: de lta yin na ni 'o na ni nga'i skye ba zad do //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni 'o na ni nga'i skye ba zad do //
translated: If that is so, then how can one cling to the idea that ‚ÄúMy births are exhausted,

original: tshangs par spyad pa bsnyen to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa bsnyen to //
translated: I have practiced pure conduct,

original: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gi lhag par zhen par byed ba de dag ji ltar lhag par zhen par byed pa'i rung zhe na /
