analyzed: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gi lhag par zhen par byed ba de dag ji ltar lhag par zhen par byed pa'i rung zhe na /
translated: I have done what had to be done‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de 'gog pa'i chos gang lags pa'i chos de gang yang mi mthong ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de 'gog pa'i chos gang lags pa'i chos de gang yang mi mthong ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, ‚ÄúIn this way, he does not see any dharma at all that is a dharma of cessation.‚Äù

original: 'dis bstan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dis bstan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: This passage teaches that the cultivation of transcendent wisdom is the essence of being distinguished by stainless transcendent wisdom.

original: de ni rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bor 'dug la 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum yang re zhig yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig par yod pa ma yin na de na yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa lta dmigs par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bor 'dug la 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum yang re zhig yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig par yod pa ma yin na de na yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa lta dmigs par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since it exists as the entity of mere reflexive awareness, and since the three realms such as the desire realm do not exist at all, if they do not exist as reflexive awareness, how could the attachment and so on that exist in them be observed?

original: gang gis na de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i khams dmigs par 'gyur /üîΩgzhan yang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: gang gis na de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i khams dmigs par 'gyur / gzhan yang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: By what means would the freedom from attachment and so on, which is characterized by being free from them, be observed as an element?

original: skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid rtag pa zhig 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dbyings yin na yang mngon sum du byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid rtag pa zhig 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dbyings yin na yang mngon sum du byar mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, if the nature of analytical cessation or the nature of nonarising is permanent, it is asserted to be the element of freedom from attachment and so on, but it cannot be made directly perceptible.

original: dngos po rtag pa ni khyad par gzhan du byar med pa nyid kyis rim dang rim ma yin pa'i sgo nas rang gi yul la shes pa skye ba la mkho ba ma yin pas yul du mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa ni khyad par gzhan du byar med pa nyid kyis rim dang rim ma yin pa'i sgo nas rang gi yul la shes pa skye ba la mkho ba ma yin pas yul du mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A permanent entity is not accepted as an object, because it is not a requirement for the production of cognition with regard to its object, either successively or not successively, since it cannot be made to have any other distinction.

original: khyad par gzhag tu yod na yang dngos po mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par gzhag tu yod na yang dngos po mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it were possible to posit a distinction, then it would follow that the entity is impermanent.

original: de bas @108a * //
analyzed: de bas @108a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i sgom pa de nyid skyes pa na 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dbyings nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i sgom pa de nyid skyes pa na 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dbyings nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: when that meditation which is incompatible with attachment, etc. is produced, it is posited as the element of freedom from attachment, etc.

original: de ltar na rang las logs shig na 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dbyings 'di la dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa ni thams cad ma 'khrugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang las logs shig na 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dbyings 'di la dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa ni thams cad ma 'khrugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that this element of freedom from attachment, etc. is observed as something separate from itself.

original: gzhan dag sems pa 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dbyings yod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: gzhan dag sems pa 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dbyings yod pa ma yin no /
translated: Others think that the element of freedom from attachment, etc. does not exist.

original: ji ltar bsgom pa 'di 'ga' zhig la phan par byed pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom pa 'di 'ga' zhig la phan par byed pa'am /
translated: How does this meditation benefit anyone?

original: gzhan dag la gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag la gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is harmful to others,

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang chos gang la yang phan pa'am gnod par mi bgyid pa de zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang chos gang la yang phan pa'am gnod par mi bgyid pa de zhes gsungs so //
translated: then why did the Lord say, ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti, it does not benefit or harm any dharma at all‚Äù?

original: sangs rgyas rnams la stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag rnams 'bul bar bgyid pa de dag phan par bgyid pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi srid pa dang longs spyod la kun du chags pa la sogs pa rgyun gcod par byed pa de gnod par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag rnams 'bul bar bgyid pa de dag phan par bgyid pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi srid pa dang longs spyod la kun du chags pa la sogs pa rgyun gcod par byed pa de gnod par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is helpful to offer the powers and the limbs of enlightenment to the Buddhas, and harmful to cut off the continuity of the attachment to existence and enjoyments of ordinary people,

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: then why did the Lord say, ‚ÄúThe cultivation of the perfection of wisdom does not give the Buddha Dharmas, nor does it take them away‚Äù?

original: gal te 'di byed pa ci yang med na ji ltar de bsgom pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di byed pa ci yang med na ji ltar de bsgom pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If it does not do anything at all, how can it be cultivated?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gang so so'i skye bo'i chos kun tu chags pa la sogs pa rnams kyang mi 'gog mi sems te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gang so so'i skye bo'i chos kun tu chags pa la sogs pa rnams kyang mi 'gog mi sems te /
translated: Therefore, the Lord does not stop or think about the dharmas of ordinary people, such as attachment,

original: 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa yang rigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa yang rigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because their destruction is causeless, and because the cessation through deliberation, etc., are not reasonable, they do not exist in reality, like a sky-lotus, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang mi 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'thob par byed pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang mi 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'thob par byed pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the dharmas of the Buddha are not attained, because there is no one who attains them.

original: de lta yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni /
translated: If that is so,

original: dmigs su ga la yod //
analyzed: dmigs su ga la yod //
translated: how can there be an object?

original: 'dir byang grol dang nges par legs pa 'thob par brtson pa kha cig la the tshom 'di skyes te /
analyzed: 'dir byang grol dang nges par legs pa 'thob par brtson pa kha cig la the tshom 'di skyes te /
translated: Here, some who strive to attain liberation and definite goodness have this doubt:

original: ci mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i them skas 'di'i rgyu na yon tan bla na med pa mtha' dag snang bar byed pa dang / nyes pa'i tshogs ma lus pa thams cad rgyun gcod par byed bzhin du dus thams cad du @108b gnas sam /
analyzed: ci mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i them skas 'di'i rgyu na yon tan bla na med pa mtha' dag snang bar byed pa dang / nyes pa'i tshogs ma lus pa thams cad rgyun gcod par byed bzhin du dus thams cad du @108b gnas sam /
translated: Does it remain at all times?

original: ci de ma thag tu med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci de ma thag tu med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or does it immediately cease to exist?

original: de bas na de yongs su mgu bar bya ba'i ched du /
analyzed: de bas na de yongs su mgu bar bya ba'i ched du /
translated: Therefore, in order to completely delight him,

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis chos zab mo 'di lta bu 'di bstan pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis chos zab mo 'di lta bu 'di bstan pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, it is excellent, excellent that you have taught such a profound Dharma.‚Äù

original: zab mo zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúProfound‚Äù means that it is not the domain of experience of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: khyod kyis phyag rtags bzhag pa ni 'khor ba'i mtha' srid du bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis phyag rtags bzhag pa ni 'khor ba'i mtha' srid du bzhag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYou have placed your seal‚Äù means that you have placed it until the end of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa la spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa la spyod pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúBodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas‚Äù refers to those who practice without reference points.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams dang zhes bya ba ni bya ba byas pa ma yin par bdag ni bya ba byas so snyam pa'i bsam pa can rnams te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams dang zhes bya ba ni bya ba byas pa ma yin par bdag ni bya ba byas so snyam pa'i bsam pa can rnams te /
translated: Those who are conceited about the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas are those who have the thought, ‚ÄúI have done what had to be done,‚Äù when they have not done what had to be done.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis spyod cing tha snyad spyod pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can no //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis spyod cing tha snyad spyod pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can no //
translated: They are conceited about their superiority, and they act and speak with that conceit.

original: de dag gis ni theg pa gcig tu byas pa'am gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni theg pa gcig tu byas pa'am gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: They have made the vehicles one, or they have taught that there is one vehicle.

original: de lta ma yin na theg pa chen po gcig tu mchog tu gyur pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag gis yongs su rtogs par bya ba'i ched du yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na theg pa chen po gcig tu mchog tu gyur pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag gis yongs su rtogs par bya ba'i ched du yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, this Dharma discourse, which is the supreme teaching of the single Great Vehicle, would not have been taught in order to make them understand.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa smos pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyang mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa smos pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyang mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The mention of those who follow the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas also indicates those who follow the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dmigs pa can rnams zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du smon lam btab la theg pa chen po'i de kho na nyid ma mthong ba rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dmigs pa can rnams zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du smon lam btab la theg pa chen po'i de kho na nyid ma mthong ba rnams la bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose who are bodhisattvas in name only‚Äù refers to those who have made a vow to attain buddhahood but have not yet seen the reality of the Great Vehicle.

original: thams cad la phan par byed pa nyid du bstan pa de dag gis ni chos kyi rnam grangs nyi tshe ba la phan par byed pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la phan par byed pa nyid du bstan pa de dag gis ni chos kyi rnam grangs nyi tshe ba la phan par byed pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The teaching that the Buddha‚Äôs speech benefits all beings would not be true of a teaching that benefits only a limited number of beings.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med par khong du chad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med par khong du chad pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúrealizes things as they really are‚Äù means that one understands that all things are unreal.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dang / dmigs pa can dag la yang 'di ji ltar phan par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dang / dmigs pa can dag la yang 'di ji ltar phan par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does this teaching benefit those who are proud and those who are attached to things?

original: gang dag sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur byas pa ma yin pa dang / sangs rgyas gcig la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bstan to //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur byas pa ma yin pa dang / sangs rgyas gcig la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bstan to //
translated: This teaching is given to those who have not served many buddhas and have not planted the roots of virtue under many buddhas.

original: gal te gsungs pa la sogs pa yang dag pa'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin na des bdag bsad do zhes de ltar skrag par brjod do //
analyzed: gal te gsungs pa la sogs pa yang dag pa'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin na des bdag bsad do zhes de ltar skrag par brjod do //
translated: If what is said does not exist in reality, why is it said that one is frightened by it, thinking, ‚ÄúIt killed me!‚Äù?

original: de ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas go rims bzhin du skrag pa dang / dngang ba dang / dngang bar 'gyur ba'i @109a * //üîΩsgras bshad de /
analyzed: de ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas go rims bzhin du skrag pa dang / dngang ba dang / dngang bar 'gyur ba'i @109a * // sgras bshad de /
translated: It is explained that fear, fright, and terror arise in small, medium, and great stages, respectively.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i 'jigs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩde ltar yang dag pa nyid shin tu bstan du zin kyang 'dir kha cig rnam par rtog pa 'phags pa 'di ni thams cad du gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i ched du bsgom pa ston pa yin na de khong du chud par byed pa'i rigs pa
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i 'jigs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no // de ltar yang dag pa nyid shin tu bstan du zin kyang 'dir kha cig rnam par rtog pa 'phags pa 'di ni thams cad du gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i ched du bsgom pa ston pa yin na de khong du chud par byed pa'i rigs pa
translated: fear, fright, and terror do not arise in small, medium, and great stages.

original: ni 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: ni 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
translated: Even though reality is taught in this way, some think that there is no reasoning to understand this, since this noble teaching is a meditation on the selflessness of persons and phenomena in all contexts.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya cher ston par spobs pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya cher ston par spobs pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: The Blessed One, I am confident in teaching the perfection of wisdom extensively.

original: spobs pa ni mngon du gyur pa dang / 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: spobs pa ni mngon du gyur pa dang / 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Confidence is from the manifest to the desired.

original: rgya cher zhes bya ba ni de ston par byed pa'i tshul phul du byung ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgya cher zhes bya ba ni de ston par byed pa'i tshul phul du byung ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Extensive means the excellent aspect of the method of teaching it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sems can gyi don chen po gzigs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sems can gyi don chen po gzigs nas /
translated: The Blessed One, seeing the great benefit for beings,

original: 'jam dpal spobs par gyis shig ces gnang ba mdzad do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal spobs par gyis shig ces gnang ba mdzad do //
translated: granted permission, saying, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, be confident.

original: de la re zhig rags pa yin pa'i phyir gang zag la bdag med pa bsgrub pa'i ched du /
analyzed: de la re zhig rags pa yin pa'i phyir gang zag la bdag med pa bsgrub pa'i ched du /
translated: There, first, for the purpose of establishing the selflessness of persons because of their coarseness,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang gi gnas pa mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang gi gnas pa mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Blessed One said, One who does not apprehend the abode of any dharma... and so on.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni bdag dang srog la sogs par 'du shes pa'o ;
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni bdag dang srog la sogs par 'du shes pa'o ;
translated: Any refers to the notion of self, life-force, and so on.

original: / gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: / gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding‚Äù means remaining.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: mi gnas pa ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-abiding‚Äù means transformation, the characteristic of change.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù?

original: ci mthong bar byed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir mi dmigs sam /
analyzed: ci mthong bar byed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir mi dmigs sam /
translated: Is it because of the absence of the power to perceive?

original: 'on te gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir yin /
analyzed: 'on te gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir yin /
translated: Or is it because of the absence of the nature of abiding and non-abiding?

original: gal te phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni de lta na gang zag la bdag med pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni de lta na gang zag la bdag med pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: If it is the first case, then the non-establishment of selflessness in the person is not established,

original: mi dmigs pa de lta bu ni dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de lta bu ni dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because such non-apprehension is not a proof of non-existence.

original: dngos po mang po la dmigs par nus pa'i mthu dang bral ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa yod de /
analyzed: dngos po mang po la dmigs par nus pa'i mthu dang bral ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa yod de /
translated: There is non-apprehension because of the absence of the power to apprehend many things,

original: dper na so so'i skye bo rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang chos la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang chos la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as ordinary people do not apprehend the Buddha, Dharma, etc.

original: de tsam gyis ni med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But that does not mean that they do not exist.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang tshig tsam snying po yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang tshig tsam snying po yin te /
translated: If it is the second alternative, then the words are the essence,

original: rigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are devoid of reason.

original: de bas na rigs pa brjod @109b dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na rigs pa brjod @109b dgos so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to state the reason.

original: chos thams cad mi gnas pa'i slad du gnas pa dang mi gnas pa mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi gnas pa'i slad du gnas pa dang mi gnas pa mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because all dharmas are non-abiding, abiding and non-abiding are not observed.

original: mi gnas pa nyid ni skad cig ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa nyid ni skad cig ma nyid yin te /
translated: Non-abiding is momentariness.

original: 'di ni khyab par byed pa'i chos can bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni khyab par byed pa'i chos can bstan to //
translated: This teaches the pervading property.

original: chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la bya'o //
translated: Dharma means grasping one's own characteristic.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bya ba byed nus pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bya ba byed nus pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: One's own characteristic is the nature of being able to perform a function.

original: thams cad ces smos pa ni thams cad ma lus par khyab par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad ces smos pa ni thams cad ma lus par khyab par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: The statement all is made to show that everything without exception is pervaded.

original: phyogs kyi chos dang dpe gnyis ni ma gsungs te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dang dpe gnyis ni ma gsungs te /
translated: The property of the position and the example are not stated.

original: phyogs kyi chos dang dpe gnyis ma gsungs pa ni gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dang dpe gnyis ma gsungs pa ni gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for not stating the property of the position and the example is because it depends on the distinctions of the disciples.

original: de ltar sbyor ba ni gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba ni gsal ba yin te /
translated: Such a syllogism is clear.

original: gang don byed nus pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa de ni skad cig gcig gnas pa'i chos kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang don byed nus pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa de ni skad cig gcig gnas pa'i chos kho na yin te /
translated: That which holds the nature that is able to perform a function is only a phenomenon that endures for one moment.

original: dper na mar me la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a lamp and so on.

original: don byed nus pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa'i don kyang pha rol po dag 'dod pa yin pas ngo bo nyid kyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: don byed nus pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa'i don kyang pha rol po dag 'dod pa yin pas ngo bo nyid kyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The meaning of holding the nature that is able to perform a function is also asserted by the opponent. Therefore, it is a reason of identity.

original: phyogs dang mi mthun pa ni nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang mi mthun pa ni nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The discordant side is like the sky-lotus and so on.

original: skad cig ma nyid med na ni don byed nus pa'i ngo bo yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid med na ni don byed nus pa'i ngo bo yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no momentariness, then there is also no nature that is able to perform a function.

original: de ltar na skad cig ma nyid grub pas gang zag la bdag med pa grub pa yin no //üîΩgrub par byed pa ni srog dang bcas pa'i lus la sogs pa ni bdag kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar na skad cig ma nyid grub pas gang zag la bdag med pa grub pa yin no // grub par byed pa ni srog dang bcas pa'i lus la sogs pa ni bdag kyang ma yin /
translated: Thus, by establishing momentariness, the selflessness of the person is established.

original: bdag gi ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The establishment is that a living body and so on is neither the self nor that which belongs to the self,

original: rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir mar me la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir mar me la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it engages in a sequence, like a lamp and so on.

original: rtag pa dang 'brel pa yin na rim gyis 'jug pa mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang 'brel pa yin na rim gyis 'jug pa mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: If it were related to the permanent, it would not be tenable that it functions gradually. This is the valid cognition that refutes it.

original: de ltar na gang zag la bdag med pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na gang zag la bdag med pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the selflessness of persons,

original: chos la bdag med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the selflessness of phenomena,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang lhag par dmigs pa'i slad du nye bar mi gnas pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang lhag par dmigs pa'i slad du nye bar mi gnas pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThat which does not abide for the sake of observing any phenomenon . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: dmigs pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i slad du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of observing‚Äù means for the sake of apprehending.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩci 'dzin par nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni kha cig 'di snyam du sems te / ci 'dzin par nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Some think, ‚ÄúIs it because it is devoid of the ability to apprehend,

original: 'on te gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir yin /
translated: or is it because it is devoid of the character of being apprehended?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar na ni ji ltar chos bdag med pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar na ni ji ltar chos bdag med pa yin /
translated: If it is the first conception, then how is it that phenomena are selfless?

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na ni rigs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na ni rigs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is the second position, what is the logic?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rigs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the logic is as follows.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar chos @110a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar chos @110a * //
translated: The Bhagavat has said,

original: thams cad ni dmigs pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad ni dmigs pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, all phenomena are non-apprehensible.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni yul dang bcas pa'i shes pa yin par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni yul dang bcas pa'i shes pa yin par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: It is asserted that the apprehension of their own characteristics is cognition that has an object.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa gang yin pa de dag ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa gang yin pa de dag ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Those that apprehend their own characteristics are non-apprehensible.

original: dper na rmi lam dang rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam dang rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the cognition of someone with diseased vision who sees falling hairs and so on.

original: 'di ltar shes pa ni rang gi rgyu las gsal ba'i ngo bor skye ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa ni rang gi rgyu las gsal ba'i ngo bor skye ba yin la /
translated: In this way, cognition arises from its own causes in the form of clarity.üîΩIt is asserted that it is the very nature of that to be the experience of its own entity.

original: de rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyis na rang gi ngo bo myong ba yin no zhes 'dod pa ni tha snyad tsam du 'dod la rag go //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyis na rang gi ngo bo myong ba yin no zhes 'dod pa ni tha snyad tsam du 'dod la rag go //
translated: This is asserted to be merely a convention.

original: de rang rig pa yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: de rang rig pa yang ma yin te ;
translated: It is not reflexive awareness,

original: gcig gi ngo bo de la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po dang / rig pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa gsum mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo de la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po dang / rig pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa gsum mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that the entity of one thing is threefold: the object of awareness, the agent of awareness, and the characteristic of awareness.

original: gzhan dag ni bdag gi nang du ma gtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bdag gi nang du ma gtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar rig par 'gyur /
translated: How could the other aggregates be known, since they are not included in the self?üîΩSince the nature of the self is not the nature of the other, how could the other be known when the self is known?üîΩIf you say that the nature of the self is the cause of the nature of the other, and that the other is the object of the self, then the self would not be the cause of the other, and the other would not be the object of the self.

original: bdag gi ngo bo de ni gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir gang gis de rig pa na gzhan yang rig par 'gyur /üîΩrtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de ni de'i rgyu las skyes pa dang / de'i phyir yul 'dzin to zhes brjod na yang rtogs pa dang / khong du chud pa dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag gi ngo bo de ni gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir gang gis de rig pa na gzhan yang rig par 'gyur / rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de ni de'i rgyu las skyes pa dang / de'i phyir yul 'dzin to zhes brjod na yang rtogs pa dang / khong du chud pa dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin nam /
translated: If you say that the nature of the self is the cause of the nature of the other, and that the other is the object of the self, then the self would not be the cause of the other, and the other would not be the object of the self.üîΩIf you say that the nature of the self is the cause of the nature of the other, and that the other is the object of the self, then the self would not be the cause of the other, and the other would not be the object of the self.üîΩIf you say that the nature of the self is the cause of the nature of the other, and that the other is the object of the self, then the self would not be the cause of the other, and the other would not be the object of the self.üîΩIf you say that the nature of the self is the cause of the nature of the other, and that the other is the object of the self, then the self would not be the cause of the other, and the other would not be the object of the self.üîΩIf you say that the nature of the self is the cause of the nature of the other, and that the other is the object of the self, then the self would not be the cause of the other, and the other would not be the object of the self.üîΩIf you say that the nature of the self is the cause of the nature of the other, and that the other is the object of the self, then the self would not be the cause of the other, and the other would not be the object of the self.

original: rnam par shes par bya ba ni rtogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin na /üîΩji ltar de'i ngo bo dang bral ba lcags kyi thur ma lta bu de rnam par shes pa de'i ngo bor 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba ni rtogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin na / ji ltar de'i ngo bo dang bral ba lcags kyi thur ma lta bu de rnam par shes pa de'i ngo bor 'gyur /
translated: If you say that the nature of the self is the cause of the nature of the other, and that the other is the object of the self, then the self would not be the cause of the other, and the other would not be the object of the self.

original: re zhig 'phros pa bzhag ste skabs nyid brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'phros pa bzhag ste skabs nyid brtsam par bya'o //
translated: If you say that the nature of the self is the cause of the nature of the other, and that the other is the object of

original: bcom ldan 'das ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is not the Bhagavat the one who has become the embodiment of the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom?

original: gal te gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If there is not even the slightest existent that has the nature of an apprehended object,

original: ji ltar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang rang rgyal ba la sogs pa'i chos snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang rang rgyal ba la sogs pa'i chos snang bar 'gyur /

original: 'on te de dag la mi snang na de lta na ni de nyan thos la sogs pa dang bye brag ci yod /
analyzed: 'on te de dag la mi snang na de lta na ni de nyan thos la sogs pa dang bye brag ci yod /

original: gang gis na thams cad mkhyen par gzhag par bya /
analyzed: gang gis na thams cad mkhyen par gzhag par bya /
translated: By what are they posited as omniscient?

original: de bas na ji ltar de'i shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa can yin pa de bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa'i yang yin te /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar de'i shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa can yin pa de bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa'i yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, just as his consciousness has the nature of apprehending objects, so too is the consciousness of the sravaka and so on,üîΩfor it is like the difference in their realization of subtle and so on from a distance.

original: rgyang ring po nas phra ba la sogs pa rtogs pa de'i bye brag lta bu yin no zhes kha cig de snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rgyang ring po nas phra ba la sogs pa rtogs pa de'i bye brag lta bu yin no zhes kha cig de snyam du sems na /
translated: If someone thinks this,

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: then in response to that, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das @110b gzhan yang gang la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang rang rig pa ma gtogs par rig par bya ba nyid du mngon du mi 'gyur na zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @110b gzhan yang gang la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang rang rig pa ma gtogs par rig par bya ba nyid du mngon du mi 'gyur na zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also thinks, ‚ÄúIn whom the buddha qualities are not manifest as objects of knowledge except for self-awareness.‚Äù

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: gnas med snang ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: gnas med snang ba yod ma yin //
translated: Without a basis, appearance does not exist.

original: mtshan ma med cing yi ge med //
analyzed: mtshan ma med cing yi ge med //
translated: Without signs, without letters,

original: rnam rtog thams cad rnam par bral //
analyzed: rnam rtog thams cad rnam par bral //
translated: Free from all conceptuality,

original: 'khor ba ji srid bar du bzhugs //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid bar du bzhugs //
translated: Abiding as long as sa·πÉsƒÅra lasts,

original: 'jig rten phun sum tshogs pa kun //
analyzed: 'jig rten phun sum tshogs pa kun //
translated: All the perfections of the world

original: yon tan rdzogs mdzad mthu dang ldan //
analyzed: yon tan rdzogs mdzad mthu dang ldan //
translated: Are accomplished by the powerful one.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni //
translated: The wisdom of the TathƒÅgata

original: kun blo tshig gi gnas ma yin //
analyzed: kun blo tshig gi gnas ma yin //
translated: Is not the domain of the minds and words of all.

original: dpag bsam dag gi shing bzhin du //
analyzed: dpag bsam dag gi shing bzhin du //
translated: Like the wish-fulfilling trees,

original: rnam rtog rlung gis thub mi bskyod //
analyzed: rnam rtog rlung gis thub mi bskyod //
translated: Not shaken by the winds of conceptuality,

original: 'jig rten phun sum don rnams mdzad //
analyzed: 'jig rten phun sum don rnams mdzad //
translated: Accomplishing the aims of the perfections of the world,

original: de phyir mthong med ces kyang gsungs //üîΩlhun gyis grub par ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: de phyir mthong med ces kyang gsungs // lhun gyis grub par ma lus pa'i //
translated: Therefore, it is also said to be invisible.üîΩIn order to accomplish all activities

original: bya ba thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Without exception spontaneously,

original: kun du rgyal ba thams cad rig //
analyzed: kun du rgyal ba thams cad rig //
translated: He is the all-victorious one, all-knowing.üîΩ

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: and is victorious in every way, and knows all.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bsgom pa gang la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bsgom pa gang la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, on the basis of which meditation the inconceivable qualities of the Buddha are attained, and so on, the inconceivable is to be understood as thusness.

original: de la yang rnam par rtog pa sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang rnam par rtog pa sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: And that is what removes conceptualization.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The non-occurrence of the conceptualization ‚Äúthe qualities of the Buddha are inconceivable‚Äù is the meaning as it is intended.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba ni thob pa ste /

analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du bya ba'i phyir mngon par zhen pa spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /

original: re zhig rnam par rtog pa 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: re zhig rnam par rtog pa 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mi mnga' ste /

original: ma rig pa'i sa bon thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sa bon thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa mtha' dag ma bsal ba yod pa de ga la 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa mtha' dag ma bsal ba yod pa de ga la 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rang bzhin gyi 'khrul pa nyid kyis yul med pa'i phyir de dag la yang 'di'i don ji lta ba bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rang bzhin gyi 'khrul pa nyid kyis yul med pa'i phyir de dag la yang 'di'i don ji lta ba bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: Imagination, because of the absence of an object, is itself a natural error. Therefore, it is not as it is in reality for them.

original: de dag la dngos po yang dag par 'dzin pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa 'di med de /
analyzed: de dag la dngos po yang dag par 'dzin pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa 'di med de /
translated: But they do not have this attachment to the real apprehension of an entity,

original: sgyu ma mkhan dang chos mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag gi 'di'i 'khrul pa yin du zin kyang don dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi @111a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan dang chos mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro // de dag gi 'di'i 'khrul pa yin du zin kyang don dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi @111a * //
translated: because they abide in conformity with the magician's illusion.üîΩEven though it is an error for them, it is not like the inference of impermanence, etc.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du /

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid thob par byed par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid thob par byed par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: It is desired that it bring about the attainment of the reality of things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par blta bar bgyi'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par blta bar bgyi'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: This cultivation of the perfection of wisdom by the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas should be seen as the non-conceptuality with regard to all dharmas.

analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa ni chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa ste /

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi sa bon dang bral ba bcom ldan 'das kyi ting nge 'dzin dmigs pa mi mnga' ba thun mong ma yin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi sa bon dang bral ba bcom ldan 'das kyi ting nge 'dzin dmigs pa mi mnga' ba thun mong ma yin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is the Blessed One's uncommon, non-apprehending samƒÅdhi, free from the seeds of all conceptual thoughts. This is what it means.

original: de'i ched du bsgrub po zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du bsgrub po zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen as for that purpose, it is to be accomplished.

analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'brel ba 'di ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhe na /

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bsgom pa gang la brten nas mthong ba ma mchis par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bsgom pa gang la brten nas mthong ba ma mchis par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su mthong ba 'di'i don ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir / chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos su mthong ba zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni de dag nyid kyis de bzhin du thugs su chud pa'i phyir dang / bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam par mi nus pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: That is why he says,

original: bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i sems dang sems las byung ba ji snyed 'gags pa de snyed la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i sems dang sems las byung ba ji snyed 'gags pa de snyed la zhes gsungs te /
translated: Blessed One, however many minds and mental factors have ceased for an illusory person.

original: sgyu mas sprul pa'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: sgyu mas sprul pa'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'o //
translated: An illusory person is one who is emanated by an illusion.

original: de la ni sems dang sems las byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni sems dang sems las byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: He does not have any minds or mental factors.

original: sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that sentient beings would arise without having existed previously.

original: de dag gi 'gag pa lta gal yod de /
analyzed: de dag gi 'gag pa lta gal yod de /
translated: What need is there to mention their cessation?

original: de ni skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that has arising as a prerequisite.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi sku ston pa po mdzad par snang ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya ba yod pa ma yin na de dag la bsnyen bkur bya ba lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi sku ston pa po mdzad par snang ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya ba yod pa ma yin na de dag la bsnyen bkur bya ba lta ga la yod de /
translated: In the same way, if the TathƒÅgata who appears as the teacher of the form body is not to be seen, how much less can he be served?

original: de ni dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that has an object as a prerequisite.

original: bsnyen bkur byas pa yod pa ma yin na khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byas pa yod pa ma yin na khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa lta ga la yod de /
translated: If there is no service, how can you be engaged in the Buddha-Dharma?

original: mu stegs bzhin no zhes dgongs nas /
analyzed: mu stegs bzhin no zhes dgongs nas /
translated: like the tƒ´rthikas.

original: 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
translated: Thinking this, he said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, are you not engaged in the Buddha-Dharma?‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyu mtshan dang de skyed pa'i don du yid brtson par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyu mtshan dang de skyed pa'i don du yid brtson par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that one strives with the mind for the cause of the Buddha qualities and for their production.

original: 'dir lan du bcom ldan 'das gang sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa'i chos de gang yang dmigs su mchis sam zhes gsol te /
analyzed: 'dir lan du bcom ldan 'das gang sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa'i chos de gang yang dmigs su mchis sam zhes gsol te /
translated: Here, the reply is, ‚ÄúBlessed One, is there any dharma whatsoever that is truly engaged with the Buddha qualities?‚Äù

original: bdag la sogs pa rtag pa med pa'i phyir bdag la sogs pa gang yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa rtag pa med pa'i phyir bdag la sogs pa gang yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because a self and so on are not permanent, a self and so on do not exist at all.

original: phung po'i tshogs mi rtag pa yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa 'jug pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i tshogs mi rtag pa yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa 'jug pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, because it is illogical for the impermanent collection of aggregates to engage in arising and disintegrating immediately after arising,

original: de bas na de'i ngo bo rgyun mi chad par skye ba 'dus byas skad cig ma'i rgyun la brten te gcig pa nyid du brtags nas yang dag par zhugs par brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i ngo bo rgyun mi chad par skye ba 'dus byas skad cig ma'i rgyun la brten te gcig pa nyid du brtags nas yang dag par zhugs par brtags pa yin te /
translated: therefore, the nature of that is imputed to be one in dependence on the continuum of momentary conditioned phenomena that arises without interruption. It is imputed to be truly engaged.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa ni brtags pa kho na yin na ci 'ga' zhig yod dam zhes yang dag pa ma yin par tshig zur gyis bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa ni brtags pa kho na yin na ci 'ga' zhig yod dam zhes yang dag pa ma yin par tshig zur gyis bstan to //
translated: The one who is properly engaged is only an imputation. The Lord asks, Is there anything at all? indicating by the word at all that it is not real.

original: gal te yang dag par zhugs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na su zhig gis bsgoms pa de grub na sangs rgyas kyi chos 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te yang dag par zhugs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na su zhig gis bsgoms pa de grub na sangs rgyas kyi chos 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If there is not even one who is properly engaged, then who is it that, when he cultivates, accomplishes the qualities of a Buddha?

original: phan tshun rtog pa la brten pa ni rnam par dbye ba med par tha dad pa'i dngos por mi 'thad de /
analyzed: phan tshun rtog pa la brten pa ni rnam par dbye ba med par tha dad pa'i dngos por mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that the distinction of this is the one who cultivates and this is the one who accomplishes is based on mutual conceptualization, because they are not different things that exist without mutual dependence.

original: chos rnams kyi chos zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is just like the expression the dharma of dharmas.

original: de bas @112b na gang gis 'brel pa'i rjes su myong ba'i gang zag la sogs par yang dag par zhugs pa de dag na yod pa yin no zhes 'dri ba ni 'jam dpal 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag su yod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas @112b na gang gis 'brel pa'i rjes su myong ba'i gang zag la sogs par yang dag par zhugs pa de dag na yod pa yin no zhes 'dri ba ni 'jam dpal 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag su yod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Lord asks, Ma√±juSrƒ´, then who has the qualities of a Buddha? referring to those who are properly engaged in the person who experiences the connection and so on.

original: lan du / bcom ldan 'das nyid la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lan du / bcom ldan 'das nyid la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The answer is, The Blessed One himself. And so on.

original: dbang phyug dam pa skyon ma lus pa dang bral ba'i ye shes thogs pa med pa'i bdag nyid dag la yang de dang 'brel pa nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma mchis te /
analyzed: dbang phyug dam pa skyon ma lus pa dang bral ba'i ye shes thogs pa med pa'i bdag nyid dag la yang de dang 'brel pa nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma mchis te /
translated: Even in the case of the highest Lord, who is the nature of unobstructed intuition free from all faults, there is no Buddha-attribute connected with him.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs te /
translated: For that very reason, it is not perceived,

original: de'i ngo bo la ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo la ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nothing exists apart from his essence.

original: bdag dang srog la sogs pa gzhan rnams la mchis par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: bdag dang srog la sogs pa gzhan rnams la mchis par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: How much less could it be found in others, such as the self, life-force, and so on!

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas de rnams kyi chos so zhes so sor phye ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas de rnams kyi chos so zhes so sor phye ste /
translated: This is the Dharma of those Buddhas.

original: gnyis su sbyor yang gcig tu brjod de /
analyzed: gnyis su sbyor yang gcig tu brjod de /
translated: Although it is applied separately, it is expressed as one,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid kyi chos so zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid kyi chos so zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to make it known as the Dharma of the nature of the Buddha.

original: 'di ltar chos dang chos can gyi tshig gi sgra gnyis yod du zin kyang brjod par bya ba'i don la ci yang dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos dang chos can gyi tshig gi sgra gnyis yod du zin kyang brjod par bya ba'i don la ci yang dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, although there are two terms of Dharma and dharmin, there is no distinction at all in the meaning to be expressed.

original: 'o na de ltar chos dang chos can tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin na ji ltar 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di yang dag par zhugs pa na chags pa med pa'i chos rnyed pa yin zhes de ltar 'dri ba ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis chags pa
analyzed: 'o na de ltar chos dang chos can tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin na ji ltar 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di yang dag par zhugs pa na chags pa med pa'i chos rnyed pa yin zhes de ltar 'dri ba ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis chags pa
translated: Well then, if there is no difference between the phenomenon and the attribute, how is it that you ask, When noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ has entered, has he found the unattached attribute?üîΩ

original: med pa nyid rnyed dam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid rnyed dam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Well then, if the distinction between the phenomenon and the subject does not exist, how is it that you ask, ‚ÄúHow is it that this noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, when he has entered, has attained the Dharma free of attachment?‚Äù Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, you ask, ‚ÄúHave you attained freedom from attachment?‚ÄùüîΩFreedom from attachment is freedom from attachment.

original: spobs pa chags pa med pha ni chags pa med pa'o zhes bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: spobs pa chags pa med pha ni chags pa med pa'o zhes bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúattachment‚Äù is elided.

original: chags shing thogs pa 'di la yod pa ma yin pas spobs pa chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chags shing thogs pa 'di la yod pa ma yin pas spobs pa chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Since attachment and obstruction do not exist here, there is freedom from attachment.

original: de'i dngos po ni chags pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni chags pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Its state is freedom from attachment.

original: de'i bdag nyid du skyes pa las ma gtogs par bdag gis chags pa med pa nyid thob pa ma mchis te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du skyes pa las ma gtogs par bdag gis chags pa med pa nyid thob pa ma mchis te /
translated: Apart from being born in that state, I have not attained freedom from attachment.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid chags pa ma mchis pa nyid lags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid chags pa ma mchis pa nyid lags te /
translated: Thus, Blessed One, I am free of attachment.

original: chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the distinction between the phenomenon and the subject is impossible.

original: bdag gis yang phyis kyang chags pa ma mchis pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bdag gis yang phyis kyang chags pa ma mchis pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ram /
translated: ‚ÄúWill I also obtain non-attachment later?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar de'i ngo bor skyes pa'i dngos po rnams ni yang de'i bdag nyid du skye ba dang 'brel pa'i rigs la sogs pa 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i ngo bor skyes pa'i dngos po rnams ni yang de'i bdag nyid du skye ba dang 'brel pa'i rigs la sogs pa 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not logical that things that have arisen in that nature will again obtain the connection to arising in that nature.

original: yang nas yang thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang nas yang thob pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that they obtain it again and again.

original: de las ma gtogs pa bdag mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig gi blo la 'di snyam du 'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di'i spobs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang khyad par med pas rdo rje'i @113a * //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa bdag mi srid pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig gi blo la 'di snyam du 'jam pa'i dbyangs 'di'i spobs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang khyad par med pas rdo rje'i @113a * //
translated: Because apart from that, a self is not possible.

original: gdan la bzhugs par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gdan la bzhugs par gsal ba yin no //
translated: Someone might think this: ‚ÄúThe eloquence of Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ is clearly seated on the vajra seat, because there is no difference between him and the TathƒÅgata.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan ji ltar 'dir thogs pa med cing ma nor ngar nyan thos la sogs pa kun dang thun mong ma yin pa ston par 'thad /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan ji ltar 'dir thogs pa med cing ma nor ngar nyan thos la sogs pa kun dang thun mong ma yin pa ston par 'thad /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be tenable that someone else teaches here without impediment and without error, in a way that is not shared with ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on?üîΩTherefore he is seated on the vajra seat.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'di ni rdo rje'i gdan la bzhugs pa yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni rdo rje'i gdan la bzhugs pa yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir /
translated: To respond:

original: 'jam dpal khyod ci byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gam zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod ci byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gam zhes gsungs te /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, are you sitting at the site of awakening?

original: byang chub kyi snying po ni rdo rje'i gdan te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po ni rdo rje'i gdan te /
translated: The site of awakening is the vajra seat,

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub ni 'di la bzhugs te skyed pas snying por byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub ni 'di la bzhugs te skyed pas snying por byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the awakening that is the nature of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is seated on it, and it is made the site of its generation.

original: snying po'i sgra ni dam pa'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: snying po'i sgra ni dam pa'i rnam grangs te /
translated: The term site is a synonym for essence,

original: mar gyi snying khu bzhin no//
analyzed: mar gyi snying khu bzhin no//
translated: like the essence of butter.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyogs gzhan thams cad pas mchog tu gyur pa ni mthong ba la sogs pa bsod nams rgya chen po la sogs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyogs gzhan thams cad pas mchog tu gyur pa ni mthong ba la sogs pa bsod nams rgya chen po la sogs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is the best of all other directions because it is the site of great merit, such as seeing and so on.

original: lan du / bcom ldan 'das nyid kyang ste /
analyzed: lan du / bcom ldan 'das nyid kyang ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn himself,

original: bdud bzhi bcom par rab tu grags pa yang der ma bzhugs na /
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom par rab tu grags pa yang der ma bzhugs na /
translated: who is well known for having conquered the four mƒÅras, did not sit there,

original: bdag de ltar ma grags blta mchis par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag de ltar ma grags blta mchis par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: so how could I, who am not like that, sit there?

original: ci las dgongs te de skad du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci las dgongs te de skad du bstan zhe na /
translated: With what intention did he teach that?

original: de'i phyir / yang dag pa'i mtha' brtsan par bgyis na zhes gsol te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / yang dag pa'i mtha' brtsan par bgyis na zhes gsol te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf one relies on the limit of reality.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob kyi bden par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not in terms of conventional truth.

original: 'o na yang dag pa'i mtha' yod dam /üîΩde la bcom ldan 'das bzhugs na ni des na skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes yang dag pa'i mtha' ngo bo ma rtogs pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na yang dag pa'i mtha' yod dam / de la bcom ldan 'das bzhugs na ni des na skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes yang dag pa'i mtha' ngo bo ma rtogs pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: But is there a limit of reality?üîΩIf the Bhagavat were to exist, then that would be a fault.

original: 'jam dpal yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to benefit those who have not realized the essence of the limit of reality, it is said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, what is the referent of the term ‚Äòlimit of reality‚Äô?‚Äù

original: 'jig tshogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúperceiving the perishable composite,‚Äù

original: 'jig tshogs kyi sgra ni 'dir ma ma'i tshig mi mngon par byas pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi sgra ni 'dir ma ma'i tshig mi mngon par byas pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: the term ‚Äúperishable composite‚Äù is taught to be ‚Äúthe view of the perishable composite‚Äù by making the feminine particle ma invisible.

original: de la blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mind becomes distorted in relation to that.

original: ji ltar yang dag pa mchog tu gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag pa mchog tu gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the supreme reality?

original: de'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, what are you thinking when you say that?‚Äù

original: khyod kyis ci las bsams te de skad smras zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis ci las bsams te de skad smras zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: What do you think of when you say that?

original: rang gi bsam pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi bsam pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify his own thought,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig tshogs de ni ma mchis pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig tshogs de ni ma mchis pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúThe perishing collection does not exist.‚Äù

original: ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa'i bdag nyid med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa'i bdag nyid med pa la bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Does not exist‚Äù means that it does not exist as a self imagined to be subject and object.

original: 'jig tshogs ma lags pas zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs ma lags pas zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The perishing collection is not‚Äù means that it does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @113b gang gi phyir brtags pa'i dra ba dang bral ba'i phung po rnams 'dir de ni mi 'pho ste /
analyzed: @113b gang gi phyir brtags pa'i dra ba dang bral ba'i phung po rnams 'dir de ni mi 'pho ste /
translated: Because the aggregates, free from the net of imagination, do not pass over here.

original: rdo rje'i gdan la sogs pa'i yul du gshegs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gdan la sogs pa'i yul du gshegs pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not go to a place such as the vajra seat.

original: 'pho ba dang bral ba yang ma lags te zhes bya ba ni der bzhugs pa ma lags so //
analyzed: 'pho ba dang bral ba yang ma lags te zhes bya ba ni der bzhugs pa ma lags so //
translated: Nor are they free from passing over there.

original: gtan tshigs de'i slad du 'jig tshogs de ni 'jig tshogs ma lags te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i slad du 'jig tshogs de ni 'jig tshogs ma lags te /
translated: For that reason, the perishing collection is not the perishing collection.

original: 'di yod pa po yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs kyang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yod pa po yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs kyang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is neither the existent nor the perishing collection.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i mtha' yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i mtha' yin par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the ‚Äúperfect limit.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin te /üîΩstong pa nyid gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin te / stong pa nyid gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness is not other than form.üîΩForm is emptiness.

original: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: Form itself is emptiness.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: It is not dual and cannot be made dual.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The same is true of consciousness.

original: da ni chos kyi rnam grangs sman gyi sdong po lta bu'i mdo 'di la rab tu spro ba 'phel ba'i phyir blo dang ldan pas de'i 'og tu bsngags pa rjod par byed pa ni dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ba
analyzed: da ni chos kyi rnam grangs sman gyi sdong po lta bu'i mdo 'di la rab tu spro ba 'phel ba'i phyir blo dang ldan pas de'i 'og tu bsngags pa rjod par byed pa ni dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ba
translated: Now, in order to increase enthusiasm for this Dharma discourse that is like a medicine tree, the wise one praises it immediately after that. Those who are not afraid of it will definitely attain enlightenment.

original: lags so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lags so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what it says.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa nyid byang chub la gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbyang chub ni rtogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa nyid byang chub la gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro // byang chub ni rtogs pa la bya ste /
translated: Because they are on the stage of action through devoted interest, they are single-minded in their enlightenment.üîΩEnlightenment is the realization.

original: byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that they will definitely attain enlightenment.

original: shin tu myur bar zhes dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu myur bar zhes dgongs pa ste /
translated: Very quickly is the intention.

original: myur ba ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mos pas spyod pa'i sa yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myur ba ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mos pas spyod pa'i sa yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Quick is in the sense of non-apprehension, because it purifies the stage of devoted engagement.

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni byang chub la nye bar gyur pa lags so zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni byang chub la nye bar gyur pa lags so zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are not frightened are close to enlightenment means they attain the irreversible stage.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni bskal pa mtha' med pas bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i sa 'di myur du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni bskal pa mtha' med pas bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i sa 'di myur du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Why is that? means What is the reason for this quick attainment of the irreversible stage, which requires accomplishment over countless eons?

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das gang ji skad du bstan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag rjes su rtogs shing rab tu 'byed pa de nyid byang chub mchog lags pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das gang ji skad du bstan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag rjes su rtogs shing rab tu 'byed pa de nyid byang chub mchog lags pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Because, Blessed One, that very realization and discernment of those phenomena such as form as they are taught is supreme enlightenment.

original: de dag ni shin tu mchog yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni shin tu mchog yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: That is the highest, is the intention.

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Those who are not frightened should be seen as Buddhas.

original: myur du 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: myur du 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is a designation, for it is intended that they will quickly become Buddhas.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni bskal pa dpag tu med pas thob par bya ba'i sangs rgyas nyid ji ltar 'grub par @114a * //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni bskal pa dpag tu med pas thob par bya ba'i sangs rgyas nyid ji ltar 'grub par @114a * //
translated: Why is that? means why is it that Buddhahood, which is attained after countless eons, is accomplished?

original: 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba de ni don dam par na skye ba ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dgas lags pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba de ni don dam par na skye ba ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dgas lags pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Because that which is called Buddha is a designation for the ultimate non-arising.

original: de dag kyang de la shin tu gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang de la shin tu gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are very much devoted to that.

original: skye ba med pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba med pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn't the realization of non-arising inexpressible?

original: skye ba med pa zhes gsungs pa ni tha ma'i tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir dang / nyi ma bzhin du khyad zhugs pa'i phyir de skad du gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes gsungs pa ni tha ma'i tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir dang / nyi ma bzhin du khyad zhugs pa'i phyir de skad du gsungs so //
translated: The statement non-arising is made in that way because the final word is made unapparent and because it is distinguished like the sun.

original: 'di skad bstan te thabs log par zhugs pa ni yun ring pos kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te thabs log par zhugs pa ni yun ring pos kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: This is what is being taught: those who engage in the wrong method will not succeed even in a long time.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs la zhugs pa de dag ni myur du 'grub par 'gyur bas ngo mtshar ci che /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs la zhugs pa de dag ni myur du 'grub par 'gyur bas ngo mtshar ci che /
translated: Those who engage in the method that is in accord with that will quickly succeed, so what is so amazing about that?

original: yang na rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ni nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ni nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: Or else, on the ground of Very Joyful, it is certain.

original: 'di ltar de mngon par rtogs pa thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de mngon par rtogs pa thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by attaining that clear realization, one is born into the family of the tathagatas.

original: chos kyi sprin gyi tshe ni nye bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin gyi tshe ni nye bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: On the Cloud of Dharma, it is near.

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe ni bar du ma chod par des sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe ni bar du ma chod par des sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, at that time, without interruption, one attains the buddhahood of universal light.

original: de'i tshe ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral bas sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral bas sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: At that time, one is a buddha, free from all obscurations.

original: yang na nye bar gyur pa la brten te 'di kun gyi nang du lta bu zhes bya ba khong nas 'byung bar gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na nye bar gyur pa la brten te 'di kun gyi nang du lta bu zhes bya ba khong nas 'byung bar gsungs te /
translated: Or else, based on the near one, it is said from the depths that this is like all of them.

original: nges pa lta bu dang / nye bar gyur pa lta bu dang / sangs rgyas lta bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges pa lta bu dang / nye bar gyur pa lta bu dang / sangs rgyas lta bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is like a certainty, like a near attainment, like a buddha.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis dris pa'i don ni ji ltar na so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa kho na dag mos pa tsam bskyed pa'i phyir de skad du bstan zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis dris pa'i don ni ji ltar na so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa kho na dag mos pa tsam bskyed pa'i phyir de skad du bstan zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the two reasons is: why is it taught that they are only on the level of ordinary beings, because they generate mere devotion?üîΩBecause it is the supreme enlightenment itself.

original: de nyid byang chub mchog lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi mchog yin par rang gi tshig gis ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid byang chub mchog lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi mchog yin par rang gi tshig gis ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This shows by its own words that it is the supreme near attainment.

original: dris pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs kyang 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: dris pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs kyang 'di nyid yin te /
translated: This is also the reason for the previous question.

original: gang dag gis chos gang dag rjes su rtogs pa lhag par che ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis chos gang dag rjes su rtogs pa lhag par che ste /
translated: Those who realize those dharmas have superior realization.

original: don dam par skye ba med pa la gzhol ba de nyid gtan tshigs su brjod par bzhed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par skye ba med pa la gzhol ba de nyid gtan tshigs su brjod par bzhed pa yin gyi /
translated: That very non-arising in the ultimate is stated as the reason,

original: khong du chud pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not understood.

original: de bas na de dag ni 'khrul ba yin no /
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni 'khrul ba yin no /
translated: Therefore, they are mistaken.

original: // /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa /üîΩbam po gsum pa /
analyzed: // /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa / bam po gsum pa /

analyzed: kha cig chos de dag khong du chud par brtson zhing don dam par skye ba med pa khong du chud pa la gzhar yang smra bar bzhed pa de dag gi gtan @114b tshigs khong du ma chud pa de'i phyir de dag ni 'khrul nas chos gang dag khong

original: du chud pa de dag nyid byang chub yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag rjes su rtogs pa de nyid byang chub ces bya ba dang / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i tshig bla dags yin du zin mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang ci'i phyir nye bar gyur pa nyid sangs rgyas yin bar blta bar bya snyam pa la de nyid gtan tshigs kyis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: du chud pa de dag nyid byang chub yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag rjes su rtogs pa de nyid byang chub ces bya ba dang / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i tshig bla dags yin du zin mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang ci'i phyir nye bar gyur pa nyid sangs rgyas yin bar blta bar bya snyam pa la de nyid gtan tshigs kyis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: You are the one who has attained the perfection of wisdom.üîΩYou are

original: sring mo dmigs pa med pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par blo gros rnam par 'phro ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' yin bzhin du bud med kyi gzugs 'chang bas 'di skad ces gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen poüîΩgang dag ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: sring mo dmigs pa med pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par blo gros rnam par 'phro ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' yin bzhin du bud med kyi gzugs 'chang bas 'di skad ces gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ces bya ba nas /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so.

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de ni so so'i skye bo'i chos la sogs pa la lhag par dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de ni so so'i skye bo'i chos la sogs pa la lhag par dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba yin te /
