translated: Those bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas who, having heard this teaching of the Dharma, are not frightened, are not terrified, and are not fearful, they will not objectify the dharmas of ordinary beings, and so on.

original: lhag par dmigs pa ni de dag gis 'dzin pa dang / de la dmigs shing 'dug ces bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: lhag par dmigs pa ni de dag gis 'dzin pa dang / de la dmigs shing 'dug ces bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: Objectification is up to ‚Äúthey grasp that and remain in it.‚Äù

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Why is that? The thought is this.

original: 'khor bar gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yod bzhin du ji ltar mi dmigs par rung /
analyzed: 'khor bar gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yod bzhin du ji ltar mi dmigs par rung /
translated: How can it be that while the consciousness belonging to sa·πÉsƒÅra exists, it is not objectified?

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni don gnyis byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni don gnyis byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
translated: Because the essence of consciousness is to perform two functions.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig cing rnam par rig pas rnam par shes pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig cing rnam par rig pas rnam par shes pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, it is consciousness because it is aware and is aware of.

original: dmigs par bya ba med na ni ci zhig shes na rnam par shes pa zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba med na ni ci zhig shes na rnam par shes pa zhes bya snyam pa la /
translated: If there is no object of consciousness, what is it that is conscious?

original: de'i phyir 'dir 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma mchis pa'i slad du mi dmigs pa ste zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma mchis pa'i slad du mi dmigs pa ste zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said here, ‚Äúbecause all dharmas are non-existent, they are not apprehended.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad ces smos pa ni 'dir rnam par shes pa nyid la bya bar gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces smos pa ni 'dir rnam par shes pa nyid la bya bar gsungs te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall dharmas‚Äù refers to consciousness itself.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis de nyid dmigs pa dang bcas par rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis de nyid dmigs pa dang bcas par rjod par byed do //
translated: This is because others describe it as having an object.

original: ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo yin par bstan te /üîΩ'di ltar rnam par rig pa 'di ni gzung bar 'dod pa'i dngos po la ltos te /
analyzed: ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo yin par bstan te / 'di ltar rnam par rig pa 'di ni gzung bar 'dod pa'i dngos po la ltos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are non-existent‚Äù indicates the nature of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, this awareness is consciousness because it is dependent on the thing that is the object of apprehension.

original: de med pa'i phyir gzhan khong du chud pa'i ngo bo 'di yang bkag pa yin no //üîΩde bas na 'di ni dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du gzhan med pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag @115a * //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir gzhan khong du chud pa'i ngo bo 'di yang bkag pa yin no // de bas na 'di ni dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du gzhan med pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag @115a * //
translated: Because that does not exist, this nature of the understanding of the other is also refuted.

original: nyid yin du zin kyang shes pa 'khrul nas rig par bya ba dang reg par byed pa'i rnam par ston par byed de /
analyzed: nyid yin du zin kyang shes pa 'khrul nas rig par bya ba dang reg par byed pa'i rnam par ston par byed de /
translated: Therefore, this is like the cognition of a city of gandharvas, etc. Even though it is the nature of consciousness without an other, it is shown to be the appearance of the object of cognition and the object of touch due to the error of consciousness.

original: de nyid la brten nas rnam par shes pa nyid du brtags so //
analyzed: de nyid la brten nas rnam par shes pa nyid du brtags so //
translated: Based on that, it is imagined to be consciousness itself.

original: yang dag par na de rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya bar brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par na de rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya bar brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, it cannot be said to be consciousness.

original: rnam par rig par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object of cognition.

original: de ltar re zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de dag ni med par rig ste /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de dag ni med par rig ste /
translated: Thus, in this way, the reasons for the afflictions, etc., are known to be nonexistent.

original: gang du yang bstan du med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du yang bstan du med pa yin no //
translated: They are not taught anywhere.

original: de'i slad du zhes bya ba ni ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: de'i slad du zhes bya ba ni ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of nonexistence.‚Äù

original: chos de dag la dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: chos de dag la dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: Those dharmas are not objects.

original: kha cig bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' med par glang po chen po dag gis gsungs su zin kyang bsngags pa myur du khong du mi chud de /
analyzed: kha cig bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' med par glang po chen po dag gis gsungs su zin kyang bsngags pa myur du khong du mi chud de /
translated: Some, even though spoken by great elephants, do not quickly understand the praise in the absence of the word of the Lord.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das la dang ba skyed pa kho na'i phyir rnam pa gsum gyi bsngags pa yang zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das la dang ba skyed pa kho na'i phyir rnam pa gsum gyi bsngags pa yang zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to generate faith in the Lord alone, he accepts the praise of the three aspects.

original: de de bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, So it is!

original: dang po'i zhal gyis bzhes pa ni byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dang po'i zhal gyis bzhes pa ni byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The first acceptance is that one will certainly attain enlightenment.

original: gnyis pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa yin zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa yin zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The second is that one will abide in the stage of nonretrogression.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yang mi g-yo ba yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yang mi g-yo ba yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: The stage of nonretrogression is said to be immovable.

original: spyi bos len pa ni shin tu dad pa can du ston to //
analyzed: spyi bos len pa ni shin tu dad pa can du ston to //
translated: Taking it on one's head shows great faith.

original: gal te mos pa'i phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin na ;
analyzed: gal te mos pa'i phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin na ;
translated: If nonretrogression is due to aspiration,

original: 'o na ni sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dgos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dgos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then generosity and so on would be unnecessary.

original: de'i phyir de dang de dag ni sbyin bdag dam par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang de dag ni sbyin bdag dam par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, they are the best givers, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i lam bstan pas ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i lam bstan pas ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: By teaching the path of the pure perfections, he clarifies the very stage of nonretrogression.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i bar du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha ma'i zhal gyis bzhes pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i bar du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha ma'i zhal gyis bzhes pa yin no //
translated: They will become endowed with the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, etc. is the final promise.

original: de la de dang de dag ces lan gnyis 'byung ba ni thugs dgyes nas nges pa kho nar de kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de la de dang de dag ces lan gnyis 'byung ba ni thugs dgyes nas nges pa kho nar de kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: There, the two occurrences of ‚Äúthey are‚Äù are for the purpose of expressing his delight, and the meaning is that they are definitely just that.

original: thabs shes yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs shes yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are correctly engaged in means and knowledge.

original: de la sbyin pa ni zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There, giving is threefold, by the distinctions of giving material things, giving freedom from fear, and giving the Dharma.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that,

original: sbyin bdag dam pa dang / sbyin bdag chen po dang / sbyin bdag khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyin bdag dam pa dang / sbyin bdag chen po dang / sbyin bdag khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: He becomes a supreme donor, a great donor, an exalted donor.

original: tshul khrims kyang @115b sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang gsum mo //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang @115b sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang gsum mo //
translated: Morality is threefold: the morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring virtue, and the morality of acting for the benefit of beings.

original: de'i dbang du byas pa ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas pa ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi yin no //
translated: The four phrases beginning with ‚Äúhe becomes perfect in morality‚Äù are from the point of view of the latter.

original: de la dang po ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de la dang po ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: The first of these is the statement of the teaching.

original: yang na tha ma ni mjug bsdus pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: yang na tha ma ni mjug bsdus pa'i tshig go //
translated: Or else, the last is the statement of the conclusion.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i mchog tu 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i mchog tu 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: He becomes the foremost of the moral.

original: de tshul khrims kyang yin mchog kyang yin pa de gang dag la yod pa'o //
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyang yin mchog kyang yin pa de gang dag la yod pa'o //
translated: He is both moral and foremost, and he has that.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa khyad par du 'phags pa mchog gang dag la yod pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa khyad par du 'phags pa mchog gang dag la yod pa'o //
translated: The phrase those who are especially distinguished by morality refers to those who are especially distinguished by morality, who are superior.

original: yon tan rnams kyi lam ni yon tan gyi lam ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyi lam ni yon tan gyi lam ste /
translated: The path of virtues is the path of virtues.

original: tshul khrims nyid yon tan lam ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyid yon tan lam ste /
translated: Morality itself is the path of virtues.

original: de rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains that.

original: bstan pa 'di thos nas mos te zhes bya ba ni de bzhin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di thos nas mos te zhes bya ba ni de bzhin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Having heard this teaching, one has conviction, thinking it is so, which is to say, one ascertains it.

original: bzod pa'i mchog ces bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa dag la bya ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i mchog ces bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa dag la bya ste /
translated: The phrase the highest patience refers to the patience that is free of conceptualization.

original: blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa la sogs pa las ji snyed brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa la sogs pa las ji snyed brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the patience that is taught in the Aksayamatinirdesa and other scriptures.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni thabs dang smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni thabs dang smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par gzung ngo //
translated: The word also in the root text indicates that the perfections of skillful means, aspiration, power, and direct intuition should be understood as being included.

original: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni so so yang dag par rig pa dang / thugs rje chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni so so yang dag par rig pa dang / thugs rje chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: All aspects refers to the qualities of the analytical knowledges, great compassion, and so on.

original: de dang ldan zhing 'brel pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan par mdzad pa'i ye shes can yin no //
analyzed: de dang ldan zhing 'brel pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan par mdzad pa'i ye shes can yin no //
translated: He who possesses and is endowed with that is the Omniscient One, the one who has the knowledge that benefits the entire world.

original: de dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i bar du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni myur ba la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i bar du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni myur ba la dgongs pa'o //
translated: He who possesses that becomes endowed with the knowledge of the Omniscient One. This is the intention regarding swiftness.

original: rnam grangs gnyis su na shin tu nye bar gyur pa nyid kyis ni nges pa nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs gnyis su na shin tu nye bar gyur pa nyid kyis ni nges pa nyid kho na yin te /
translated: In another twofold enumeration, it is certain that he is very close,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa bye brag tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa bye brag tu byas pa'o //
translated: distinguishing the one who abides on the irreversible stage.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa bstan pas ni chos kyi sprin la gnas par bstan te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa bstan pas ni chos kyi sprin la gnas par bstan te /
translated: By teaching the purification of the perfections, it shows abiding in the Cloud of Dharma.

original: de la ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For there, all the perfections are purified.

original: gal te chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa tsam yang byang chub mchog 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa tsam yang byang chub mchog 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: If merely believing in this Dharma discourse leads to the attainment of supreme enlightenment,

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di kho nas yun ring por 'di dag ston pa mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di kho nas yun ring por 'di dag ston pa mdzad /
translated: why is it that only this noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ teaches these for a long time?

original: dus ring por rjes su bsgrubs bsgoms kyang da dung byang chub @116a * //
analyzed: dus ring por rjes su bsgrubs bsgoms kyang da dung byang chub @116a * //
translated: Even though he has practiced and cultivated them for a long time, he still has not attained supreme enlightenment.

original: mchog ma thob ces dogs pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mchog ma thob ces dogs pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel such doubts,

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis don gyi dbang ci zhig mthong zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis don gyi dbang ci zhig mthong zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
translated: it is asked, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, what power of meaning do you see? and so forth.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'dod ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'dod ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis 'di skad bstan te /
translated: By the words he does not wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, this is taught:

original: khyod la brten pa mtha' med pa dag gis kyang 'bad pa ma byas par 'di thob na /
analyzed: khyod la brten pa mtha' med pa dag gis kyang 'bad pa ma byas par 'di thob na /
translated: If, without making effort, you attain this by relying on me,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' dag rdzogs pa khyod kho na ci'i phyir 'di la 'bad pa chen pos sgrub par byed /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' dag rdzogs pa khyod kho na ci'i phyir 'di la 'bad pa chen pos sgrub par byed /
translated: You alone have completed all the collections of merit and wisdom. Why do you strive so greatly to accomplish this?

original: de bas na gzhan la rag las pa'i don cung zad cig mthong nas thob par mi 'dod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan la rag las pa'i don cung zad cig mthong nas thob par mi 'dod dam zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if you see even a slight purpose that depends on others, do you not wish to obtain it?

original: lan du / bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag byang chub tu zhugs na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lan du / bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag byang chub tu zhugs na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The reply is: Blessed One, if I were to set out for enlightenment, etc.

original: ci ste bdag byang chub kyi ched du yang dag par zhugs par gyur na ni de'i tshe de mngon du bgyi bar bdag 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste bdag byang chub kyi ched du yang dag par zhugs par gyur na ni de'i tshe de mngon du bgyi bar bdag 'dod de /
translated: If I were to set out for enlightenment, at that time I would wish to actualize it.

original: 'bad pa ni 'dod pa la mi 'khrul ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa ni 'dod pa la mi 'khrul ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because striving is not confused about what is desired.

original: ji tsam du /üîΩbcom ldan 'das bdag ni byang chub tu smon pa ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du / bcom ldan 'das bdag ni byang chub tu smon pa ste /
translated: To the extent thatüîΩBlessed One, I aspire to enlightenment,

original: byang chub don du gnyer ba ma lags so //
analyzed: byang chub don du gnyer ba ma lags so //
translated: but I do not strive for enlightenment.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' byang chub don du gnyer bar mi byed pa ji ltar rigs zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' byang chub don du gnyer bar mi byed pa ji ltar rigs zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the thought: how is it reasonable that a bodhisattva would not strive for enlightenment?

original: 'di ltar 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang lags pa de byang chub nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang lags pa de byang chub nyid yin no //
translated: Because, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ KumƒÅrabh≈´ta is just enlightenment itself.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is this:

original: byang chub ni gzung ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub ni gzung ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kho na yin gyi /
translated: Enlightenment is just the nature of wisdom free from the proliferation of the false imagination of the apprehended and so on.

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of something else.

original: 'jam dpal yang de lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi lus can kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal yang de lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi lus can kho na yin te /
translated: And Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ is just the embodiment of that kind of wisdom.

original: dar las bsgribs pa la sogs pa dper bya ba tsam yin no //
analyzed: dar las bsgribs pa la sogs pa dper bya ba tsam yin no //
translated: The examples of being covered by silk and so on are just that.

original: yang na sgrib pa med pa don du gnyer bar rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang na sgrib pa med pa don du gnyer bar rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or, is it not reasonable to strive for the unobscured?

original: ma yin te 'di ltar gang zhig byang chub yang dag par don du gnyer ba de ni de skyed pa'i dbang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te 'di ltar gang zhig byang chub yang dag par don du gnyer ba de ni de skyed pa'i dbang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: No, because one who is truly intent on enlightenment does not have the power to produce it.

original: bdag ni 'di 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa yin no //
translated: It depends on the mere wish of the other,

original: de bas na don du gnyer bar mi byed de /
analyzed: de bas na don du gnyer bar mi byed de /
translated: and so one does not strive for it.

original: yang na don dam par skye ba med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du ni gnyis ka yang dbyer med pas byang chub nyid 'jam dpal yin zhes dgongs pa'o //üîΩ'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di ci'i rgyus zab mo 'chad pa la mkhas snyam @116b du the tshom za ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na don dam par skye ba med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du ni gnyis ka yang dbyer med pas byang chub nyid 'jam dpal yin zhes dgongs pa'o // 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di ci'i rgyus zab mo 'chad pa la mkhas snyam @116b du the tshom za ba'i phyir /
translated: Or else, in ultimate reality, both are nondual, since they are not distinguished in their own nature, which is non-arisen. Thus, it is the thought that enlightenment itself is Manjusri.

original: 'jam dpal khyod zab mo zab mo'i gnas 'di lta bu ston pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod zab mo zab mo'i gnas 'di lta bu ston pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba bka' stsal to //
translated: Since the noble Manjusri is skilled in expounding the profound, the Lord said, Excellent, excellent, Manjusri! You have well taught this profound, profound subject.

original: zab mo zab pa zhes bya ba ni bse ru lta bu la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo zab pa zhes bya ba ni bse ru lta bu la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Profound, profound means that it is not the domain of the rhinoceros-like and others.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni phyogs la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni phyogs la bya'o //
translated: Subject refers to a position.

original: 'di ltar khyod ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus you means because you.

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang gis byas shing bsgrubs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang gis byas shing bsgrubs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is so called because you have done and accomplished the deeds characterized by generosity and so forth to the Victorious Ones of the past.

original: yang na sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams kyis chos zab mo 'chad pa'i bya ba byed par gang zhig bsgos pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams kyis chos zab mo 'chad pa'i bya ba byed par gang zhig bsgos pa byas pa'o //
translated: Or, it is so called because you have performed the deeds of explaining the profound Dharma that were cultivated by the Victorious Ones of the past.

original: mi dmigs par tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du ni dus ring por gang gis spyad cing goms par byas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs par tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du ni dus ring por gang gis spyad cing goms par byas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: You have practiced and become accustomed to the long-lasting pure conduct, which is non-apprehending, for a long time. It is so called because of that.

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Brahma is nirvana.

original: de'i ched du pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa spyod pa'o //
translated: It is for that purpose that you practice the perfections and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di de lta bur gyur pa de bas na 'di de lta bu ston to zhes bya ba ni mdo'i don yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di de lta bur gyur pa de bas na 'di de lta bu ston to zhes bya ba ni mdo'i don yin no //
translated: Because this noble Manjushri is like that, therefore he teaches like this. This is the meaning of the sutra.

original: 'phags pa yang bdag nyid dmigs su med pa goms pa yin par zur gyi tshul gyis de ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag mi dmigs par spyod pa lags na ni chos thob pa nyid du 'gyur ba lags so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: 'phags pa yang bdag nyid dmigs su med pa goms pa yin par zur gyi tshul gyis de ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag mi dmigs par spyod pa lags na ni chos thob pa nyid du 'gyur ba lags so zhes gsol to //
translated: Blessed One, if one practices without apprehending a self, then one would attain the Dharma.

original: 'dis ci bstan zhe na ;
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan zhe na ;
translated: What does this show?

original: mi dmigs par spyod par byed pas gal te bdag pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa yod na ni de'i tshe chos dang chos can du sgro btags nas 'dzin pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob pa kho nar yang 'gyur
analyzed: mi dmigs par spyod par byed pas gal te bdag pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa yod na ni de'i tshe chos dang chos can du sgro btags nas 'dzin pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob pa kho nar yang 'gyur
translated: If one practices the perfections with a self, then at that time one would attain the Dharma, which is characterized by the adherence to the apprehension of the superimposition of subject and object.

original: ba zhig na sgro 'dogs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir 'di bdag gis thob pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ba zhig na sgro 'dogs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir 'di bdag gis thob pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But because all superimpositions are abandoned, this is not my attainment.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dag la bdag mi dmigs par spyod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dag la bdag mi dmigs par spyod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And one does not practice the perfections without apprehending a self.

original: rang nyid dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the nature of the perfections, etc., which are not objects of perception.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di bkag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di bkag pa ma yin te /
translated: The Lord has not prohibited this,

original: gnang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has permitted it.

original: gal te 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: If this noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ is not an object of perception,

original: 'o na ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa dbye bas tha dad du gyur pa lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis @117a * //
analyzed: 'o na ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa dbye bas tha dad du gyur pa lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis @117a * //
translated: then the perfect disciples of the Lord, who are distinguished by their categories of the aids to penetration, etc., and who are understood by the world with its gods,

original: rtogs par bya ba rnams 'dis dmigs par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba rnams 'dis dmigs par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: will not perceive him.

original: de'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod kyis pas nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag mthong ngam zhes dris so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod kyis pas nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag mthong ngam zhes dris so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord asks, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, do you see these perfect disciples?‚Äù

original: phun sum tshogs pa ni mchog tu gyur pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa ni mchog tu gyur pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPerfect‚Äù means ‚Äúsupreme.‚Äù

original: bdag gis ji ltar mthong ba de ltar ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar mthong ba de ltar ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir //
translated: The world with its gods does not see things as I see them.

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das mthong lags so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mthong lags so zhes gsol to //
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, I see it.‚Äù

original: ma rtogs pa de'i bsam pa la ltos nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa de'i bsam pa la ltos nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One, considering his lack of understanding, said,

original: ji ltar ci 'dra bar mthong zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: ji ltar ci 'dra bar mthong zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: ‚ÄúHow do you see it? What is it like?‚Äù

original: ji lta ji lta bu zhes bya ba'i don dang de mthong na mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yin na ji ltar mi 'gal zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: ji lta ji lta bu zhes bya ba'i don dang de mthong na mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yin na ji ltar mi 'gal zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhow‚Äù and ‚Äúwhat‚Äù is this: if it is seen, it has the nature of not being observed. How is it not contradictory?

original: so so'i skye bo'i dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: The ordinary person is one who has attained the heat stage of the path of preparation.

original: slob pa ni zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum mo //
analyzed: slob pa ni zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum mo //
translated: The learner is one who is in one of the four stages of entering the path or in one of the three stages of the path of seeing.

original: mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The nonlearner is the arhat.

original: thams cad kyang don dam pa'i tshul la gnas pa'i tshe mthong ba yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: thams cad kyang don dam pa'i tshul la gnas pa'i tshe mthong ba yang ma mchis so //
translated: When all of them abide in the ultimate way, they do not see anything.‚Äù

original: sngar ni re re nas tshig rdzogs par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar ni re re nas tshig rdzogs par byas pa yin no //
translated: Previously, each was completed with a word.

original: 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is a general indication.

original: bye brag ni de yin no //
analyzed: bye brag ni de yin no //
translated: The specific is that.

original: kun rdzob kyi lam la gnas pa ni ma mthong pa yang ma mchis pa lags te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi lam la gnas pa ni ma mthong pa yang ma mchis pa lags te /
translated: One who abides in the path of conventionality does not see even non-existence.

original: mthong ba kho na lags so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mthong ba kho na lags so zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that it is only seeing.

original: 'jig rten gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas mthong ba yang bdag gis mngon par zhen pa med par mthong ba yin pa de ltar mthong ngo zhes gsol to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas mthong ba yang bdag gis mngon par zhen pa med par mthong ba yin pa de ltar mthong ngo zhes gsol to //
translated: From the perspective of worldly truth, seeing is also seeing without attachment to self. It is seen in that way.

original: ji ltar de ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that so?

original: 'dir mang du yang mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir mang du yang mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Here, it is said that one does not see much, etc.

original: mang ba ni so so'i skye bo ste /
analyzed: mang ba ni so so'i skye bo ste /
translated: Many refers to ordinary beings.

original: de dag phal che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag phal che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the majority.

original: nyung du ni slob pa dang mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: nyung du ni slob pa dang mi slob pa ste /
translated: Few refers to those in training and those beyond training.

original: de dag dkon pa nyid kyis nyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dkon pa nyid kyis nyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are few due to their rarity.

original: nyung ba ni su yin /
analyzed: nyung ba ni su yin /
translated: Who are the few?

original: mang ba ni su yin zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: mang ba ni su yin zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Who are the many?

original: de'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show their division, it is said:

original: dul bar yang mi mthong ma dul bar yang mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dul bar yang mi mthong ma dul bar yang mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: One does not see them as disciplined, nor does one see them as undisciplined.

original: gzhan yang mi dmigs pa nyid la ltos nas brgal ba dang / gal te mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin na bcom ldan 'das kyi la bor phun sum tshogs pa dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag ji ltar dmigs @117b par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dmigs pa nyid la ltos nas brgal ba dang / gal te mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin na bcom ldan 'das kyi la bor phun sum tshogs pa dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag ji ltar dmigs @117b par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Moreover, in dependence on the very non-apprehension, there is the objection: If they have the nature of non-apprehension, how can the Blessed One‚Äôs perfect abandonment and the bodhisattvas be apprehended?

original: de'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams de ltar mthong na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor rang bzhin mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams de ltar mthong na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor rang bzhin mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, if you see the hearers in that way, you see the TathƒÅgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang de kho na bzhin no zhes lan glan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang de kho na bzhin no zhes lan glan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas are also just like that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos kyang rjes su mi mthong zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos kyang rjes su mi mthong zhes gsungs te /
translated: One does not see even the dharma called ‚Äúbodhisattva.‚Äù

original: thams cad yod par dbye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang / gnas skabs kyang bdag dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su zhi ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la byang chub kyi phyir sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: thams cad yod par dbye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang / gnas skabs kyang bdag dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su zhi ba yin pa'i phyir ro // de la byang chub kyi phyir sems dpa' ste /
translated: and free from conceptual thoughts such as the differentiation of all things as existent, and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa thob pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa thog ma'i gnas skabs kyi byang chub sems dpa' yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa thob pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa thog ma'i gnas skabs kyi byang chub sems dpa' yin no //
translated: The state of the bodhisattva is the state of the bodhisattva who has attained the generation of the thought of enlightenment, who is in the first stage, the stage of action from faith.

original: byang chub tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'o //üîΩbyang chub kyi phyir spyod do zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'o // byang chub kyi phyir spyod do zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The one who has entered into enlightenment is the one who is in the stage of action from faith.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i bar yin no //
translated: The one who practices for the sake of enlightenment is the one who is in the stage of joy and so on, up to the one who is impeded by only one birth.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha ma pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha ma pa'o //
translated: The one who has fully awakened to enlightenment is the one in his last existence.

original: yang brgal ba gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs na ni de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang brgal ba gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs na ni de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, if the TathƒÅgata were to be apprehended, then at that time it would contradict his nature of non-apprehension.

original: 'on te ma yin na ni de'i tshe mthong ba la bstan pa'i dge ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa de dag ji ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la sogs par 'gyur snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin na ni de'i tshe mthong ba la bstan pa'i dge ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa de dag ji ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la sogs par 'gyur snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: But if not, then at that time, how could those abundant crops of virtue taught in the s≈´tras be for the benefit of oneself and others?

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar mthong zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar mthong zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thinking this, [the Buddha] said, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, how do you see the TathƒÅgata?

original: glang po chen po zhog shig ces bya ba ni lan bka' stsal pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po chen po zhog shig ces bya ba ni lan bka' stsal pa yin no //
translated: Do not move, O Great Elephant is the reply.

original: glang po chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: glang po chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bya ste /
translated: Great Elephant refers to the TathƒÅgata.üîΩAs it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa glang chen ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa glang chen ni //
translated: The TathƒÅgata, the Great Elephant,

original: rtag tu mnyam gzhag spyod pa yin //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam gzhag spyod pa yin //
translated: Always abides in meditative equipoise.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: glang po chen po ma bskyod cig //
analyzed: glang po chen po ma bskyod cig //
translated: Do not move, O Great Elephant!

original: de bskyod na ni de mthong ste mngon par zhen pas bskyod pa'i dge ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bskyod na ni de mthong ste mngon par zhen pas bskyod pa'i dge ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is shaken, it is seen, and the entire perfect crop of virtue shaken by attachment is destroyed.

original: yang dag par mos pa dang bral nas med pa'i lta bar ltung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par mos pa dang bral nas med pa'i lta bar ltung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, having lost right faith, one falls into the view of non-existence.

original: de bas na ma brtags na dga' ba nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das ni gdul bya'i bye brag gi phyir bzhugs na ches legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma brtags na dga' ba nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das ni gdul bya'i bye brag gi phyir bzhugs na ches legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One, who is pleased with the unexamined, would be better off remaining in the world for the sake of the variety of disciples.

original: 'dir 'dus pa de kho na nyid zab mo thos pa rnams la ya mtshan bskyed pa'i phyir @118a * //
analyzed: 'dir 'dus pa de kho na nyid zab mo thos pa rnams la ya mtshan bskyed pa'i phyir @118a * //
translated: Here, it is said in order to generate wonder in those who have heard the profound reality of the assembly,

original: dang ; bar du chod pa'i bya ba dag bya ba'i phyir yang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dang ; bar du chod pa'i bya ba dag bya ba'i phyir yang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and in order to perform the interrupted action.

original: de lta ma yin na de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i dogs par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i dogs par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could there be doubt immediately after it is said?

original: gzhan dag blo ma sbyangs shing khyad par can gyi skal ba thob pa dang bral ba 'dus pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis de dag mi nyan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag blo ma sbyangs shing khyad par can gyi skal ba thob pa dang bral ba 'dus pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis de dag mi nyan to //
translated: Others, whose minds are untrained and who lack the attainment of special good fortune, assemble, but by the power of the Tathagata, they do not listen to it.

original: de bas na lhag par ya mtshan du gyur pa'i chos 'khor la gzigs nas skabs la bab pa dang skye bo mang po la phan par bya ba'i phyir glang po chen po'i rang gi ngo bo thog ma nyid du 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na lhag par ya mtshan du gyur pa'i chos 'khor la gzigs nas skabs la bab pa dang skye bo mang po la phan par bya ba'i phyir glang po chen po'i rang gi ngo bo thog ma nyid du 'dri ba ni /
translated: Therefore, having seen the wheel of Dharma that is especially wondrous, he asks about the nature of the great elephant at the proper time and for the benefit of many people:

original: 'jam dpal sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dags zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dags zhes gsungs so //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, what is the meaning of the word ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù?

original: de'i ngo bo mdor ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo mdor ston pa ni /
translated: The brief teaching on its nature is:

original: bdag ces bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: What is the meaning of the word ‚Äúself‚Äù?

original: bdag ces bya ba ni mu stegs pas yongs su brtags pa bdag go snyam pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni mu stegs pas yongs su brtags pa bdag go snyam pa'i yul lo //
translated: The word ‚Äúself‚Äù is the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù that is imagined by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar bya ba dngos po'i cha 'ga' yang der ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar bya ba dngos po'i cha 'ga' yang der ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-arisen‚Äù means that no aspect of an entity that is to be taken as a sign has arisen there.

original: bdag ces bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dags yin pa sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de yang de'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dags yin pa sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de yang de'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúself‚Äù is a designation for what? The term ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù is a designation for that. This is the meaning of ‚Äúits nature.‚Äù

original: de la yang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa mtshan mar bya ba'i dngos po'i bag tsam yang yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa mtshan mar bya ba'i dngos po'i bag tsam yang yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the cause for the application of the term is not established in the slightest in the entity that is to be characterized.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta ste sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni gzhi med pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta ste sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni gzhi med pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs te /
translated: For this very reason, it is said, ‚ÄúThe term ‚ÄòBuddha‚Äô is a designation without basis.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: 'di 'am 'di la gzhi med pas gzhi med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di 'am 'di la gzhi med pas gzhi med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is without basis here or there. It is without basis.

original: de'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: de'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: That is its designation.‚Äù

original: 'dis don rtogs par byed cing khong du chud par byed pas gzhi ste tshig la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis don rtogs par byed cing khong du chud par byed pas gzhi ste tshig la bya'o //
translated: The basis is the word, because it causes the understanding and comprehension of the meaning.

original: gang gis skye 'gro mtha' dag gi yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa la mkhas pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la rjod par byed pa dang 'brel pa'i gnas 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis skye 'gro mtha' dag gi yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa la mkhas pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la rjod par byed pa dang 'brel pa'i gnas 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: There is no basis for describing the nature of the Blessed One‚Äôs body as a quality of skill in fulfilling the hopes of all living beings.

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid brtag pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i blo can byis pa rnams kyi spobs pa rang dbang du byung nas mtshan sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes yang dag par mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid brtag pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i blo can byis pa rnams kyi spobs pa rang dbang du byung nas mtshan sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes yang dag par mngon par zhen to //
translated: Fools who turn their backs on the reality of things have the audacity to think, ‚ÄúThe name ‚ÄòBuddha‚Äô exists.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya bar brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan de la yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya bar brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan de la yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The reason for using the term ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù does not exist.

original: ston par byed pa'i tshig bla dags yin te de dag gis sgro btags pa yin no //
analyzed: ston par byed pa'i tshig bla dags yin te de dag gis sgro btags pa yin no //
translated: It is a designation that is used to teach, and it is a superimposition.

original: don gnyis pa 'di yang sgrub pa'i tshul dang mthun @118b par 'brel bar bstan to //
analyzed: don gnyis pa 'di yang sgrub pa'i tshul dang mthun @118b par 'brel bar bstan to //
translated: This second point is also taught in a way that is consistent with the method of proof.

original: de la dang po rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dang po rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove the first point, it says:

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni tshig gis shes par dka' ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni tshig gis shes par dka' ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù is difficult to understand with words.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar re zhig tshig kyang 'di ni tshig go zhes brtag par dka' ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig tshig kyang 'di ni tshig go zhes brtag par dka' ste /
translated: Because it is difficult to investigate even words, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is a word.‚Äù

original: shes par bya zhing gtan la dbab par mi nus te sla ba ma yin na /
analyzed: shes par bya zhing gtan la dbab par mi nus te sla ba ma yin na /
translated: It is not easy to understand and ascertain.

original: des bzhag cing bstan par bya ba'i don sangs rgyas zhes bya ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: des bzhag cing bstan par bya ba'i don sangs rgyas zhes bya ba lta ci smos /
translated: How much more so is it difficult to understand the meaning of ‚Äúbuddha‚Äù that is established and taught by that word?

original: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The intention is as follows.

original: rjod par byed pa yang sgra'i ngo bo la tshig ces brjod na /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa yang sgra'i ngo bo la tshig ces brjod na /
translated: If the expression is called a ‚Äúword‚Äù in the nature of sound,

original: de yang sgra'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: de yang sgra'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: is that the definition of sound,

original: spyi 'am blo la gzugs brnyan du 'dug pa zhig yin grang /
analyzed: spyi 'am blo la gzugs brnyan du 'dug pa zhig yin grang /
translated: or is it a universal, or is it an image in the mind?

original: kun kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: None of these is correct.

original: de bas na 'di ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis sgra'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin pas dngos po'i de bzhin nyid dpyod pa lhur len pa khyod kyis brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis sgra'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin pas dngos po'i de bzhin nyid dpyod pa lhur len pa khyod kyis brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since this is the application of the convention of sound through the power of error, it is not possible for you, who are intent on investigating the suchness of things, to investigate it.

original: rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo bkag pa nyid kyis de la ltos te rab tu brtags pa brjod par bya ba nyid kyang rab tu bkag pa kho na yin no //üîΩ'on kyang de bkar te yang dgag par bya ba'i phyir gnyis pa'i don du /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo bkag pa nyid kyis de la ltos te rab tu brtags pa brjod par bya ba nyid kyang rab tu bkag pa kho na yin no // 'on kyang de bkar te yang dgag par bya ba'i phyir gnyis pa'i don du /
translated: By the very refutation of the nature of the expounder, the expounded, which depends on that, is also refuted.

original: gang yang dag par ma grub pa dang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang yang dag par ma grub pa dang zhes gsungs te /
translated: But in order to refute that, he says, ‚Äúthat which is not established as real.‚Äù

original: rkyen tshogs pa las thog mar byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen tshogs pa las thog mar byung ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise in the beginning from the collection of conditions.

original: ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu rgyun du 'jug cing gnas par 'du shes pa'i ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu rgyun du 'jug cing gnas par 'du shes pa'i ma skyes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot arisen‚Äù means that it does not arise in the subsequent continuum, as the notion of enduring.

original: mi 'gag pa ste zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad par 'gags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gag pa ste zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad par 'gags pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot ceasing‚Äù means that it does not cease through the interruption of the continuum.

original: bdag la sogs pa mtshan mar bya ba'i tshig gi gnas su gyur pa gang chos gang dang yang mi ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de la gzhi tshig gang yang med do //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa mtshan mar bya ba'i tshig gi gnas su gyur pa gang chos gang dang yang mi ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de la gzhi tshig gang yang med do //
translated: The Blessed One, who is not associated with any dharma, who is not a basis for verbal expression, which is the basis for the performance of the examination of signs such as self, does not have any basis for verbal expression.

original: ji lta bu zhe na gzhi dbyer med pa 'di la dbyer med pas dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na gzhi dbyer med pa 'di la dbyer med pas dbyer med pa ste /
translated: How is that? ‚ÄúIn this indivisible basis, there is no division, because of non-division.‚Äù

original: kun du 'gro ba spyi zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba spyi zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: up to ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù is called ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù.

original: de'i gzhi ni 'di'i gnas dang rten zhes tshig sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni 'di'i gnas dang rten zhes tshig sbyar te /
translated: The basis of that is the abode and support of this, as the sentence is constructed.

original: de'i gzhi med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / tshig gi yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: de'i gzhi med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / tshig gi yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout basis‚Äù, ‚Äúwithout abode‚Äù, and ‚Äúnot the domain of words‚Äù is just that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:üîΩ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù is the designation for that.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de ni de'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pas sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de ni de'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pas sgro btags pa ste /
translated: This is the superimposition due to the lack of complete purity of the practice of wisdom,

original: de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to engage with reality.

original: 'dir mdo ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir mdo ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here is the s≈´tra:

original: tshig gis brjod par bya ba'i don rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gam /üîΩmtshan ma la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: tshig gis brjod par bya ba'i don rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gam / mtshan ma la sogs pa'am /
translated: Is the meaning that is expressed by words the individual characteristic,üîΩor the universal characteristic, etc.

original: spyi 'am / blo la gzugs brnyan yod pa zhig yin grang /
analyzed: spyi 'am / blo la gzugs brnyan yod pa zhig yin grang /
translated: , or is it the mental image?

original: de la @119a * //
analyzed: de la @119a * //
translated: Regarding that,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni skyes ma thag tu med par gyur pas zhes pa la sogs par ma nus shing brjod par bya ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni skyes ma thag tu med par gyur pas zhes pa la sogs par ma nus shing brjod par bya ba med do //
translated: the individual characteristic is not able to be expressed, as it is said, ‚Äúbecause it ceases immediately upon arising‚Äù, and so on.

original: mtshan ma la sogs pa yang rtogs pas rang dgar byas pa nyid kyi phyir yang dag par med do //
analyzed: mtshan ma la sogs pa yang rtogs pas rang dgar byas pa nyid kyi phyir yang dag par med do //
translated: And because of the self-indulgence of conceptualization, such as with regard to characteristics, etc., they are not real.

original: dngos po nyid yod na ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin te de la yang skyon smras zin to //
analyzed: dngos po nyid yod na ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin te de la yang skyon smras zin to //
translated: If there were an entity, it would be by way of its own characteristic, and the error with regard to that has already been stated.

original: spyi yang logs shig pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor yod pa ni blo la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi yang logs shig pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor yod pa ni blo la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And a universal, as something else, etc., does not exist in the mind,

original: sna tshogs snang ba'i blo las nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba'i blo las nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not experienced in the mind that appears as a multiplicity.

original: gang ming tsam dang rjes su 'brel zhing rnam par rtog pa la gzugs brnyan tsam phyi rol na yod pa 'dra bar snang ba de la don yin par gtam dgod par 'dod de smra ba de ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang ming tsam dang rjes su 'brel zhing rnam par rtog pa la gzugs brnyan tsam phyi rol na yod pa 'dra bar snang ba de la don yin par gtam dgod par 'dod de smra ba de ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yin no //
translated: That which is related to mere names and appears as if it were an external reality, like a mere reflection in a conceptual mind, is asserted to be the object of discourse. But that is due to the power of error.

original: 'khrul te snang ba de yang ji ltar snang bzhin du 'dod pa'i phyir gang yang dag par ma grub pa la sogs par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul te snang ba de yang ji ltar snang bzhin du 'dod pa'i phyir gang yang dag par ma grub pa la sogs par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And that error appears as if it were real, because it is accepted as it appears. Therefore, it is said to be not established as real, etc.

original: 'di don gyi ngo bor yang rigs pa ma yin te mi gsal ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di don gyi ngo bor yang rigs pa ma yin te mi gsal ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable that this is the essence of the object, because it is unclear, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku 'di dag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa yin na thabs gang gis rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku 'di dag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa yin na thabs gang gis rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: If the domain of these bodies of the Lord is beyond all domains, by what means is it to be realized?

original: de'i phyir btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa tshol bar 'dod pas ni bdag btsal bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa tshol bar 'dod pas ni bdag btsal bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThe Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, those who seek the TathƒÅgata should seek the self.‚Äù

original: brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya'o //
translated: They should investigate it.

original: de gnyis 'brel pa ci zhig yod na gang gis de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de la tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de gnyis 'brel pa ci zhig yod na gang gis de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de la tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the two, by which one seeks the one in order to realize the other?

original: bdag ces bya ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi tshig bla dags te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi tshig bla dags te zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe self is a synonym for the Buddha.‚Äù

original: chos nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that it is the same as reality.

original: mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni ji ltar bdag ces bya ba mu stegs kyis yongs su brtags pa de ni shin tu med cing yod pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni ji ltar bdag ces bya ba mu stegs kyis yongs su brtags pa de ni shin tu med cing yod pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs so //
translated: The teaching of sameness is this: Just as what is called ‚Äúself‚Äù is totally nonexistent and does not exist, therefore it is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang shin tu med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang shin tu med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, a buddha is totally nonexistent and not apprehended.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ma lus pa rtogs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ma lus pa rtogs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt a buddha said to be so called because of realizing all things without exception, such as the past?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni 'das pa gzigs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni 'das pa gzigs //
translated: The Buddha sees the past.üîΩAnd so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhe na de lta ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar rtogs pa po yang med /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhe na de lta ma yin te / 'di ltar rtogs pa po yang med /
translated: That is not so.üîΩBecause there is no knower,

original: rtogs pa yang med /
analyzed: rtogs pa yang med /
translated: no knowledge,

original: rtogs par bya ba yang med de /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba yang med de /
translated: and no object of knowledge,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of being free from apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de @119b bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis ni 'das pa la mi slu ba'i mkhyen pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de @119b bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis ni 'das pa la mi slu ba'i mkhyen pa 'byung ste /
translated: By the power of the TathƒÅgata, knowledge arises that is undeceiving with regard to the past.

original: de'i ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis de skad brjod do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis de skad brjod do //
translated: It is called that because of the power of attachment to its nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: ji ltar bdag ces bya ba 'das pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa'i chos gang gis kyang tshig tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ltar ston pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag ces bya ba 'das pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa'i chos gang gis kyang tshig tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ltar ston pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: just as the so-called self is not to be expressed in words by any dharma that is fully understood, such as past, etc., so also is the Teacher.

original: de ltar ston pa gang la yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo grangs su bgrang ba gang yang yod pa ma yin yang de'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i 'khrul pa'i dri ma thams cad kyis ma sbags pa'i mkhyen pa'i byin rlabs kyis 'gro ba rnams kyi dang ba phun sum tshogs pa sgrub
analyzed: de ltar ston pa gang la yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo grangs su bgrang ba gang yang yod pa ma yin yang de'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i 'khrul pa'i dri ma thams cad kyis ma sbags pa'i mkhyen pa'i byin rlabs kyis 'gro ba rnams kyi dang ba phun sum tshogs pa sgrub
translated: Thus, although there is nothing at all that is fully understood or that is the nature of full understanding, etc., which is counted in enumeration, still, by the power of the knowledge that is uncontaminated by any stain of error that grasps that as a thing, he accomplishes the perfect faith of beings.

original: par mdzad pa la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par mdzad pa la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called a Buddha because he accomplishes the perfect faith of beings.

original: gal te thabs 'dis bcom ldan 'das la blta bar bya ba yin na de ni sla ba kho na yin na de'i phyir 'di la 'bad pa chen po byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te thabs 'dis bcom ldan 'das la blta bar bya ba yin na de ni sla ba kho na yin na de'i phyir 'di la 'bad pa chen po byed ce na /
translated: If it is easy to see the Bhagavan through this method, then why do you exert great effort in this?

original: thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa la snying por blo skyed cing rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa la snying por blo skyed cing rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate the mind that takes hearing and contemplation to be the essence and to eliminate conceptualization,

original: bdag ces bya ba'i gzhi'i tshig bla dags de ni shes par sla ba ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i gzhi'i tshig bla dags de ni shes par sla ba ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said that the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is not easy to understand.

original: nga'o snyam pa ni thog ma med pa nas goms pa yin pa'i phyir bsgoms pa mchog tu mthar phyin pa las skyes pa'i shes pa med par thos pa tsam snying por byed pas bsal bar mi nus te /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa ni thog ma med pa nas goms pa yin pa'i phyir bsgoms pa mchog tu mthar phyin pa las skyes pa'i shes pa med par thos pa tsam snying por byed pas bsal bar mi nus te /
translated: Since the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is habituated in beginningless samsara, it cannot be eliminated by making mere hearing the essence, without the wisdom arisen from the culmination of the supreme meditation.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni yul byed pa nyid rnam par sun 'byin pas sel bar byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni yul byed pa nyid rnam par sun 'byin pas sel bar byed la /
translated: Thus the self is eliminated by the repudiation of the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: de sun 'byin pa yang med par bsgoms pa mthar phyin pa las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sun 'byin pa yang med par bsgoms pa mthar phyin pa las 'gyur ro //
translated: And that repudiation occurs through the culmination of meditation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te chos la bdag med so sor rtog / so sor brtags te gal te sgom byed na //
analyzed: gal te chos la bdag med so sor rtog / so sor brtags te gal te sgom byed na //
translated: and if one meditates on what has been discerned,

original: rgyu des 'bras bu mya ngan 'das pa thob//
analyzed: rgyu des 'bras bu mya ngan 'das pa thob//
translated: then through that cause one attains the result, nirvana.

original: rgyu gzhan gyis ni zhi bar 'gyur ba med //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyis ni zhi bar 'gyur ba med // ces gsungs so //
translated: There is no peace through any other cause.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i gzhi'i tshig bla dags de ni gzhi med pa nyid kyis yang dag par shes par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i gzhi'i tshig bla dags de ni gzhi med pa nyid kyis yang dag par shes par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The condensed meaning is this: the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is not easily understood because it is groundless.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i gzhi'i tshig bla dags kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i gzhi'i tshig bla dags kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The term ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù is also like that.

original: dngos por mngon par zhen pa ni thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa bsgom pa med par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos por mngon par zhen pa ni thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa bsgom pa med par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since clinging to things has been accumulated since beginningless time, it does not disappear without cultivating non-apprehension.

original: de bas na 'dir don ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa kho na mngon du bya dgos pa yin pas 'di nyid la 'bad de gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir don ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa kho na mngon du bya dgos pa yin pas 'di nyid la 'bad de gnas par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here the meaning is that only the knowledge arisen from meditation must be realized, so one should strive in just that and abide in it.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal @120a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal @120a * //
translated: ƒÄrya Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´

original: nyid kyi mthus shes par byas zin pa rang nyid la rjes su brtse ba yod pa dang bcas pa bzhin du gsar du zhugs pa rnams la yin la /
analyzed: nyid kyi mthus shes par byas zin pa rang nyid la rjes su brtse ba yod pa dang bcas pa bzhin du gsar du zhugs pa rnams la yin la /
translated: Just as he has compassion for those who have already understood through his power, so too for those who are newly engaged.

original: ji ltar las dang po pas 'tshal bar 'gyur ba de lta bur mi ston to zhes brjod /
analyzed: ji ltar las dang po pas 'tshal bar 'gyur ba de lta bur mi ston to zhes brjod /
translated: He does not teach in such a way that beginners can understand.

original: ci'i phyir gsal bar ma bstan te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsal bar ma bstan te /
translated: Why is it not clearly taught?

original: don gyis ni las dang po pa rnams kyang khong du chud par 'gyur ba de ltar bstan to //
analyzed: don gyis ni las dang po pa rnams kyang khong du chud par 'gyur ba de ltar bstan to //
translated: It is taught in such a way that beginners can also understand through the meaning.

original: 'phags pa yang rnam par rtog pa lhag ma brtsam par bzhed nas bdag nyid kyi shes pa 'byung ba 'di gsal bar bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa yang rnam par rtog pa lhag ma brtsam par bzhed nas bdag nyid kyi shes pa 'byung ba 'di gsal bar bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The noble one, wishing to begin the remaining concepts, in order to clarify his own arising cognition, said:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu kho bo ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa byas pa srung ba can gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu kho bo ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa byas pa srung ba can gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, I am like an arhat who guards what has been done.

original: rtogs pa ni byas pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa ni byas pa ste /
translated: Realization is what has been done.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams ched du srung zhing yod par byed pa'i ngang tshul can gang dag yin pa de dag ni byas pa srung ba can yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams ched du srung zhing yod par byed pa'i ngang tshul can gang dag yin pa de dag ni byas pa srung ba can yin te /
translated: Those who have the nature of protecting and maintaining the mental factors such as the pleasure of abiding in the present life are those who protect what they have done.

original: dgra bcom pa rtogs pa rnam par grol ba dbang po rnon po zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rtogs pa rnam par grol ba dbang po rnon po zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: They are arhats liberated by wisdom, and so on up to those of sharp faculty who are liberated by both parts.

original: kho bo ni ji ltar sus kyang zhes bya ba'i tshig ni thams cad kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo ni ji ltar sus kyang zhes bya ba'i tshig ni thams cad kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúno one at all‚Äù are a summary of all the above.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyi bar du yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyi bar du yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One is to be understood as well.

original: des na 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Therefore, this is taught:

original: ji ltar shes pa dang brjod pa mtha' dag las yang dag par 'das par bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi ched du de ltar bdag ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa dang brjod pa mtha' dag las yang dag par 'das par bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi ched du de ltar bdag ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúI teach the Dharma in this way for the sake of enlightenment, in order to transcend all cognition and expression.

original: de dag gi spyod yul yang ma yin na las dang po pa dngos po'i mtha' la gnas pa rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de dag gi spyod yul yang ma yin na las dang po pa dngos po'i mtha' la gnas pa rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If it is not even the domain of those who have attained the result, what need is there to speak of beginners who abide in the limit of existence?‚Äù

original: byang chub ni de dag nyid la shes pa dang brjod pa thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub ni de dag nyid la shes pa dang brjod pa thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
translated: Enlightenment is the transcendence of all objects of cognition and expression.

original: dri ba brtsam pa'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dri ba brtsam pa'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to begin the question, he says, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa dang tshig gi yul ma yin na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ji ltar mngon du byas nas bstan zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang tshig gi yul ma yin na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ji ltar mngon du byas nas bstan zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i don yin no //
translated: If it is not the object of cognition and expression, how did the Lord realize it and teach it? This is the meaning of the question.

original: 'di ltar byang chub ni sus kyang rnam par ma shes zhes bya ba nas ma bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub ni sus kyang rnam par ma shes zhes bya ba nas ma bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because no one has known enlightenment, up to because it has not been shown.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bstan pa'i bar du sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'di la ma gtogs par byed pa po 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bstan pa'i bar du sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'di la ma gtogs par byed pa po 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, except for the previously explained cognition and expression, there is no other agent, no entity of the nature of a grasping self.

original: de la sus kyang rnam par ma shes pa ni spyi'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: de la sus kyang rnam par ma shes pa ni spyi'i rnam par ro //
translated: There, ‚Äúno one has known‚Äù is in general.

original: sus kyang @120b mngon par rdzogs par ma rtogs pa ni bye brag gi ngo bor ro //
analyzed: sus kyang @120b mngon par rdzogs par ma rtogs pa ni bye brag gi ngo bor ro //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúnot realized‚Äù is that it is not realized in a specific way.

original: ma mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot seen‚Äù means not seen by the eye consciousness.

original: ma thos pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: ma thos pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot heard‚Äù means not heard by the ear consciousness.

original: bye brag ma phyed pa dang rnam par ma shes pa gnyis kyang brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bye brag ma phyed pa dang rnam par ma shes pa gnyis kyang brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: The terms ‚Äúnot distinguished‚Äù and ‚Äúnot known‚Äù should be explained in the same way.

original: gnyis ni nye bar mtshon par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ni nye bar mtshon par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The terms ‚Äúnot seen‚Äù and ‚Äúnot heard‚Äù are used to illustrate the other two terms.

original: yang na yul ring po 'di gnyis kyang re zhig gzung bar bya ba ma yin na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: yang na yul ring po 'di gnyis kyang re zhig gzung bar bya ba ma yin na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir gnyis bstan to //
translated: Or, the two terms ‚Äúnot seen‚Äù and ‚Äúnot heard‚Äù are used to illustrate the other two terms, because the other two objects are distant and not immediately apprehended.

original: yang na tshig snga ma gnyis ni bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na tshig snga ma gnyis ni bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Or, the first two terms are from the perspective of distinguishing and knowing,

original: ma dran pa ni rjes su myong ba sngon du song ba'i dran pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: ma dran pa ni rjes su myong ba sngon du song ba'i dran pa'i shes pas so //
translated: ‚Äúnot remembered‚Äù means not remembered by the memory consciousness that has experienced something previously.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par mi shes pa nas ma dran pa'i bar du yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par mi shes pa nas ma dran pa'i bar du yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the terms ‚Äúnot known‚Äù up to ‚Äúnot remembered‚Äù used?

original: 'di ltar ma skyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyed pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is not produced.

original: bskyed na ni de ma thag tu 'dzin pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed na ni de ma thag tu 'dzin pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were produced, it would be possible to apprehend it immediately.

original: ji ltar ma dran zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma dran zhe na /
translated: How is it not remembered?

original: gang gis ma bkag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis ma bkag pa ste /
translated: It is not remembered by anyone.

original: dran pa'i yul ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i yul ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of memory is the past.

original: ma smras pa ni rang gis so //
analyzed: ma smras pa ni rang gis so //
translated: It is not spoken of by itself.

original: ma bstan pa ni dris pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: ma bstan pa ni dris pa'i tshe'o //
translated: It is not taught when asked about.

original: gal te de ltar byang chub ni nang gi yin na de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed de dgos pa yang ci yod ce na /üîΩji tsam du byang chub ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste zhes gsungs te /
