analyzed: gal te de ltar byang chub ni nang gi yin na de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed de dgos pa yang ci yod ce na / ji tsam du byang chub ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste zhes gsungs te /
translated: If enlightenment is like this, and it is internal, then why do you strive to attain it?

original: ji tsam du byang chub ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du byang chub ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: To the extent that there is what is called ‚Äúenlightenment,‚Äù to that extent there is what is called ‚Äúthe attainment of enlightenment.‚ÄùüîΩTo the extent that there is what is called ‚Äúenlightenment,‚Äù to that extent there is what is called ‚Äúthe attainment of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: byang chub ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúattainment of enlightenment‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúenlightenment.‚Äù

original: de ni rang dang gzhan gyi don byed pa 'di lta bu gang yin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang dang gzhan gyi don byed pa 'di lta bu gang yin pa yin no //
translated: It is this kind of activity that accomplishes the benefit of self and other.

original: 'dis ni mchog yin par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni mchog yin par bstan te /
translated: This shows that it is supreme.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub de yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub de yang yod pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the nature of the supreme of all perfections, that enlightenment exists.

original: de ltar na byang chub ni byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub ni byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Thus, since enlightenment is the nature of an agent,

original: byed pa po la ltos pa'i phyir byed pa po yod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa po la ltos pa'i phyir byed pa po yod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and since it depends on an agent, the existence of an agent is obtained.

original: byed pa po yang las la rtsom pas byang chub par bya ba'i las kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa po yang las la rtsom pas byang chub par bya ba'i las kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since an agent is engaged in an action, the object of enlightenment, the action, also exists.

original: de ltar na byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med cing zhes bya ba rjes bzhin du ston pa thams cad dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med cing zhes bya ba rjes bzhin du ston pa thams cad dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, since it is said that ‚Äúthere is nothing whatsoever that is enlightened by enlightenment,‚Äù all of this would contradict the scriptures.

original: byang chub de yang dngos po ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub de yang dngos po ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: But that enlightenment is not a thing.

original: byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúagent.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te byed pa med na go ji ltar byang chub ces bya /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te byed pa med na go ji ltar byang chub ces bya /
translated: Why is that? If there is no agent, how can there be enlightenment?

original: 'di ltar byang chub dang rtogs pa dang dngos po nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam @121a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub dang rtogs pa dang dngos po nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam @121a * //
translated: Thus, enlightenment, realization and the experience of things are synonyms.

original: grangs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: grangs yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that,

original: 'di ni kun brtags te brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni kun brtags te brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: then in order to demonstrate that this is a mere expression, an imputation,

original: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med cing zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med cing zhes gsungs te /
translated: but not the ultimate, it says that there is nothing whatsoever to be fully awakened to by means of enlightenment.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo la 'dzin pa mi sred pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo la 'dzin pa mi sred pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no apprehension of an extraneous essence.

original: 'o na rang la 'dzin pa la ltos nas byed pa rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro zhe na 'di yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyang byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na rang la 'dzin pa la ltos nas byed pa rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro zhe na 'di yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyang byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: If you think that it is posited in dependence on the apprehension of itself, then in order to demonstrate that this also does not exist, it says that enlightenment is not fully awakened to by means of enlightenment.

original: rang rig pa la yang bya ba dang byed pa dang byed pa po'i dngos po gzhag tu gcig la gsum gyi dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa la yang bya ba dang byed pa dang byed pa po'i dngos po gzhag tu gcig la gsum gyi dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, in terms of reflexive awareness, it is untenable to posit the entity of an action, an instrument, and an agent as one.

original: byang chub byed pa'i ngo bo la rgol ba pos brgal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub byed pa'i ngo bo la rgol ba pos brgal ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that the opponent has already refuted the entity that is awakened?

original: byed pa po'i ngo bo la ma rgal bar byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar de sel bar byed /
analyzed: byed pa po'i ngo bo la ma rgal bar byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar de sel bar byed /
translated: Since the opponent has already refuted the entity that is the agent, how could he dispel the statement ‚ÄúThere is nothing at all that is fully awakened to by the one who is awakened‚Äù?

original: byed pa'i ngo bo de ni byang chub la med cing gang la byang chub pa dang bdag nyid la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bsal ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: byed pa'i ngo bo de ni byang chub la med cing gang la byang chub pa dang bdag nyid la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bsal ba'i rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to dispel the statement ‚ÄúThe entity that is the agent does not exist in the one who is awakened and does not exist in the self‚Äù because the opponent has already refuted that.

original: de la brgal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la brgal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause the opponent has already refuted that,‚Äù

original: bden te 'on kyang byed pa po'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag kho na nyid bdag nyid du gyur pa ni byed pa zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang byed pa po'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag kho na nyid bdag nyid du gyur pa ni byed pa zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: that is true. However, the specific state of the agent itself is called ‚Äúthe agent.‚Äù

original: de las 'di gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las 'di gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not different from that.

original: byed pa po de'i ngo bo ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po de'i ngo bo ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not be the nature of that agent.

original: byed pa po de'i ngo bo yang logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po de'i ngo bo yang logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And it is taught that the nature of that agent does not exist separately.

original: byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúthere is nothing whatsoever that is awakened to by enlightenment,‚Äù and so forth.

original: de bas na gnyis su med pa rang rig pa tsam dri mas ma sbags pa gtso bor byas te /
analyzed: de bas na gnyis su med pa rang rig pa tsam dri mas ma sbags pa gtso bor byas te /
translated: Therefore, nondual self-awareness alone, uncontaminated by impurities, is taken as primary.

original: byang chub ces btags te gzhag go //
analyzed: byang chub ces btags te gzhag go //
translated: It is designated and posited as ‚Äúenlightenment.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs pa yin no //
translated: This eliminates the extreme of superimposition.

original: byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med na /
analyzed: byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ci yang med na /
translated: If there is nothing whatsoever that is awakened to by enlightenment,

original: byang chub ni bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings de ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas she na /
analyzed: byang chub ni bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings de ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas she na /
translated: then how is it that the Blessed One himself has fully awakened to the expanse of reality, which is enlightenment?

original: de'i phyir / 'jam dpal bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam zhes tshig zur gyis dris te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'jam dpal bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam zhes tshig zur gyis dris te /
translated: Therefore, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the Blessed One, having been asked by the Blessed One, ‚ÄúHave you fully awakened to the dharma-element?‚Äù

original: ma yin nam ci zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma yin nam ci zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: with the words ‚ÄúNo, Blessed One,‚Äù

original: lan ni btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu de ni ma yin no zhes @121b bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lan ni btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu de ni ma yin no zhes @121b bya ba yin no //
translated: he replied, ‚ÄúNo, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rtogs pas rab tu phye ba'i ston pa'i rtogs pa de sel bar byed na grub pa'i mtha' dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rtogs pas rab tu phye ba'i ston pa'i rtogs pa de sel bar byed na grub pa'i mtha' dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Why is that? If the realization of the Teacher, which is distinguished by the realization of suchness, is eliminated, how could it not contradict the tenets?

original: 'og ma'i don khas mi len pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'og ma'i don khas mi len pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the lower meaning is not accepted,

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings nyid bcom ldan 'das yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings nyid bcom ldan 'das yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúBecause the dharma-element itself is the Blessed One.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is as follows.

original: dri ma med pa'i bdag nyid kyi mkhyen pa'i ngo bo ni byang chub bo /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i bdag nyid kyi mkhyen pa'i ngo bo ni byang chub bo /
translated: Awakening is the nature of knowledge that is the nature of the stainless self.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The Blessed One is also of that nature.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang de'i bdag nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang de'i bdag nyid kho na yin te /
translated: The dharma-dhƒÅtu is also of just that nature,

original: rnam par dben pa las dben pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes rtag tu bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rnam par dben pa las dben pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes rtag tu bka' stsal to //
translated: because there is no difference between the emptiness of the Blessed One and the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: dben pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo 'di la ni byang chub par bya ba dang / byang chub pa po dang / byang chub pa'i ngo bo yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dben pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo 'di la ni byang chub par bya ba dang / byang chub pa po dang / byang chub pa'i ngo bo yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could there be an enlightenment, an enlightener, and an essence of enlightenment in this non-empty nature?

original: yod na ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were, there would be the existence of grasped and grasper.

original: dben pa'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: dben pa'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is emptiness itself.

original: stong pa nyid med par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid med par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: If there were no emptiness, there would be no dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, if the Blessed One had fully awakened to the dharma-dhƒÅtu,

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur na /
translated: if the dharma-dhƒÅtu were fully awakened to,

original: 'o na ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de skye ba med pa'i dbyings yin par sngon rnam pa du mar bzhag pa de dang yang 'gal zhing mi mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de skye ba med pa'i dbyings yin par sngon rnam pa du mar bzhag pa de dang yang 'gal zhing mi mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, it is contradictory and inconsistent with what was previously stated many times that the nature of nondual wisdom is the basic element of nonarising.

original: dngos su na rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su na rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in fact, there is an object of cognition and a cognizer.

original: de'i bdag nyid ston pa'i phyir de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bstan na ;
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ston pa'i phyir de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bstan na ;
translated: In order to teach that nature, it is said, ‚ÄúHe is fully awakened.‚Äù

original: byang chub pa'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub pa'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the nature of awakening the Blessed Lady?

original: de ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid ces bya zhes mi shes pas dris pa dang / de'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu chos kyi dbyings de nyid byang chub bo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid ces bya zhes mi shes pas dris pa dang / de'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu chos kyi dbyings de nyid byang chub bo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since it is not known that ‚Äúthe nature of the basic element of phenomena is called awakening,‚Äù the question is asked, and therefore it is said, ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, that basic element of phenomena itself is awakening.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Why is that? The thought behind the question is this:

original: byang chub gang yin pa ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: byang chub gang yin pa ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Enlightenment is the nature of things because it is the nature free from all obscurations.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo yin na de ci'i phyir byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid du dam 'cha' ste /üîΩdngos po dang dngos po med pa @122a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo yin na de ci'i phyir byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid du dam 'cha' ste / dngos po dang dngos po med pa @122a * //
translated: Since the dharmadhƒÅtu has the characteristic of nonduality, all phenomena are the nature of nonexistence. Why then do you assert that it is the nature of enlightenment?üîΩBecause it is impossible for existence and nonexistence

original: gnyis ni gcig tu gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis ni gcig tu gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: to be the same.

original: de la 'dir lan ni chos kyi dbyings ni sems can med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la 'dir lan ni chos kyi dbyings ni sems can med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here the answer is that the dharmadhƒÅtu is not sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni sems can med pa zhes bya ba de ni byang chub kyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni sems can med pa zhes bya ba de ni byang chub kyi tshig yin no //
translated: In this way, the dharmadhƒÅtu is called ‚Äúnon-sentient beings,‚Äù which is a term for enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni byang chub kyi tshig bla dags te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni byang chub kyi tshig bla dags te /
translated: Similarly, the term ‚Äúall phenomena are essenceless‚Äù is a synonym for enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir byang chub kyi tshig yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir byang chub kyi tshig yin /
translated: Why is it a term for enlightenment?

original: ci brtags pa la bya'am /üîΩdon rang bzhin gyis dngos po med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni sems can med pa'o zhes brjod par rigs so //
analyzed: ci brtags pa la bya'am / don rang bzhin gyis dngos po med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni sems can med pa'o zhes brjod par rigs so //
translated: Or is it to be taken as the ultimate reality?

original: 'on kyang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub la brgal ba'i lan ci yang ma btab pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub la brgal ba'i lan ci yang ma btab pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is to be taken as a mere designation, then it is not reasonable to say that the realm of the Dharma is devoid of sentient beings, because the meaning of the realm of the Dharma is the ultimate reality, and ultimate reality is devoid of sentient beings, because the meaning of ultimate reality is the absence of intrinsically real entities.üîΩBut if it is to be taken as the ultimate reality, then it is not reasonable to say that the realm of the Dharma is devoid of sentient beings, because the ultimate reality is devoid of sentient beings, and the ultimate reality is not devoid of sentient beings, because the ultimate reality is the realm of the Dharma.üîΩTherefore, the Lord, who is the very embodiment of enlightenment, is said to be a synonym for the realm of the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir byang chub pa'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das bstan ma thag pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs su 'gro ba'o zhes gsungs te /üîΩde'i bdag nyid de ni byang chub de'i tshig bla dags yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub pa'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das bstan ma thag pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs su 'gro ba'o zhes gsungs te / de'i bdag nyid de ni byang chub de'i tshig bla dags yin gyi /
translated: The very embodiment of enlightenment is a synonym for the realm of the Dharma.

original: brtags pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtags pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not a mere designation.

original: 'di yang chos kyi dbyings nyid bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya ba 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang chos kyi dbyings nyid bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya ba 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: This also clarifies that the Lord is the very realm of the Dharma.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows.

original: rig par bya ba dang rig pa po med pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: rig par bya ba dang rig pa po med pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: The characteristic of the dharmadhƒÅtu is the absence of the object of cognition and the cognizer.

original: de nyid byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: That is called enlightenment,

original: rnam par dben pa dang dben pa can tha dad pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dben pa dang dben pa can tha dad pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught that the isolated and the isolator are not different.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni ngo bo med cing gtan med pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni ngo bo med cing gtan med pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no //
translated: The dharmadhƒÅtu is not non-existent, nor is it essentially non-existent.

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo kho na ste /
translated: However, it is the very essence of entities,

original: brtags pa'i rnam pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i rang gi ngo bo la chos kyi dbyings dang byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rnam pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i rang gi ngo bo la chos kyi dbyings dang byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: the essence free from all imagined aspects, which is called the dharmadhƒÅtu and enlightenment.

original: thams cad kyang chos nyid 'di las ma 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyang chos nyid 'di las ma 'das pa yin te /
translated: Everything is not beyond this reality,

original: de bas na mnyam pa nyid las dgongs te /
analyzed: de bas na mnyam pa nyid las dgongs te /
translated: therefore, with the intention of equality,

original: de skad du chos thams cad dngos po med pa de ni byang chub kyi tshig go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du chos thams cad dngos po med pa de ni byang chub kyi tshig go zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said: The non-existence of all things is the word for enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chos kyi dbyings sems can med pa dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa de ni byang chub kyi tshig yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chos kyi dbyings sems can med pa dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa de ni byang chub kyi tshig yin /
translated: Because the realm of phenomena is devoid of sentient beings and all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: ji tsam du dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis ni gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam du dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis ni gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: To the extent that existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive,

original: lan du chos thams cad ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan du chos thams cad ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the reply is that all phenomena are undifferentiated.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul du ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul du ste /
translated: In the domain of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi ngo bor dang / de @122b bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi ngo bor dang / de @122b bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: in the essence of the domain of the buddhas, up to in the essence of thusness.

original: 'di ltar gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par rnam par dbye ba'i tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de tha dad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par rnam par dbye ba'i tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de tha dad pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that which is devoid of the differentiation of apprehended object and apprehending subject, etc., is undifferentiated.

original: kha cig 'khrul nas tha dad pa med pa nyid ni gang la rang gi ngo bo dbye ba med pa de la de skad ces bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: kha cig 'khrul nas tha dad pa med pa nyid ni gang la rang gi ngo bo dbye ba med pa de la de skad ces bya'o zhe na /
translated: Some, confused, say that undifferentiatedness is that which is devoid of the differentiation of its own essence.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, he answered this as follows:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rig pa med pa'o zhes lan gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par rig pa med pa'o zhes lan gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, that which is called ‚Äònondifferentiation‚Äô is non-cognition.‚Äù

original: 'di la rnam par rig par 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la rnam par rig par 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no apprehension of cognition here, it is non-cognition.

original: kha cig 'khrul nas rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di la sems can yang med pas rnam par rig pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: kha cig 'khrul nas rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di la sems can yang med pas rnam par rig pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Some, confused, think that this non-cognition is non-cognition because there are no sentient beings here.

original: de'i phyir de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: Therefore, in order to clarify that, he said:

original: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par shes shing gzung bar mi nus pas na rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par shes shing gzung bar mi nus pas na rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya'i /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, that which is called ‚Äònon-cognition‚Äô is called ‚Äònon-cognition‚Äô because it cannot be cognized or apprehended,

original: rnam par shes pa tsam yang med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam yang med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because mere cognition does not exist.

original: gang gi ngo bo rnam par shes par mi nus /
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo rnam par shes par mi nus /
translated: The essence of what cannot be cognizedüîΩIs the essence of what?

original: ci rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i ngo bor ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i ngo bor ram zhe na /
translated: Is it the essence of subtle particles, etc.?

original: 'dus byas su rnam par rig par mi nus pa nas /
analyzed: 'dus byas su rnam par rig par mi nus pa nas /
translated: It is not possible to cognize it as compounded.üîΩ

original: 'dus ma byas kyi bar du yang rnam par rig par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi bar du yang rnam par rig par mi nus pa ste /
translated: It is not possible to cognize anything from the conditioned up to the unconditioned.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dus byas kyi dbye ba gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dus byas kyi dbye ba gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúup to‚Äù includes the conditioned distinctions of form, feeling, and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad du de dag la rnam par rig pa 'dzin pa gang yang med de chung ngu na rnam par shes pa tsam yang 'di la yod pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na de rnam par rig pa med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du de dag la rnam par rig pa 'dzin pa gang yang med de chung ngu na rnam par shes pa tsam yang 'di la yod pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na de rnam par rig pa med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: In no way whatsoever is there any apprehension of a cognizer in regard to those, and not even the slightest bit of consciousness exists in this regard. For this reason, it is said that it is ‚Äúwithout cognition.‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnam par rig par byed pa ni rigs te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnam par rig par byed pa ni rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that it is cognized as having the nature of subtle atoms and so on,

original: de dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those do not appear.

original: 'on te sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bor yin na ni gsal bar rab tu snang ba'i ngo bo la ji ltar na rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bor yin na ni gsal bar rab tu snang ba'i ngo bo la ji ltar na rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is the nature of mind and mental factors, then how is it that it is not cognized in the nature that clearly appears?

original: de'i phyir btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, all phenomena are not cognized by mind and mental factors.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad de sems dang sems las byung ba yang rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad de sems dang sems las byung ba yang rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: All phenomena are not cognized by mind and mental factors.

original: 'dzin pa med par mthun pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa @123a * //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med par mthun pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa @123a * //
translated: Because they are not grasped, and because they are free from the characteristic of being an object of apprehension.üîΩWhy is that?

original: 'byung ba gsal bar snang bzhin du ji ltar gsal bar nus zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba gsal bar snang bzhin du ji ltar gsal bar nus zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is: while the arising of feeling, etc., is clearly apparent, how can it be clearly apparent?

original: lan du 'di ltar tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni skye ba rang gi ngo bo 'thob pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lan du 'di ltar tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni skye ba rang gi ngo bo 'thob pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The answer is: in this way, all phenomena such as feeling, etc., do not arise, i.e., do not obtain their own nature.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rang rang gi ngo bo 'thob pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rang rang gi ngo bo 'thob pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Don‚Äôt feeling, etc., obtain their own nature?

original: de med du zin na 'jig rten snang ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de med du zin na 'jig rten snang ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that did not exist, then the appearance of the world would be nonexistent, and the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified would not exist.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa yang bden te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa yang bden te /
translated: Therefore, the statement is true.

original: de 'byung ba yang gang la gnas te rnam par rig par 'gyur ba'i 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i chos ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'byung ba yang gang la gnas te rnam par rig par 'gyur ba'i 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i chos ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the arising of that does not exist as a phenomenon that is apprehended and that would be cognized while abiding in that.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams lcags kyi thur ma bzhin du gzhan la reg par byed pa cung zad kyang med la /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams lcags kyi thur ma bzhin du gzhan la reg par byed pa cung zad kyang med la /
translated: Like an iron stylus, feeling and so on do not contact anything else.

original: rang la yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang la yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por ma yin gyi /
translated: And they do not exist as the entities of object and apprehender in relation to themselves.üîΩThey arise only in the nature that is granted by their own causes.

original: rang gi rgyu las gnang ba'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba kho nar zad do zhes ji skad du sngar gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las gnang ba'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba kho nar zad do zhes ji skad du sngar gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the summarized meaning.

original: chos sna tshogs yod pa ma yin na sems can 'di dag ni ma gsod pa la zhugs pa'i dbye ba 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chos sna tshogs yod pa ma yin na sems can 'di dag ni ma gsod pa la zhugs pa'i dbye ba 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the various dharmas do not exist, how can it be proper that these sentient beings are engaged in the activity of killing their mothers?

original: de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa ste /
translated: They are engaged in the inconceivable.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are engaged in buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni bsam pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni bsam pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: Buddhahood is inconceivable because it is not the domain of thought.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid med na rnam par gzhag pa 'di dag mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid med na rnam par gzhag pa 'di dag mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i don yin no //
translated: If there is no variety, these distinctions are not proper. This is the meaning of the objection.

original: lan du gang dag mtshams med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa'o zhes bya ba'i go rims bsnor nas kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs par ma mdzad kyi /
analyzed: lan du gang dag mtshams med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa'o zhes bya ba'i go rims bsnor nas kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs par ma mdzad kyi /
translated: In response, those who are engaged in the activity of killing their mothers are engaged in the inconceivable. The order is reversed. Those who are engaged in the inconceivable are not engaged in the inconceivable.

original: mtshams med pa la zhugs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: mtshams med pa la zhugs pa yang yin te /
translated: They are also engaged in the activity of killing their mothers.

original: 'di yang mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa kho nas bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yang mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa kho nas bstan to //
translated: This also is taught only with the intention of the sameness of all dharmas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa de dag ni yang dag pa la zhugs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa de dag ni yang dag pa la zhugs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThose who enter into the inconceivable enter into reality.‚Äù

original: yang gi sgras mtshams med pa la zhugs par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras mtshams med pa la zhugs par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be understood to refer to those who have committed the five heinous actions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba 'dir dgongs pa ni 'o na yang dag pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin 'dir ci de kho na yid la byed @123b pa phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes la brjod na de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba 'dir dgongs pa ni 'o na yang dag pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin 'dir ci de kho na yid la byed @123b pa phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes la brjod na de ni mi rung ste /
translated: Why is that? The intention here is: What is this ‚Äúreality‚Äù? If it refers to the nonerroneous wisdom that takes that as its object, that is not correct.

original: de thun mong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thun mong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not common to all.

original: mnyam pa nyid la brjod na ni mtshams med pa la zhugs pa ngan song la gzhol ba rnams ji ltar na bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid la gzhol ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la brjod na ni mtshams med pa la zhugs pa ngan song la gzhol ba rnams ji ltar na bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid la gzhol ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it refers to sameness, how can those who have committed the five heinous actions, who are destined for the lower realms, enter into the inconceivable and be destined for buddhahood?

original: de'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu yang dag pa zhes bya ba de ni dbyer med pa'i tshig yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu yang dag pa zhes bya ba de ni dbyer med pa'i tshig yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, what is called reality is a term for the undifferentiated.

original: 'di la dbyer med de thams cad du ngo bo mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la dbyer med de thams cad du ngo bo mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is undifferentiated because of the sameness of nature everywhere.

original: dbyer med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The dharmadhƒÅtu, which is undifferentiated, does not exist.

original: de'i tshig ni ngag yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshig ni ngag yin no //
translated: That term is speech.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid du na de dag la bye brag gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid du na de dag la bye brag gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that in emptiness, they have no distinctions at all.

original: ji ltar bye brag med pa de bstan pa'i phyir dang po rgol bar byed pa rtsom pa ni 'o na gal te thams cad de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa yin na mtshams med pa la zhugs pa de ji ltar ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag med pa de bstan pa'i phyir dang po rgol bar byed pa rtsom pa ni 'o na gal te thams cad de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa yin na mtshams med pa la zhugs pa de ji ltar ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are undifferentiated, first the opponent begins the argument: ‚ÄúWell, if everything is endowed with suchness, how is it that one who has committed an immediate [negative action] goes to a miserable realm?

original: byang chub tu smon pa byas pa dang / de las gzhan pa yod pa dag kyang ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub tu smon pa byas pa dang / de las gzhan pa yod pa dag kyang ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: And why do those who have made the aspiration to enlightenment and others who exist go to nirvƒÅ·πáa and to the higher realms?‚Äù

original: de ltar gyur na ni mtshams med pa la zhugs pa mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das par gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni mtshams med pa la zhugs pa mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das par gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then those who have committed the heinous actions would go to the higher realms and attain nirvana,

original: de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub la brtson pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub la brtson pa bzhin no //
translated: just like those who strive for enlightenment, because they would possess suchness.

original: yang na de dag kyang de bzhin du de ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na de dag kyang de bzhin du de ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or, those who strive for enlightenment would not go to the higher realms,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there would be no difference.

original: de'i phyir gang dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa de dag ni mtho ris su 'gro ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa de dag ni mtho ris su 'gro ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThose who possess the inconceivable do not go to the higher realms,‚Äù and so on.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'dir stong pa nyid la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'dir stong pa nyid la dgongs pa'o //
translated: Here, the inconceivable refers to emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid bsgom pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid bsgom pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: The idea is as follows: It would be pointless to engage in virtuous dharmas and to cultivate emptiness,

original: de dang ldan pa dang mi ldan par yang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa dang mi ldan par yang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there would be no difference between possessing those and not possessing them.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bar nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bar nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa nas /
translated: The inconceivable is not situated in going and coming, up to nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bar nye bar gnas pa ma yin te /üîΩmtho ris dang / ngan song du zhes dgongs pa'o //üîΩde gnyi ga yang srid pa thog ma med pa nas goms pa yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i tshig ni lan grangs du mar gtong ba dang len pa srid pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bar nye bar gnas pa ma yin te / mtho ris dang / ngan song du zhes dgongs pa'o // de gnyi ga yang srid pa thog ma med pa nas goms pa yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i tshig ni lan grangs du mar gtong ba dang len pa srid pa yin no //
translated: It is not situated in going and coming, up to heaven and the lower realms.üîΩThe words ‚Äúgoing and coming‚Äù refer to the attainment and rejection of the higher realms and lower realms, respectively.

original: mya ngan las 'das par @124a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par @124a * //
translated: Both of these are possible because of the repeated practice of going and coming since beginningless time.

original: 'gro ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can yin pas 'dir 'ong bar byed pa med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can yin pas 'dir 'ong bar byed pa med do //
translated: But going to nirvana is not possible here, because it is not subject to deterioration.

original: bar gyi sgras de thob par byed pa'i sa la sogs pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar gyi sgras de thob par byed pa'i sa la sogs pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù should be understood to include the stages, etc. that lead to nirvana.

original: 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang mi 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang mi 'thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGoing and coming‚Äù means attainment and non-attainment.

original: nye bar gnas pa ni 'jug pa 'am rab tu 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ni 'jug pa 'am rab tu 'byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSituated‚Äù means engaged or distinguished.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: stong pa nyid 'di bsgoms na gang zag stong pa bzhin du gzhan la phan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di bsgoms na gang zag stong pa bzhin du gzhan la phan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cultivates this emptiness, like an empty person, one becomes a cause of benefit to others.

original: de bas na de phyin ci ma log par goms pa las dge ba 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bas na de phyin ci ma log par goms pa las dge ba 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, virtue increases from correct cultivation of it.

original: bzlog na bsgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlog na bsgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one turns away from it, one is obscured.

original: de mngon du gyur ba dang mngon du ma gyur pa yang phan pa dang phan pa ma yin pa thob par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de mngon du gyur ba dang mngon du ma gyur pa yang phan pa dang phan pa ma yin pa thob par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Even when it is not manifest, it causes the attainment of benefit and non-benefit.

original: yod pa tsam gyis phan pa dang phan pa ma yin par byed pa ma yin pas sngar smras pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: yod pa tsam gyis phan pa dang phan pa ma yin par byed pa ma yin pas sngar smras pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Since it does not cause benefit and non-benefit by mere existence, the previously stated absurd consequence does not arise.

original: de'i 'og tu ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams kyi dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams kyi dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: After that, it was taught in order to remove the doubts of the Vinaya masters and the Sutra masters.

original: de la 'di ni 'dul ba'i don la brtson pa rnams kyi dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni 'dul ba'i don la brtson pa rnams kyi dogs pa yin te /
translated: Here is the doubt of those who are diligent in the meaning of the Vinaya:

original: sna tshogs pa nyid med pa yin na 'dul ba las ltung bar 'gyur ba la gnas pa'i dge slong rnam pa bzhi dang ltung ba med pa zhes ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid med pa yin na 'dul ba las ltung bar 'gyur ba la gnas pa'i dge slong rnam pa bzhi dang ltung ba med pa zhes ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: If there is no diversity, why did the Vinaya declare four types of monks who are in downfall and one who is not?

original: de la 'dir re zhig btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang dag ltung ba'i rtsa ba bzhi la gnas pa de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la 'dir re zhig btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang dag ltung ba'i rtsa ba bzhi la gnas pa de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here the Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra said, ‚ÄúThose who are in the four root downfalls, etc.‚Äù

original: ltung ba'i rtsa ba smos pas ni dge 'dun lhag ma yang mtshon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba'i rtsa ba smos pas ni dge 'dun lhag ma yang mtshon par byed pa yin no //
translated: The mention of root downfalls also indicates the remaining defeats.

original: bzhi la gnas pa smos pas ni mi gnas pa yang mtshon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi la gnas pa smos pas ni mi gnas pa yang mtshon par byed pa yin no //
translated: The mention of four indicates those who are not in them.

original: de dag kyang rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: They are in the rootless, which means they are in the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: 'di la rtsa ba thog ma yod pa ma yin pas rtsa ba med pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: 'di la rtsa ba thog ma yod pa ma yin pas rtsa ba med pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The rootless is the dharma-dhƒÅtu, because there is no beginning of a root here.

original: chos nyid ni dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid ni dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reality of phenomena is always present.

original: de la gnas pa ni de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: Abiding in that is becoming of the nature of that.

original: chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of all phenomena is suchness.

original: rtsa ba dang rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di'i tshig gi don sgro btags nas pha rol po dag rgol ba ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di'i tshig gi don sgro btags nas pha rol po dag rgol ba ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs objection, which is based on a misinterpretation of the words ‚Äúwithout root and without root-ground,‚Äù is ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: de lta na ni shin tu 'dul ba dang 'gal @124b bar ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩdgongs pa'i tshig gi don brjod pa ni btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu skye ba med pa la rtsa ba 'am /
analyzed: de lta na ni shin tu 'dul ba dang 'gal @124b bar ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dgongs pa'i tshig gi don brjod pa ni btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu skye ba med pa la rtsa ba 'am /
translated: The meaning is, ‚ÄúWhy does it not contradict the Vinaya?‚Äù

original: rtse mo zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtse mo zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the intentional statement is expressed in the words ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, because there is no root or summit in nonproduction.‚Äù

original: skye ba med pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The dharma-dhƒÅtu is nonproduction.

original: rtse mo med pa ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: rtse mo med pa ni tha ma'o //
translated: The summit is the end.

original: de ci'i phyir smos /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir smos /
translated: Why is that said?

original: ji tsam du rtsa ba med pa zhes bya ba de kho nas skabs kyi don gsal bar gyur pa kho na yin mod ce na /
analyzed: ji tsam du rtsa ba med pa zhes bya ba de kho nas skabs kyi don gsal bar gyur pa kho na yin mod ce na /
translated: If it is said that the meaning of the passage is clear just from the phrase ‚Äúwithout root,‚Äù

original: tha ma smos pas thog ma gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha ma smos pas thog ma gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the word ‚Äúlast‚Äù is mentioned in order to clarify the first.

original: de lta ma yin par rtsa ba 'ba' zhig smos na rtsa ba 'byung ba nyi tshe grags par 'gyur gyi skabs la phan pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par rtsa ba 'ba' zhig smos na rtsa ba 'byung ba nyi tshe grags par 'gyur gyi skabs la phan pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if only the word ‚Äúroot‚Äù were mentioned, only the arising of the root would be known, and it would not be helpful for the passage.

original: tha ma med ces bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha ma med ces bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout end‚Äù is mentioned in order to teach the dharma-dhƒÅtu by another synonym.

original: 'di ltar de ltar na thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings ni dus thams cad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ltar na thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings ni dus thams cad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the dharma-dhƒÅtu is all-pervading at all times.

original: de bas na rtsa ba med pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba de ni mi gnas pa'i dge slong gi tshig bla dags so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na rtsa ba med pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba de ni mi gnas pa'i dge slong gi tshig bla dags so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthe monk without root‚Äù is a synonym for the ‚Äúmonk without abode.‚Äù

original: / rtsa ba med pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba byung ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: / rtsa ba med pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba byung ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout root‚Äù means being free from the arising of the root.

original: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa la mi gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa la mi gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: Non-abiding is non-abiding in the self-habit, etc., up to the nature of emptiness.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang rgol ba ltung ba la rtsod pa dang 'thab pa byung ba la rtsod pa'i dge slong dang / de dag dang bral na sems dang bar byed cing 'jig rten na yon gnas su bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs med na de dag rnam par gzhag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang rgol ba ltung ba la rtsod pa dang 'thab pa byung ba la rtsod pa'i dge slong dang / de dag dang bral na sems dang bar byed cing 'jig rten na yon gnas su bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs med na de dag rnam par gzhag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When there is no dispute and no quarrel among the monks over the Vinaya, and when there is no various kinds of worldly gifts for the monks, how can they be established as having pure minds and being free from those?

original: de'i phyir rtsod pa byung ba zhes bya ba de ni lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsod pa byung ba zhes bya ba de ni lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said: ‚ÄúThe arising of dispute is a synonym for superimposition.‚Äù

original: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni gang la gzung ba la sogs pas lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni gang la gzung ba la sogs pas lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ste /
translated: Superimposition is that which is superimposed on the apprehended object, etc.

original: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kho na la bya'o //
analyzed: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kho na la bya'o //
translated: Superimposition should be understood as only the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: sna tshogs par so sor snang ba 'byung ba dang rtsod pa la sogs par gzhag pa yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: sna tshogs par so sor snang ba 'byung ba dang rtsod pa la sogs par gzhag pa yod du zin kyang /
translated: Although there is the arising of the appearance of diversity and the establishment of disputes, etc.,

original: 'on kyang thams cad kyang sems kyi chos nyid gnyis su med pa las mi ldog go zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad kyang sems kyi chos nyid gnyis su med pa las mi ldog go zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: nevertheless, all of them are not beyond the nondual reality of mind. This is the condensed meaning.

original: de la lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la spyod pa ni 'jig rten na sbyin gnas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la spyod pa ni 'jig rten na sbyin gnas su 'gyur te /
translated: In this regard, one who engages in the so-called ‚ÄúdharmadhƒÅtu of superimposition‚Äù becomes an object of generosity in the world.

original: de la spyod pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //üîΩspyod pa ni @125a * //
analyzed: de la spyod pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o // spyod pa ni @125a * //
translated: Engaging in that is knowing things as they are.

original: rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because engagement is realization.

original: de bas na bsod nams mi nyung ba bsags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir de nyid mchod gnas su 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bsod nams mi nyung ba bsags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir de nyid mchod gnas su 'os pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is worthy of worship because it is the basis for the accumulation of no small amount of merit.

original: yi ge kha cig las nyes par sgro 'dogs pa la spyod pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las nyes par sgro 'dogs pa la spyod pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In some texts, it says ‚Äúengaging in the superimposition of faults.‚Äù

original: de la nyes pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba la sogs pa la bya la /
analyzed: de la nyes pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba la sogs pa la bya la /
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúfaults‚Äù refers to downfalls, etc.

original: de chos kyi dbyings gang la sgro 'dogs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba 'bru mang por bya'o //
analyzed: de chos kyi dbyings gang la sgro 'dogs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba 'bru mang por bya'o //
translated: That is, the one who superimposes on the dharma-dhƒÅtu is called that.

original: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu lhag par sgro 'dogs pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba 'di'i sgra'i don bzung na lhag par sgro 'dogs pa la spyod pa'am /
analyzed: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu lhag par sgro 'dogs pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba 'di'i sgra'i don bzung na lhag par sgro 'dogs pa la spyod pa'am /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, if one takes the meaning of the term ‚Äúone who engages in superimposition‚Äù literally, one who engages in superimposition on the superior,

original: rtsod par sgro 'dogs pa la spyod pa ni yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: rtsod par sgro 'dogs pa la spyod pa ni yon gnas yin no //
translated: or one who engages in superimposition on dispute, is a worthy recipient of offerings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyud rnam par ma dag pa ji ltar yon gnas su'o zhes sems pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyud rnam par ma dag pa ji ltar yon gnas su'o zhes sems pa'o //
translated: Why is that? He thinks, ‚ÄúHow is one with an impure continuum a worthy recipient of offerings?‚Äù

original: rnam par phye ste mdor ston pa ni 'di ltar mnyam pa la de lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste mdor ston pa ni 'di ltar mnyam pa la de lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: The brief teaching with an analysis is as follows: ‚ÄúIt is because of superimposing on the equal.‚Äù

original: mnyam pa 'dra ba kun la khyab pa de la lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings la bya ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa 'dra ba kun la khyab pa de la lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings la bya ste /
translated: The equal, the similar, the all-pervading is the superimposition on the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: 'di la lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúsuperimposing on the superior‚Äù should be connected as before.

original: ma mo'i don la brtson pa dag sems pa sna tshogs pa med na dad pa dang dad pa med pa dang / lhag pa'i sems la spyod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di dag ji ltar rnam par dbye /
analyzed: ma mo'i don la brtson pa dag sems pa sna tshogs pa med na dad pa dang dad pa med pa dang / lhag pa'i sems la spyod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di dag ji ltar rnam par dbye /
translated: If there is no diversity of thought, how can faith and faithlessness, etc. up to the practice of higher thought be distinguished?

original: 'di ltar dad pa zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pa zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Faith is the clear comprehension of action, result, truth, and the Three Jewels.

original: rung ba 'di la yod pas rung ba can te /
analyzed: rung ba 'di la yod pas rung ba can te /
translated: One who is suitable is one who has faith.

original: 'dul ba las gsungs pa bzhin du rung ba la rjes su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba las gsungs pa bzhin du rung ba la rjes su gnas pa'o //
translated: One who is suitable is one who abides in the precepts as taught in the Vinaya.

original: tshul yang dag par ma bcom pa ni srid pa'i mtshan nyid 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / gzugs la dga' ba'i tshul rtsa ba nas bton pa'o //
analyzed: tshul yang dag par ma bcom pa ni srid pa'i mtshan nyid 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / gzugs la dga' ba'i tshul rtsa ba nas bton pa'o //
translated: One who is not a heretic is one who has uprooted the heretical way of life that delights in the characteristics of existence, i.e., in sa·πÉsƒÅra, and delights in form.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa las rgal ba ni gang gis 'jigs pa'i rgyu nyon mongs pa'i tshogs spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa las rgal ba ni gang gis 'jigs pa'i rgyu nyon mongs pa'i tshogs spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: One who has crossed over the fear of birth, etc. is one who has abandoned the causes of fear, i.e., the afflictions.

original: de ni 'jigs pa las rgal ba'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jigs pa las rgal ba'o //
translated: He has crossed over fear.

original: bzod pa skyes pa can ni gang zhig sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa skyes pa can ni gang zhig sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa'o //
translated: One who has patience is one who has produced the patience of the knowledge of the teaching with regard to suffering.

original: dul ba ni spyod pa bzang po can no //
analyzed: dul ba ni spyod pa bzang po can no //
translated: One who is disciplined is one who has good conduct.

original: lhag pa'i sems la spyod pa ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la spyod pa ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o //
translated: One who practices the higher mind is one who has attained uncontaminated concentration.

original: bzlog pa ni ma dad pa la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma dad pa la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Faith and so on are the opposites of lack of faith and so on.

original: rnam par dbye @125b ba de dag snang ba thams cad kyang chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa la yang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: rnam par dbye @125b ba de dag snang ba thams cad kyang chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa la yang 'gal ba med de /
translated: These classifications do not contradict the fact that all appearances are of one taste in the dharmadhatu,

original: rnam pa du ma snang zhing ston pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gnyis su med pa la yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar na rnam par byang ba nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas ma dad pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam pa du ma snang zhing ston pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gnyis su med pa la yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro // de ltar na rnam par byang ba nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas ma dad pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: because they appear in that way in the nondual mind and mental factors that appear and manifest in many aspects.üîΩThus faith and so on are presented in terms of being endowed with purification and so on.

original: log par lta ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas dad pa la sogs par gzhag go //
analyzed: log par lta ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas dad pa la sogs par gzhag go //
translated: Lack of faith and so on are presented in terms of being endowed with wrong views and so on.

original: tha snyad ni brjod par 'dod pas bkod pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu kho na las yin gyi /
analyzed: tha snyad ni brjod par 'dod pas bkod pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu kho na las yin gyi /
translated: Convention is only the cause of the form that one wishes to express.

original: dngos su yod pa la ltos pa ni ma yin pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su yod pa la ltos pa ni ma yin pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: It does not depend on what is actually present, so one should not cling to it.üîΩThe reason for those words is to show that it is merely the form that one wishes to express.

original: tshig de dag nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni brjod par 'dod pa'i rnam pa tsam yin par ston pa ni yon tan dang ldan pa tha snyad du ma dad pa la sogs pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig de dag nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni brjod par 'dod pa'i rnam pa tsam yin par ston pa ni yon tan dang ldan pa tha snyad du ma dad pa la sogs pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that one who is endowed with good qualities is not one who has faith in conventional expressions, etc.,

original: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu dge slong dad pa can ni dad pas byin pa spyod pa'i 'os ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu dge slong dad pa can ni dad pas byin pa spyod pa'i 'os ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, a faithful monk is not a fit vessel for the enjoyment of gifts out of faith.‚Äù

original: de la dad pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dad pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Here, faith is desire.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with ‚Äúattachment to self and what belongs to self, etc.‚Äù

original: de 'di la yod pas dad pa can no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas dad pa can no //
translated: Since it exists in this, it is faith.

original: ma dad pa ni bzlog pa ste //
analyzed: ma dad pa ni bzlog pa ste //
translated: Lack of faith is the opposite.

original: sred pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is freedom from craving.

original: de ni dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: de ni dgra bcom pa ste /
translated: That is an arhat.

original: rgyud yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their mental continuum is completely pure.

original: zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las 'di skad du de dag ni zas ro brgya dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las 'di skad du de dag ni zas ro brgya dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the Samadhiraja-sutra, it says that they have food with a hundred flavors, and so on.

original: rtog par byed pa ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rtog par byed pa ni rtog pa ste /
translated: Imagination is conceptualization.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is incorrect conceptualization.

original: de 'di la yod pas brtags pa can no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas brtags pa can no //
translated: They have that, so they are imaginative.

original: 'di yang 'os ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang 'os ma yin te /
translated: This is also not right,

original: rgyud yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their mental continuum is not completely pure.

original: bzlog pa ni brtags pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni brtags pa can ma yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is non-imaginative.

original: gang dus thams cad du tshul bzhin yid la byed par mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gang dus thams cad du tshul bzhin yid la byed par mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the delight in proper mental attention at all times.

original: sred pa 'am 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi tshul brtson par byas na rgyun ma zad par tshul yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya bar mi srid pas na /
analyzed: sred pa 'am 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi tshul brtson par byas na rgyun ma zad par tshul yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya bar mi srid pas na /
translated: If one strives in the way of craving or the stream of cyclic existence, it is impossible to destroy the stream without destroying the way.

original: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dris so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dris so //
translated: Therefore, he asked, Manjusri, what were you thinking when you said that?

original: rang gi bsam pa ston pa ni mnyam pa nyid yang dag par 'joms par mi byed de /
analyzed: rang gi bsam pa ston pa ni mnyam pa nyid yang dag par 'joms par mi byed de /
translated: The statement ‚Äúone does not destroy the equality of self and others‚Äù shows his own attitude.

original: mnyam pa nyid de nyid tshul yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de nyid tshul yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: That equality is itself the way.

original: mnyam pa nyid yang dag par 'joms par mi byed de zhes bya ba ni 'dis mi byed ces bya ba khong nas @126a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid yang dag par 'joms par mi byed de zhes bya ba ni 'dis mi byed ces bya ba khong nas @126a * //
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not destroy the equality‚Äù means that one does not make it non-existent.

original: dbyung ngo // mnyam pa nyid ni gang zag stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbyung ngo // mnyam pa nyid ni gang zag stong pa nyid do //
translated: Equality is the emptiness of the person.

original: de 'dis the tshom dang phyin ci log gi shes pa gnyis kyis yang dag par 'joms par mi byed do //
analyzed: de 'dis the tshom dang phyin ci log gi shes pa gnyis kyis yang dag par 'joms par mi byed do //
translated: One does not destroy it by the two kinds of knowledge, the knowledge of doubt and the knowledge of error.

original: de gnyis kyis yul du byed pa nyid ni 'joms par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis yul du byed pa nyid ni 'joms par byed pa yin no //
translated: The object of those two is what is destroyed.

original: gal te des mnyam pa nyid yang dag par 'joms par mi byed na de lta na mnyam pa nyid yang dag par 'joms par mi byed ces bya bas chog mod /
analyzed: gal te des mnyam pa nyid yang dag par 'joms par mi byed na de lta na mnyam pa nyid yang dag par 'joms par mi byed ces bya bas chog mod /
translated: If one does not destroy equality, then it is enough to say ‚Äúone does not destroy equality.‚Äù

original: tshul yang dag par ma bcom pa zhes ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: tshul yang dag par ma bcom pa zhes ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why does the verse also say ‚Äúone does not destroy the way‚Äù?

original: mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid mnyam pa nyid de nyid sngar bstan pa'i tshul yin te don tha dad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid mnyam pa nyid de nyid sngar bstan pa'i tshul yin te don tha dad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: The equality that is taught is the equality that has the nature of emptiness. That very equality is the method that was taught previously. There is not the slightest difference in meaning.

original: de bas na gang gis yang dag par ma bcom pa yang dag par ma rtogs pa de de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don du gnas so //üîΩ'jigs pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i dgra bcom pa ni 'jigs pa nyid dang ma bral bar mi srid do snyom nas /
analyzed: de bas na gang gis yang dag par ma bcom pa yang dag par ma rtogs pa de de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don du gnas so // 'jigs pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i dgra bcom pa ni 'jigs pa nyid dang ma bral bar mi srid do snyom nas /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement ‚Äúthat which is not destroyed and not realized is just like that‚Äù remains.

original: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dris so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dris so //
translated: Thinking that it is not possible for an arhat who is free from all fears to be not free from fear, he asked, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, what were you thinking when you said that?‚Äù

original: 'dir brjod par bzhed pa ni de'i 'jigs pa cung zad tsam yang med na ci zhig las rgal bar 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bzhed pa ni de'i 'jigs pa cung zad tsam yang med na ci zhig las rgal bar 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, what is intended to be said is that if there is not the slightest fear, then what is there to cross?

original: 'di snyam du 'jigs pa zhig yod na ni las rgal tam ma rgal zhes brtags grang na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'jigs pa zhig yod na ni las rgal tam ma rgal zhes brtags grang na /
translated: The thought here is that if there were fear, then one could investigate whether or not one has crossed over.

original: dgra bcom pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'jigs pa cung zad tsam yang yod na de gang las rgal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'jigs pa cung zad tsam yang yod na de gang las rgal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: If there were even the slightest fear at the stage of an arhat, then what would be called ‚Äúhaving crossed over‚Äù that?

original: sngon nyid nas 'jigs pa lnga las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon nyid nas 'jigs pa lnga las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has already transcended the five fears.

original: gang gis sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos cung zad tsam yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas ma skyed pa de ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can gyi 'phags pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos cung zad tsam yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas ma skyed pa de ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can gyi 'phags pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: One who does not generate even the slightest dharma, such as the so-called perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, by cultivating the four noble truths is called a ‚Äúnoble being who possesses perseverance for nonarising.‚Äù

original: ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar nas so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar nas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone who possesses perseverance for nonarising‚Äù is to be applied to this.

original: 'di ltar de ni rang bzhin kho na yin gyi de la ma gtogs par bzod par byed pa'i byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rang bzhin kho na yin gyi de la ma gtogs par bzod par byed pa'i byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: Because it is just their nature, they are not agents who generate perseverance with respect to that,

original: ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: for they are nonarising.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ma dul ba ni ngan par spyod pa yin na de las bzlog pa nyid du lus dang ngag zhi bar mi srid do snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ma dul ba ni ngan par spyod pa yin na de las bzlog pa nyid du lus dang ngag zhi bar mi srid do snyam pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that if the undisciplined one is one who engages in evil conduct, then it is impossible for the body and speech to be disciplined, since they are the opposite of that.

original: rang gi dgongs pa ni ma dul ba ni dul la /
analyzed: rang gi dgongs pa ni ma dul ba ni dul la /
translated: Our own opinion is that the undisciplined one is disciplined,

original: dul ba ni ma dul ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dul ba ni ma dul ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: and the disciplined one is undisciplined.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
translated: By whom? is the remainder.

original: ma dul ba ni smad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma dul ba ni smad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the undisciplined one is despised,

original: gang @126b gis 'dul bar byed cing skrod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang @126b gis 'dul bar byed cing skrod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: he is called undisciplined by whom he is disciplined and expelled.

original: dul ba ni ma dul zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos /
analyzed: dul ba ni ma dul zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos /
translated: Why is the disciplined one called undisciplined?

original: de ni shugs kyis go bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni shugs kyis go bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It is understood by implication.

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: 'on kyang 'dul ba dang bral ba ma yin na ni 'dul ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di la dgongs nas smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dul ba dang bral ba ma yin na ni 'dul ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di la dgongs nas smos te /
translated: but it is stated with the intention of this: if he is not free from discipline, he is disciplined.

original: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is stated in order to clarify.

original: / zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang bral ba rnams ji ltar lhag pa'i sems la spyod pa nyid yin zhes bsams nas 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes smras so //
analyzed: / zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang bral ba rnams ji ltar lhag pa'i sems la spyod pa nyid yin zhes bsams nas 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes smras so //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, what do you think?

original: lan du btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa 'di ltar de lhag par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lan du btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa 'di ltar de lhag par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra replied, It is because they surpass others.

original: lhag par byed pa ni sems nyid la lhag par bdag tu mngon par zhen nas tha snyad du byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: lhag par byed pa ni sems nyid la lhag par bdag tu mngon par zhen nas tha snyad du byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: They surpass others by clinging to the mind itself as superior and making conventional designations up to this point.

original: gzhan dag na re bya ba ma yin pa byed pa bzlog pa'i phyir 'phags pa ni lhag pa'i sems la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bya ba ma yin pa byed pa bzlog pa'i phyir 'phags pa ni lhag pa'i sems la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Others say: In order to stop the performance of what should not be done, it is taught that the noble ones do not practice the perfections of superior mind.

original: sems can dman pa gzhan dag 'di snyam du nyan thos dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la bkod pa ni blo mchog dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa'i sems 'di skyes nas /
