analyzed: sems can dman pa gzhan dag 'di snyam du nyan thos dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la bkod pa ni blo mchog dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa'i sems 'di skyes nas /
translated: When other inferior sentient beings think, Placing ≈õrƒÅvaka arhats and pratyekabuddhas on the grounds is the highest wisdom,

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di yang dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa yin pa snyam /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di yang dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa yin pa snyam /
translated: This noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ is also an arhat with exhausted defilements, isn't he?

original: de lta bu ma yin na shin tu zab pa'i de kho na nyid ston par su zhig nus pa yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin na shin tu zab pa'i de kho na nyid ston par su zhig nus pa yod ce na /
translated: If it is not so, who else is capable of teaching the extremely profound suchness?

original: de'i dogs pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: de'i dogs pa la ltos nas /
translated: Considering this doubt,

original: shes rab mchog dang ldan pas 'jam dpal khyod kyis dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ji lta ba de bzhin du smras pa legs so legs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab mchog dang ldan pas 'jam dpal khyod kyis dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ji lta ba de bzhin du smras pa legs so legs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, Excellent, excellent! O Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, endowed with supreme wisdom, you have spoken just as an arhat with exhausted defilements would.

original: zag pa zad pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The exhaustion of defilements is the reason for being an arhat.

original: ji ltar de dag 'chad pa de bzhin du khyod kyang de kho na nyid ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag 'chad pa de bzhin du khyod kyang de kho na nyid ston te /
translated: Just as they explain, you also teach suchness.

original: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa ni 'di lta bu byed par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa ni 'di lta bu byed par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for one who is not of that nature to act in this way.

original: de bas na khyod kyang dgra bcom pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na khyod kyang dgra bcom pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, you are also not an arhat.

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said:

original: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag dgra bcom pa ni ma yin gyi zag pa zad pa ni yin par khas blangs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag dgra bcom pa ni ma yin gyi zag pa zad pa ni yin par khas blangs so //
translated: I have not attained the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: of Arhatship, nor the state of a Pratyekabuddha, nor the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment.üîΩ Subhuti: What is the reason that you say this?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i tshig 'di ji ltar rung /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i tshig 'di ji ltar rung /
translated: Sariputra: Because of the emptiness of the essential original nature of all dharmas.üîΩ Subhuti: So it is, Sariputra, so it is.üîΩSariputra: What is the reason that you say this?üîΩ Subhuti: Because of the emptiness of own-marks.üîΩ Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?üîΩ Subhuti: Because of the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: thams cad la yang dgra bcom pa ma yin par zag pa zad pa nyid yin par mi rung na khyod gzhan du ji ltar gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la yang dgra bcom pa ma yin par zag pa zad pa nyid yin par mi rung na khyod gzhan du ji ltar gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?

original: btsun @127a * //
analyzed: btsun @127a * //
translated: Subhuti: Because of the emptiness of own-being.üîΩ Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?üîΩ Subhuti: Because of the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.üîΩ Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?üîΩ Subhuti: Because of the emptiness of the ultimate.

analyzed: pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi bsam pa ston to //
translated: Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?üîΩ Subhuti: Because of the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?üîΩ Subhuti: Because of the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.üîΩ Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?üîΩ Subhuti: Because of the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.üîΩ Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sa la 'dod pa dag zag pa'i gnas bzhin du spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: de yang nga'i zad do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang nga'i zad do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?üîΩ Subhuti: Because of the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.üîΩ Sariputra: What is the reason that you say this?

original: de ltar rnam grangs 'dis na kho bo zag pa zad mod kyi zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam grangs 'dis na kho bo zag pa zad mod kyi zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, by this enumeration, I have exhausted the contaminants.

original: nyan thos kyi sa mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that he does not abide in the stage of the ≈õrƒÅvaka.

original: gzhan dag yid gnyis za ba sna tshogs pa med na /
analyzed: gzhan dag yid gnyis za ba sna tshogs pa med na /
translated: If others do not have various doubts,

original: ci'i phyir srid pa tha ma pa kho na byang chub kyi snying por 'dug nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir srid pa tha ma pa kho na byang chub kyi snying por 'dug nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya la /

translated: and not others, such as ≈õrƒÅvakas?

translated: Therefore, in order to show that his doubt is groundless, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ asked, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, when a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva sits at the site of awakening,‚Äù and so on.

original: ci rnam pa 'di lta bu srid dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci rnam pa 'di lta bu srid dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means, ‚ÄúIs it possible in this way?‚Äù

analyzed: srid do zhes bya ba'i phyir 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba /
translated: In order to say ‚ÄúIt is possible,‚Äù Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi snying por mchis la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva has gone to the seat of awakening, etc.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs don med par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs don med par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Why is that? It is because the accumulations of merit and wisdom would be meaningless.

original: 'di'i lan du /
analyzed: 'di'i lan du /
translated: The answer to that is:

original: 'di ltar byang chub la chos 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa cung zad tsam yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub la chos 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa cung zad tsam yang ma mchis so //
translated: In that way, there is not even the slightest conceptualization of apprehending phenomena in awakening.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is non-apprehensible.

original: gtan tshigs de'i slad du spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bgyi'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i slad du spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bgyi'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that reason, the wisdom that is free from all conceptual elaborations is called unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di'i phyir yang 'di gnyis med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir gang gis byang chub par byed pa bdag nyid dang byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang 'di gnyis med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir gang gis byang chub par byed pa bdag nyid dang byang chub pa'o //
translated: For this reason also, because these two do not exist, by what is there awakening? It is the self that awakens.

original: byed pa po bdag nyid med do zhes sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po bdag nyid med do zhes sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the previously explained reasoning that the self does not exist as an agent,

original: byang chub de yang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub de yang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat enlightenment is also unborn,‚Äù and so on.

original: byed pa'i ngo bo'i byang chub de yang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i ngo bo'i byang chub de yang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: That enlightenment, the entity of the agent, is also unborn.

original: de la gang zhig byed pa por 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi snying po la mchis pa'i ngo bo 'ga' yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: de la gang zhig byed pa por 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi snying po la mchis pa'i ngo bo 'ga' yang ma mchis so //
translated: In that regard, there is no entity whatsoever that exists in the essence of enlightenment, which would become the agent.

original: su zhig byed pa po kho nar gyur te /üîΩbyang chub mngon par rdzogs @127b par 'tshang rgya ba'am /üîΩgzhan 'ga' zhig byed par gyur pa gang gis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /
analyzed: su zhig byed pa po kho nar gyur te / byang chub mngon par rdzogs @127b par 'tshang rgya ba'am / gzhan 'ga' zhig byed par gyur pa gang gis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /
translated: Who would be the agent?üîΩWho would fully awaken to enlightenment?üîΩOr who would be the agent by whom one would fully awaken to enlightenment?

original: las su gyur ba gang la byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba 'gal ba'am /
analyzed: las su gyur ba gang la byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba 'gal ba'am /
translated: Or what would be the object of action in which one would fully awaken to enlightenment?

original: byed pa por gyur pa gang gis mngon par byang chub nas byang chub kyi snying po las ldang ba gang yang ma mchis shing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byed pa por gyur pa gang gis mngon par byang chub nas byang chub kyi snying po las ldang ba gang yang ma mchis shing mi dmigs so //
translated: There is no one who has attained enlightenment, and no one who has arisen from the site of enlightenment.

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar byang chub kyi snying po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar byang chub kyi snying po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how can there be a site of enlightenment?

original: 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas de bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas de bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught in that way in dependence upon the conventional truth.

original: kha cig gi blo la gal te byang chub rnam pa de lta bu yin na /
analyzed: kha cig gi blo la gal te byang chub rnam pa de lta bu yin na /
translated: Some people think, ‚ÄúIf enlightenment is like that,

original: re zhig 'di la byang chub sems dpa' kho na zhes ci'i phyir bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'di la byang chub sems dpa' kho na zhes ci'i phyir bya ste /
translated: then why is it called the site of the bodhisattva?

original: med pa de la ni sems dpa' yin par 'ga' yang dmigs pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: med pa de la ni sems dpa' yin par 'ga' yang dmigs pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: For it is not the case that anything whatsoever is perceived in that nonexistence.‚Äù

original: 'di ni sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams la kun brtags te bstan pa yin no zhes dgongs nas /
analyzed: 'di ni sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams la kun brtags te bstan pa yin no zhes dgongs nas /
translated: Thinking that this is a teaching that is imagined in relation to illusion-like phenomena,

original: 'jam dpal byang chub ces bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dags zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal byang chub ces bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dags zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: the Lord said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, what is the referent of the word ‚Äòenlightenment‚Äô?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir stsal bar bya zhing bkas smos pa'i dgongs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du bcom ldan 'das byang chub ces bgyi ba de ni mtshams ma mchis pa lnga po dag gi tshig bla dags lags so zhes 'di nyid mnyam pa la dgongs te gsol to
analyzed: de'i phyir stsal bar bya zhing bkas smos pa'i dgongs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du bcom ldan 'das byang chub ces bgyi ba de ni mtshams ma mchis pa lnga po dag gi tshig bla dags lags so zhes 'di nyid mnyam pa la dgongs te gsol to
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn has taught and the BhagavƒÅn has said that the meaning of the five heinous actions is the same as the meaning of the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs enlightenment.

original: // dgongs pa ma rtogs na kha cig skrag par 'gyur bas de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: // dgongs pa ma rtogs na kha cig skrag par 'gyur bas de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: If the meaning is not understood, some will be frightened, so he asks, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: ji ltar sdig pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs dag yon tan gyi tshogs kyi rang gi ngo bor khas blang du rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar sdig pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs dag yon tan gyi tshogs kyi rang gi ngo bor khas blang du rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is, ‚ÄúHow can it be acceptable to assert that the nature of the collection of bad actions is the nature of the collection of good qualities?‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar dngos po ma mchis pas mtshams ma mchis pa lnga po de dag nyid byang chub kyi rang bzhin te zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar dngos po ma mchis pas mtshams ma mchis pa lnga po de dag nyid byang chub kyi rang bzhin te zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of the meaning is, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, in that way, the five heinous actions themselves are the nature of enlightenment because of the nonexistence of things.‚Äù

original: byang chub nyid kyi rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyi rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: The nature of enlightenment is whatever is the nature of enlightenment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dngos po ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po ma mchis pa ste /
translated: Because they are non-existent.

original: chos thams cad byed pa dang / byed pa po la sogs par brtags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa dang / byed pa po la sogs par brtags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: All phenomena are free from the imputation of an agent, an instrument, and so forth.

original: de dag byang chub kyi rang bzhin nyid lags pa'i gtan tshigs de'i slad du byang chub de ni mtshams ma mchis pa lnga'i rang bzhin can lags te /
analyzed: de dag byang chub kyi rang bzhin nyid lags pa'i gtan tshigs de'i slad du byang chub de ni mtshams ma mchis pa lnga'i rang bzhin can lags te /
translated: Because of that reason, that awakening has the nature of the five inexpiable acts,

original: mtshams med pa dang 'dra bar 'di yang lags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa dang 'dra bar 'di yang lags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is like the inexpiable acts.

original: mtshams med pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji skad bstan pa @128a * //
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji skad bstan pa @128a * //
translated: If the inexpiable acts are taught to be the nature of non-existence,

original: ni rigs grang na /
analyzed: ni rigs grang na /
translated: then it is reasonable that

original: byang chub go ji ltar yin /
analyzed: byang chub go ji ltar yin /
translated: awakening is like that.

original: de yang mtshams med pa rnams dang / chos gzhan rnams mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: de yang mtshams med pa rnams dang / chos gzhan rnams mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: Moreover, the inexpiable acts and other phenomena are called ‚Äúrealizations,‚Äù which is the nature of an action.

original: byed pas ni byed pa po 'phen par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: byed pas ni byed pa po 'phen par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And by action, the agent is projected.

original: de'i phyir mtshams ma mchis pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshams ma mchis pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe heinous acts are fully realized.‚Äù

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni ma la sogs pa gsal bar mngon sum du rig pa rnams ji ltar bsad par nus /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni ma la sogs pa gsal bar mngon sum du rig pa rnams ji ltar bsad par nus /
translated: Why is that? Those who clearly perceive their mother and so on cannot kill them.

original: de lta bur gyur pa rnams kyang med pa yin na ni sems kyang yod pa nyid kyi tshad ma ci zhig yod ces pas bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa rnams kyang med pa yin na ni sems kyang yod pa nyid kyi tshad ma ci zhig yod ces pas bsams pa'o //
translated: If they are nonexistent in that way, what valid cognition is there of the existence of the mind?

original: lan du skyed par byed pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni shin tu gcig kho nar mngon sum ma lags so //
analyzed: lan du skyed par byed pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni shin tu gcig kho nar mngon sum ma lags so //
translated: In response, it is said: All phenomena, such as the creator and so on, are not directly perceived as being one.

original: de bas na chos de dag ni sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo'i bar du gang gis kyang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas mngon par rdzogs par ma rtogs par mig gi rnam par shes pas ma mthong /
analyzed: de bas na chos de dag ni sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo'i bar du gang gis kyang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas mngon par rdzogs par ma rtogs par mig gi rnam par shes pas ma mthong /
translated: Therefore, those phenomena are not fully realized by the wisdom arisen from meditation by anyone, from a buddha to an ordinary being. They are not seen by the eye consciousness.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas ma thos /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas ma thos /
translated: They are not heard by the ear consciousness.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas ma 'tshal /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas ma 'tshal /
translated: They are not known by the wisdom arisen from reflection.

original: de las gzhan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ma rtogs /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ma rtogs /
translated: The other mental consciousnesses do not perceive it.

original: bar gyi tshig gis thos pa dang / myong ba dang / reg pa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig gis thos pa dang / myong ba dang / reg pa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The middle word ‚Äúhear‚Äù is to be supplied to the other two words ‚Äúexperience‚Äù and ‚Äútouch.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩma la sogs pa mngon sum gyis rig pa rnams rdul phra mo'i ngo bo yin nam /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te / ma la sogs pa mngon sum gyis rig pa rnams rdul phra mo'i ngo bo yin nam /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.üîΩThose who perceive their mother, etc., directly, do they perceive them as having the nature of subtle atoms?

original: cha shas can gyi ngo bo zhig grang /
analyzed: cha shas can gyi ngo bo zhig grang /
translated: Or do they perceive them as having the nature of a composite?

original: de gnyi ga yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Neither of these two is reasonable.

original: 'di ltar yul thag ring po na bar med par gnas pa rnams rdul phran yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul thag ring po na bar med par gnas pa rnams rdul phran yin par mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, it is unreasonable to maintain that those that are situated without interstice in a distant place are subtle atoms,

original: dus thams cad du cha shas dang bcas par 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du cha shas dang bcas par 'dug pa yin no //
translated: because they are situated with parts at all times.

original: de ltar na rdul phra mo gcig pu ni ji ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rdul phra mo gcig pu ni ji ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, a single subtle atom is not tenable in any way.

original: gcig ma grub na du ma'i ngo bo yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig ma grub na du ma'i ngo bo yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If a single one is not established, then a nature of many is also unreasonable.

original: de bas na rdul phra rab phyi rol na gnas pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rdul phra rab phyi rol na gnas pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, there are no external subtle atoms at all.

original: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i mi'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i mi'i rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of a man, which is devoid of the nature of one or many.

original: rdul phra rab ma grub pa'i phyir cha shas can yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ma grub pa'i phyir cha shas can yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And because the atom is not established, the possessor of parts does not exist.

original: de ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyis de brtsams pa yin par yongs su brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyis de brtsams pa yin par yongs su brtags pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is imagined that it is composed of atoms.

original: rgya cher dpyad pa'i gtam 'phros pa 'di re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: rgya cher dpyad pa'i gtam 'phros pa 'di re zhig gzhag go //
translated: This digression on the extensive analysis should be set aside for the moment.

original: de lta bu ni @128b byang chub bo zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa ste rnam pa de lta bu'i byang chub ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu ni @128b byang chub bo zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa ste rnam pa de lta bu'i byang chub ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Such is enlightenment is the conclusion. It means that enlightenment of that kind is the nature of the nonapprehension of all phenomena.

original: 'o na ji ltar gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing mngon sum gyi bar du byas pa yin par bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing mngon sum gyi bar du byas pa yin par bstan ce na /
translated: But how is it that the apprehension of form, sound, and so on, was taught by the Lord himself, who fully awakened to them and made them manifest?

original: de lta lags kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas mngon sum du bgyis pa'i bar du de dag gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta lags kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas mngon sum du bgyis pa'i bar du de dag gzhag go //
translated: Nevertheless, Blessed One, I will set forth, I will establish, I will make manifest, from the time of the full enlightenment of the Buddhas up to the time of the establishment of the Dharma, those who are full of pride.

original: nye bar gzhag go //
analyzed: nye bar gzhag go //
translated: I will establish them, I will make them manifest.

original: bar gyi sgras mthong ba dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar gyi sgras mthong ba dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes seeing, hearing, and so on.

original: khyod kyang mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: khyod kyang mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are you also full of pride?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes de ltar tha snyad du byed ces dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes de ltar tha snyad du byed ces dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the doubt that he might be, he says,

original: 'jam dpal ci khyod nga la 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o snyam sems sam zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ci khyod nga la 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o snyam sems sam zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, do you think thus of me: ‚ÄòThe TathƒÅgata is my TathƒÅgata‚Äô?

original: sems la zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sems la zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚Äù The word ‚Äúmind‚Äù is a verbal suffix.

original: tshig gnyis kyis mngon par zhen pa ston te /
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyis mngon par zhen pa ston te /
translated: The two phrases show the attachment.

original: 'di ltar tha snyad tsam lan du mar brjod pa las mngon no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tha snyad tsam lan du mar brjod pa las mngon no //
translated: It is evident from the repeated use of the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù that this is mere conventional usage.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa de la rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa de la rtsod pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One replied, ‚ÄúNo, Subh≈´ti, it is not so.‚Äù This is the objection to that attachment.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras nyid du shin tu grags pa khyod ji ltar yab la mngon par zhen par mi byed ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras nyid du shin tu grags pa khyod ji ltar yab la mngon par zhen par mi byed ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is it so?‚Äù This means, ‚ÄúYou are well known as the son of the TathƒÅgata. Why do you not avoid attachment to your father?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o snyam du mi sems pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o snyam du mi sems pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The Blessed One replied, ‚ÄúIt is because the TathƒÅgata does not think, ‚ÄòThis is my TathƒÅgata.‚Äô‚Äù

original: brgal ba gang yin pa de nyid lan du byas pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: brgal ba gang yin pa de nyid lan du byas pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the reply just the same as the objection?

original: ma yin te bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is a distinction.

original: gang gis bdag de snyam du mi sems pa ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa sngon du song ba'i nyes pa rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bdag de snyam du mi sems pa ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa sngon du song ba'i nyes pa rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The reason why one does not think that is the uninterrupted occurrence of the fault of the prior apprehension of one‚Äôs own nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tha snyad yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata is my TathƒÅgata‚Äù is a convention.

original: de bas na 'di'i rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: Therefore, following this,

original: bdag gi mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that the engagement of one's own adherence is not.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa mchog gi gnas yab la @129a * //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa mchog gi gnas yab la @129a * //
translated: The question is to the father, the abode of the highest perfection of qualities.

original: re zhig ji ltar mi dmigs zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar mi dmigs zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is, How is it not apprehended?

original: lan ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lan ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The answer is, Blessed One, thusness is the Tathagata himself.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ni means because.

original: de bzhin nyid de bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ni ston pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ni ston pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is, The teacher is thusness abiding thus.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i ngo bor ro //
translated: Thus means in the nature of the absence of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: kha cig la gtan tshigs 'dri ba ni mi smos par de'i de nyid kyang de bzhin nyid de zhes de skad du 'byung ba de'i don yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig la gtan tshigs 'dri ba ni mi smos par de'i de nyid kyang de bzhin nyid de zhes de skad du 'byung ba de'i don yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Some ask for the reason, but it is not mentioned. The statement that thusness is also thus has this meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyang de nyid kyi dngos po de nyid de bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyang de nyid kyi dngos po de nyid de bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: The Bhagavat himself is that suchness of that thing itself.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba nyid de bzhin nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba nyid de bzhin nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is free from the aspect of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de'i de nyid kyi dngos po nyid de bzhin nyid yin no zhes brjod par bya ba las dngos po de nyid de bzhin nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa ni chos can gyi ngo bo de las don gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i de nyid kyi dngos po nyid de bzhin nyid yin no zhes brjod par bya ba las dngos po de nyid de bzhin nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa ni chos can gyi ngo bo de las don gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be said that the suchness of that thing itself is that suchness, but it is said that the suchness of that thing is that suchness in order to stop the idea that it is something different from the entity of the phenomenon.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba nyid ston pa yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba nyid ston pa yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make it understood that it is taught to be free from the aspect of apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rig par mi bgyid cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rig par mi bgyid cing /
translated: the suchness of the TathƒÅgata does not cognize the TathƒÅgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang de bzhin nyid rnam par rig par mi bgyid do zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang de bzhin nyid rnam par rig par mi bgyid do zhes gsungs te ;
translated: and the TathƒÅgata does not cognize suchness.

original: 'di ni gang gis gzung bar bya ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni gang gis gzung bar bya ba yang ma yin la /
translated: This is not something that is apprehended,üîΩand

original: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid de ni bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam par rig par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid de ni bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam par rig par mi bgyid do //
translated: That reality does not make representations in order to be taught.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs pa rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar ji ltar khas blangs zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs pa rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar ji ltar khas blangs zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Why is that? means that one should understand how the acceptance of the vision of the Buddha eye, such as the enlightenment, the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and so on, is free from the grasped and the grasper.

original: lan ni / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar don dam par na de bzhin nyid ni dngos po ma mchis shing /
analyzed: lan ni / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar don dam par na de bzhin nyid ni dngos po ma mchis shing /
translated: The answer is: Blessed One, it is like this: ultimately, reality is not a thing,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: and the Tathagata is also not a thing.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba yin par 'jig rten pa'i bdag nyid 'dod la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba yin par 'jig rten pa'i bdag nyid 'dod la /
translated: What is called reality is asserted by the worldly to be the grasped and the grasper.

original: de la ngo bo de'i dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ngo bo de'i dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: There, the entity of that nature is not a thing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de ltar kun brtags pa'i dngos po med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de ltar kun brtags pa'i dngos po med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The Tathagata is also just like that, not a thing that is imagined.

original: de yang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not transcend the reality of thusness.

original: de ltar na gzung ba dang @129b 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa bkag pa bstan pas 'di bsgrubs zin te yang bstan mi dgos kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na gzung ba dang @129b 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa bkag pa bstan pas 'di bsgrubs zin te yang bstan mi dgos kyi /
translated: Thus, this is already established by the teaching of the refutation of the apprehended and apprehender and the refutation of subtle particles, etc., and it is not necessary to teach it again.

original: tshig gi mtshams sbyar ba dang / dogs pa'i gnas spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi mtshams sbyar ba dang / dogs pa'i gnas spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: However, in order to connect the words and to eliminate doubts,

original: don dam par zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rnam par rtog pa ma spangs shing mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni kun rdzob yin par zhal gyis bzhes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rnam par rtog pa ma spangs shing mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni kun rdzob yin par zhal gyis bzhes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the word ultimately is used because it is accepted that the relative is the entity of the apprehended and apprehender due to the power of non abandonment and non relinquishment of conceptuality.

original: yang de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i ched du 'og nas kyang gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bgyi ba'i tshig gis bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i ched du 'og nas kyang gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bgyi ba'i tshig gis bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In order to clarify that very point, the reason will be taught below, and it is taught by the words of the TathƒÅgata.

original: don gyi ngo bo de ni ming tsam du bas te ming tsam snying po yin gyi /
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo de ni ming tsam du bas te ming tsam snying po yin gyi /
translated: The essence of that object is merely a name. Mere name is the essence.

original: don gyis stong zhes bya ba'i bar du yin te /
analyzed: don gyis stong zhes bya ba'i bar du yin te /
translated: up to ‚Äúempty of meaning‚Äù

original: don dam par chos thams cad brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir ro // yang na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Because ultimately all phenomena are inexpressible and unarisen.

original: ming brjod pa tsam du zad kyi brjod par bya bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ming brjod pa tsam du zad kyi brjod par bya bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, the term ‚ÄútathƒÅgata‚Äù is just an expression of a name; it is not suitable to be expressed.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ming gis ming ni stong pa ste //
analyzed: ming gis ming ni stong pa ste //
translated: Name is empty of name.

original: ming la ming ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: ming la ming ni yod ma yin //
translated: Name does not exist in name.

original: chos rnams thams cad ming med pa //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ming med pa //
translated: All phenomena are without name.

original: ming ni kun du brtags pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ming ni kun du brtags pa yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Name is a conceptual imputation.

original: gal te de lta na don dam par yod cing brjod pa'i gnas su gyur pa gang la de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes brjod pa dang / mngon par zhen par byed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na don dam par yod cing brjod pa'i gnas su gyur pa gang la de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes brjod pa dang / mngon par zhen par byed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is the tathƒÅgata that is the object of the ultimate, the basis of expression, in regard to which one says ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata is my TathƒÅgata‚Äù and in regard to which one forms a conception?

original: gang yang med do zhes spong bar byed pa ni gang la bdag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: gang yang med do zhes spong bar byed pa ni gang la bdag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di yin no //
translated: The denial that it is anything at all is the statement, In that case, I think that the Tathagata is not the Tathagata of me, etc.

original: the tshom gyis blo dkrugs pa dag gis ra chod du yongs su dris su zin kyang kha cig tshig 'di snyam du dogs pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: the tshom gyis blo dkrugs pa dag gis ra chod du yongs su dris su zin kyang kha cig tshig 'di snyam du dogs pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Even though they have been questioned thoroughly by those whose minds are disturbed by doubt, some people still have doubts.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la the tshom za 'am zhes dris so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la the tshom za 'am zhes dris so //
translated: In order to eliminate those doubts, the Lord asks, Manjusri, do you doubt the Tathagata?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni dris ma thag pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar gal te rgyun la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba 'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni dris ma thag pa gang yin pa'o // 'di ltar gal te rgyun la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba 'am /
translated: The answer is, No, Lord, referring to the question just asked.üîΩ If the Tathagata were to arise through the characteristics of a continuum, etc.,

original: rgyun gzhan du gyur pa'i ngo bor yongs su grub pa'am /
analyzed: rgyun gzhan du gyur pa'i ngo bor yongs su grub pa'am /
translated: or if the transformation of the continuum were to be established as a real entity,

original: rgyun rgyun chad pa'i bdag nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang @130a * //
analyzed: rgyun rgyun chad pa'i bdag nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang @130a * //
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs parinirvƒÅ·πáa is also suitable as a state that is interrupted in its continuum.üîΩIf there were some TathƒÅgata who was established as a real thing, then I would have doubts about that object, the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: rung ste / de bzhin gshegs par yongs su grub pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni de bzhin gshegs pa yul de la bdag the tshom 'tshal lo zhes gsungs te tshig de gsum gyis 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rung ste / de bzhin gshegs par yongs su grub pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni de bzhin gshegs pa yul de la bdag the tshom 'tshal lo zhes gsungs te tshig de gsum gyis 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: These three statements teach the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: skye ba dang rga ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa gang yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs par tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i don gyis dngos po 'di ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa gang yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs par tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i don gyis dngos po 'di ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The thing that is designated as the TathƒÅgata, who arises, ages, and passes into nirvƒÅ·πáa, does not exist in any way.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni byed pa'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa yin te /üîΩdngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni byed pa'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa yin te / dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gshegs pa'am /
translated: Because the so-called TathƒÅgata is taught as a reason for an action.üîΩIf it is taken to mean ‚Äúhe goes to things as they are,‚Äù

original: rtogs pa la bya na /
analyzed: rtogs pa la bya na /
translated: or ‚Äúhe realizes things,‚Äù

original: byed pa rnam pa de gnyis ka yang rgyas par bsal zin to /
analyzed: byed pa rnam pa de gnyis ka yang rgyas par bsal zin to /
translated: then both of those two types of actions have already been extensively refuted.

original: // /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa /üîΩbam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: // /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: Noble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.

original: kha cig gi blo la 'di snyam du gal te 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyi dbye ba yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: kha cig gi blo la 'di snyam du gal te 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyi dbye ba yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Noble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.üîΩNoble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.

original: sh'akya'i rigs sam gzhan du de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das par ma bstan te bzhugs pa dang / gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de ji lta bu de bas ni 'dir 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ngo snyam du mi sems sam zhes dris so //üîΩ'byung ba smos pas gnas pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs sam gzhan du de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das par ma bstan te bzhugs pa dang / gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de ji lta bu de bas ni 'dir 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ngo snyam du mi sems sam zhes dris so // 'byung ba smos pas gnas pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Noble One, you should not think that the TathƒÅgata arises or ceases to be, or that the TathƒÅgata abides or does not abide.

original: dang po dang rgyun gyis 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po dang rgyun gyis 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Noble One

original: lan bcom ldan 'das gal te chos kyi dbyings la 'byung ba mchis na ni bdag de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ngo snyam du sems par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lan bcom ldan 'das gal te chos kyi dbyings la 'byung ba mchis na ni bdag de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ngo snyam du sems par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Answer: Blessed One, if the dharma-dhƒÅtu were to arise, I would think that the TathƒÅgata arises.

original: sems zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúmind‚Äù is left out.

original: chos kyi dbyings la ni sngon med pa'i skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ni sngon med pa'i skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no arising of the dharma-dhƒÅtu that did not exist before.

original: de bas na gnyis la dben pa'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la yang sngon med pa'i skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis la dben pa'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la yang sngon med pa'i skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgata, who is of the nature of being isolated from the duality, also has no arising that did not exist before.

original: de bas na bdag de snyam du mi sems so zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag de snyam du mi sems so zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I do not think that way.

original: 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi smos sam zhes bya bas ni dri ba rnam pa gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi smos sam zhes bya bas ni dri ba rnam pa gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, do you not say that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are completely nirvanized as many as the sands of the Ganges river? This shows the second question.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis de'i lan gdab par bzhed @130b nas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du yul gcig pa ma lags sam zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis de'i lan gdab par bzhed @130b nas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du yul gcig pa ma lags sam zhes gsol to //
translated: The Lord himself, wishing to answer that, said, ‚ÄúBhagavan, are the objects of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, not the same in being an inconceivable object?‚Äù

original: yul gcig pa zhes bya ba ni rten gcig pa ste /
analyzed: yul gcig pa zhes bya ba ni rten gcig pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe same object‚Äù means the same basis.

original: dper na nya rnams kyi yul chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nya rnams kyi yul chu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, water is the object of fish.

original: yul gcig pa'i dbang du byas te yul gcig pa dris pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul gcig pa'i dbang du byas te yul gcig pa dris pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the question about the same object from the perspective of the same object?

original: 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du zhes gsungs so //üîΩ'di ltar zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du zhes gsungs so // 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad yin te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúin being an inconceivable object.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù is a verbal prefix.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: gang dag gi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gang dag gi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: It is said of those whose object is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa la dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa la dgongs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúInconceivable‚Äù refers to the extremely pure realm of phenomena.

original: thams cad du bsam par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du bsam par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to conceive of it in any way.

original: des na 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Therefore, this is what is being taught:

original: ci rnam par byang ba skyes shing thugs rje'i snying po dang shin tu ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi dbyings la de'i bdag nyid du rten tam /
analyzed: ci rnam par byang ba skyes shing thugs rje'i snying po dang shin tu ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi dbyings la de'i bdag nyid du rten tam /
translated: Do the Bhagavans, who have generated complete enlightenment and are endowed with the essence of compassion, rely on the dharmadhƒÅtu as their very nature?

original: ci rten pa ma lags sam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci rten pa ma lags sam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or, are they not a support?

original: 'jam dpal de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, it is just so, and so on.

original: gal te de de ltar nges pa yin na re zhig gzhag ste /
analyzed: gal te de de ltar nges pa yin na re zhig gzhag ste /
translated: If that is so, then it is certain that they are not a support.

original: 'di yang dris pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de ltar bzhugs sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang dris pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de ltar bzhugs sam zhe na /
translated: But then, the question is asked, does the BhagavƒÅn ≈öƒÅkyamuni remain in that way?

original: 'jam dpal de de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, it is just so, he replied.

original: gal te de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid grub pa yin no zhes dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa bzhugs pa de'i slad du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: gal te de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid grub pa yin no zhes dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa bzhugs pa de'i slad du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das
translated: Thinking that, he says, ‚ÄúBhagavat Shakyamuni, for the sake of those who are in the world, and those who are in the state of nirvana, the Bhagavat Buddhas, as many as there are sand particles in the Ganges River,

original: 'od srungs la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yun ring por bzhed pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa lags so //
analyzed: 'od srungs la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yun ring por bzhed pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa lags so //
translated: and those who have long since passed into nirvana, such as Kashyapa and so forth, are in nirvana.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'brel pa ci yod na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'brel pa ci yod na /
translated: Here, what is the connection?

original: gang gcig bzhugs na thams cad kyang bzhugs pa yin /
analyzed: gang gcig bzhugs na thams cad kyang bzhugs pa yin /
translated: If one remains, all remain.

original: 'di ltar gcig gi bdag nyid du thams cad rjes su 'dug pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig gi bdag nyid du thams cad rjes su 'dug pa ni ma yin la /
translated: In this way, all are not included in a single nature.

original: tshogs tha dad pa kho nas byang chub so sor thob bo zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs tha dad pa kho nas byang chub so sor thob bo zhe na /
translated: If enlightenment is attained individually by each assembly alone,

original: lan ni bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan ni bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: the answer is, ‚ÄúBhagavat, the Bhagavat Buddhas are like this‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩji ltar bcom ldan 'das sh'akya'i tog dag pa chen @131a * //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste / ji ltar bcom ldan 'das sh'akya'i tog dag pa chen @131a * //
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: po'i mthu dang / thugs rje'i snying po'i dbyings dang da ltar ldan zhing rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: po'i mthu dang / thugs rje'i snying po'i dbyings dang da ltar ldan zhing rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the Blessed One, the ≈öƒÅkya Lion, possesses the realm of the essence of great purity and compassion, and is not completely in nirvƒÅ·πáa, which has the characteristic of cessation,

original: de bzhin du de dag kyang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag kyang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, since they have that very nature, it is not reasonable that they are in nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' shin tu rnam par dag pa'i nus pa dang / thugs rje zhan pa'i gnas skabs na yang re zhig sems can yongs su smin pa'i dus la gzigs shing dus dpag tu med par bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' shin tu rnam par dag pa'i nus pa dang / thugs rje zhan pa'i gnas skabs na yang re zhig sems can yongs su smin pa'i dus la gzigs shing dus dpag tu med par bzhugs so //
translated: Thus, even when the bodhisattva is in a state of weak ability and compassion, he still sees the time for ripening sentient beings and remains for immeasurable time.

original: byang chub brnyes nas kyang shin tu dag pa'i mthu dang / thugs rje chen po brnyes nas dpag tu med pa'i sems can gyi tshogs la myur du phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa can su zhig yid ches par mi byed /
analyzed: byang chub brnyes nas kyang shin tu dag pa'i mthu dang / thugs rje chen po brnyes nas dpag tu med pa'i sems can gyi tshogs la myur du phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa can su zhig yid ches par mi byed /
translated: And who would not believe in the Tathagata who, after attaining enlightenment, remains for a long time through the power of his pure vows and through the attainment of great compassion in order to quickly benefit a multitude of immeasurable sentient beings?

original: de bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat Buddhas are only non-abiding nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: las byed pas rab tu phye ba'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa skye ba med pa yin du zin kyang gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba 'phags pa byams pa la sogs pa de dag kyang de ltar 'gyur du dogs so zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: las byed pas rab tu phye ba'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa skye ba med pa yin du zin kyang gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba 'phags pa byams pa la sogs pa de dag kyang de ltar 'gyur du dogs so zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Even though the Bhagavat ≈öƒÅkyamuni, who is distinguished by his activity, is unborn, it is feared that those who will appear in the future, such as the noble Maitreya, will be like that.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bas na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bas na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúBhagavat, if you have fully awakened to that, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin du las byed pas rab tu phye ba rnams tshad ma dang 'gal bas dus thams cad du skye ba med pa yin pas na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bor byung ste
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin du las byed pas rab tu phye ba rnams tshad ma dang 'gal bas dus thams cad du skye ba med pa yin pas na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bor byung ste
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn ≈öƒÅkyamuni arose as the essence of utter purity.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na /
translated: When he fully awakened to perfect buddhahood,

original: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba mi pham pa la sogs pa yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa kho nar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba mi pham pa la sogs pa yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa kho nar blta bar bya ste /
translated: it should be seen that those who will appear in the future, such as the TathƒÅgata Ajita, will also fully awaken to perfect buddhahood.

original: de nyid kyi ngo bo yin par gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngo bo yin par gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is their essence, because the reason is the same, and because all tathƒÅgatas fully awaken to perfect buddhahood in sameness.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gtan tshigs 'dra ba yin la 'bras bu mi 'dra ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gtan tshigs 'dra ba yin la 'bras bu mi 'dra ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that the reason is the same in every respect, but the result is not the same.

original: mnyam pa nyid 'di la dgongs nas bshad pa yin par khong du ma chud pa dag de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes smras te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid 'di la dgongs nas bshad pa yin par khong du ma chud pa dag de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes smras te /
translated: The Lord, intending this sameness, said, Why is it so?

original: ngo bo tha dad pa yin bzhin du @131b gcig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na ji ltar de las gzhan bdag kyang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya /
analyzed: ngo bo tha dad pa yin bzhin du @131b gcig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na ji ltar de las gzhan bdag kyang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya /
translated: If, while having different natures, one were fully enlightened, how could the others say, I am fully enlightened?

original: de lta na ni shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: If it were so, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: rang brjod par bzhed pa ston pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'das pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang brjod par bzhed pa ston pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'das pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The Lord, wishing to explain this, said, The past is inconceivable, etc.

original: sngon med pa'i ngo bo skyes nas zhig pa ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i ngo bo skyes nas zhig pa ni 'das pa'o //
translated: The past is the destruction of a thing that has arisen and no longer exists.

original: sngon med pa'i ngo bo skyes nas ma 'gags pa ni da ltar ro //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i ngo bo skyes nas ma 'gags pa ni da ltar ro //
translated: The present is a thing that has arisen and not yet been destroyed.

original: sngon med pa'i ngo bo phyis 'byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i ngo bo phyis 'byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The future is a thing that has not yet arisen.

original: thams cad kyang nges par las byed pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo kho na yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang nges par las byed pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo kho na yin no //
translated: All of them are by nature definitely devoid of activity.

original: des na dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa yang chos nyid 'di las mi 'da' ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa yang chos nyid 'di las mi 'da' ba kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagatas of the three times do not go beyond this reality.

original: de lta ma yin na de dag sangs rgyas kho na yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag sangs rgyas kho na yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were otherwise, they would not be Buddhas,

original: tshad ma dang 'gal ba rtogs na phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal ba rtogs na phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would be mistaken, since they would be understood to contradict valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar las byed pas rab tu phye ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar las byed pas rab tu phye ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the arising, etc. of the Tathagatas, which are distinguished by the performance of actions, are not real.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bas na su dag 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes so zhes bgyi ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bas na su dag 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes so zhes bgyi ba nas /
translated: Blessed One, therefore, those who think that the Tathagata is born, and so on, up to

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du sems pa de dag gi 'jig rten gnas pa ni 'khrul pa ste nor pas de dag lung dang rigs pa'i don ma rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du sems pa de dag gi 'jig rten gnas pa ni 'khrul pa ste nor pas de dag lung dang rigs pa'i don ma rtogs pa yin no //
translated: those who think that he has attained complete nirvana, their worldly existence is mistaken, deluded. They do not understand the meaning of scripture and reasoning.

original: yi ge kha cig las 'jig rten gnas pa ni 'khrul pa ste zhes 'byung ba de'i don yang snang ba med pa'i phyir dang / ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las 'jig rten gnas pa ni 'khrul pa ste zhes 'byung ba de'i don yang snang ba med pa'i phyir dang / ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In some texts, the phrase ‚Äúthe world is confused‚Äù is found; the meaning of that is also because of the non-existence of appearance and because of the non-existence of the light of knowledge of reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag ni 'jig rten gnas pa zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gnas pa ni shes pa dang shes bya dang / rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag ni 'jig rten gnas pa zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gnas pa ni shes pa dang shes bya dang / rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, they are called the world‚Äôs inhabitants‚Äù means that the world‚Äôs inhabitants are characterized by knowledge and the knowable, by the expression and the expressed, and by worldly convention.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams shin tu de la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams shin tu de la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because worldly people are very attached to that.

original: 'phros par bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: 'phros par bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'dzin pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúThey are spread out‚Äù means that they are held as other orüîΩare taught.

original: ston pa'o // de dag kyang gang zhe na ;üîΩsu dag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes so zhes bgyi ba nas /
analyzed: ston pa'o // de dag kyang gang zhe na ; su dag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes so zhes bgyi ba nas /
translated: And what are they?

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who think, ‚ÄòThe TathƒÅgata has arisen‚Äô up to ‚Äòhas entered parinirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äô are attached.‚Äù

original: bar tshig gis skye'o //
analyzed: bar tshig gis skye'o //
translated: The middle word is ‚Äúarisen.‚Äù

original: skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩgnas zin to //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ro // gnas zin to //
translated: will be born.üîΩhas been born.

original: gnas so // gnas par 'gyur ro //üîΩyongs su mya ngan las @132a * //üîΩ'das so // yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: gnas so // gnas par 'gyur ro // yongs su mya ngan las @132a * // 'das so // yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: is born.üîΩhas passed into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa.üîΩis passing into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: will pass into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: gang dag la de ltar mngon par zhen pa med du zin kyang de dag la yang 'khrul pa dang 'jig rten gnas pa ni yod pa yang ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang dag la de ltar mngon par zhen pa med du zin kyang de dag la yang 'khrul pa dang 'jig rten gnas pa ni yod pa yang ma yin nam /
translated: Even though they do not have such convictions, do not the error and the worldly convention exist?

original: byis pa dang mkhas pa gnyis kyi tha snyad ni 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: byis pa dang mkhas pa gnyis kyi tha snyad ni 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the conventions of the foolish and the wise are similar.

original: de dag gis ni 'gro ba sgyu ma lta bur 'dug pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir dang / mngon par zhen pa med pas ma brlan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'gro ba sgyu ma lta bur 'dug pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir dang / mngon par zhen pa med pas ma brlan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not understand that the world is like an illusion, and they are not moistened by the absence of conviction.

original: da ni mngon sum du gyur cing dge bar gyur pa rnams 'di la gus pa skyed pa'i ched du bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa 'di zab par brjod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal de'i phyir khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab
analyzed: da ni mngon sum du gyur cing dge bar gyur pa rnams 'di la gus pa skyed pa'i ched du bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa 'di zab par brjod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal de'i phyir khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab
translated: Now, in order to generate respect for this [tantra] among those who have become direct perceivers and who have become virtuous, this teaching on the inconceivable is expressed as profound.üîΩüîΩIn order to express that, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, for that reason, you should understand the inconceivable tathƒÅgatas, the inconceivable Dharma, and the inconceivable Sangha.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to generate respect for this teaching of the inconceivable in those who have become direct disciples and have become virtuous, the BhagavƒÅn says, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, for that reason you should proclaim this inconceivable tathƒÅgata,‚Äù and so on.

original: shin tu rab tu zab pa 'di gang gis bshad pa la gzhan 'di dang 'dra ba nyan pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu rab tu zab pa 'di gang gis bshad pa la gzhan 'di dang 'dra ba nyan pa yod pa yin te /
translated: This very profound teaching is explained by someone, and there are others who listen to it like this.

original: de bas na khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar ram /
analyzed: de bas na khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar ram /
translated: Therefore, you should proclaim this inconceivable tathƒÅgata in the presence of the tathƒÅgatas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'am /
translated: or in the presence of bodhisattvas,

original: dgra bcom pa'i mdun du brjod pa rjod cig de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i mdun du brjod pa rjod cig de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: or in the presence of arhats. The inconceivable tathƒÅgata is the inconceivable tathƒÅgata.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rang gi ngo bo la bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rang gi ngo bo la bya'o //
translated: It should be taken to refer to the essence that is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab ce na /
translated: Why is it inconceivable?

original: gang gi phyir bsam du med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam du med pa ste /
translated: Because it is inconceivable.

original: bsam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not an object of thought.

original: de nyid kyang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: gang gis bsam pa las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis bsam pa las 'das pa ste /
translated: Because it is beyond thought.

original: bsam par bya bar nus pa'i ngo bo las gang gi phyir 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam par bya bar nus pa'i ngo bo las gang gi phyir 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbeyond‚Äù is that it is beyond the nature of an object of thought.

original: de bas na bsam gyis mi lang ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bsam gyis mi lang ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be inconceivable.

original: de ltar na tshig dang po ni bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshig dang po ni bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the first phrase is the statement.

original: bzhi pa ni tshig mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni tshig mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is the conclusion of the phrase.

original: yang na skyes nas thob pa dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang // bsgoms pa las byung ba shes rab rnam pa bzhi'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir tshig rnam pa bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na skyes nas thob pa dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang // bsgoms pa las byung ba shes rab rnam pa bzhi'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir tshig rnam pa bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, it is applied in order, with four phrases, because it is not the domain of the four kinds of wisdom: that obtained from birth, that derived from listening, that derived from reflection, and that derived from cultivation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni chos la slob dpon 'chab pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams man ngag 'di 'bogs par ji ltar rigs she na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni chos la slob dpon 'chab pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams man ngag 'di 'bogs par ji ltar rigs she na /
translated: The question is: how is it possible for the great bodhisattvas, who are free of the concealment of the master of the Dharma, to impart this instruction?

original: @132b dgongs pa ni gzhan de bshad na don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @132b dgongs pa ni gzhan de bshad na don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The idea is that if it is explained to others, it would be meaningless.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni thos nas bsngags par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni thos nas bsngags par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan yin te /
translated: Thus, they would not praise it, saying, ‚ÄúHaving heard this, it is not even correct,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni phyin ci ma log par bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bsngags par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci ma log par bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bsngags par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not praise it, saying, ‚ÄúThis is only taught without error,‚Äù

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid la reg par bstan pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid la reg par bstan pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would understand that it is not taught to touch the thatness of things.

original: spong bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa'i phyir dang / brgyud pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir mthar thug pa yin no zhes shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa'i phyir dang / brgyud pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir mthar thug pa yin no zhes shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They would not abandon it, because they know that it is the ultimate, since it is the cause of the extremely pure dharmadhatu and because it is the intrinsic identity of the continuum.

original: bsam ba ni 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: bsam ba ni 'di lta ste ;
translated: The idea is this:

original: chos rnams la slob dpon 'chab pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams la slob dpon 'chab pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not in order to conceal the teacher of the Dharma.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: chos 'chad par byed na thos pa la dga' bar bya ba'i phyir byed dam /
analyzed: chos 'chad par byed na thos pa la dga' bar bya ba'i phyir byed dam /
translated: If one teaches the Dharma, is it done in order to delight in hearing it,

original: ma 'ongs pa na phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir byed grang na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir byed grang na /
translated: or is it done in order to benefit and gladden in the future?

original: de la chos zab mo'i bzod pa dang bral ba de la byas na mgu ba nyi tsher ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de la chos zab mo'i bzod pa dang bral ba de la byas na mgu ba nyi tsher ma zad kyi /
translated: If one does it for the latter, not only is there a limited satisfaction,

original: len par yang mi byed /
analyzed: len par yang mi byed /
translated: but there is no acceptance.

original: phan pa yang mi sgrub kyi /
analyzed: phan pa yang mi sgrub kyi /
translated: One does not accomplish benefit,

original: slar phyin ci log nyid du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar phyin ci log nyid du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: but rather one causes the opposite.

original: 'di ltar de thos pas dngos po 'am dngos po med par lta bar lhung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de thos pas dngos po 'am dngos po med par lta bar lhung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when one has no tolerance for the profound Dharma, one falls into the view of entity or non-entity through hearing.

original: 'chad pa dang don gnyis la dngos po dang dngos po med par lhag par mos pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'chad pa dang don gnyis la dngos po dang dngos po med par lhag par mos pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because one is devoted to the entity or non-entity of the two, explanation and meaning.

original: de bas na spong bar byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de bas na spong bar byed pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, one also abandons.

original: gang gis don med pa la gzhol bar 'gyur ba de bas na snod ma yin pa la lhag pa'i bsam pas 'di brtsams pa ni 'ju stobs chung ngus zas lci ba za ba bzhin du don ma yin pa gcig nas gcig du 'phel bar 'gyur bas 'di dag
analyzed: gang gis don med pa la gzhol bar 'gyur ba de bas na snod ma yin pa la lhag pa'i bsam pas 'di brtsams pa ni 'ju stobs chung ngus zas lci ba za ba bzhin du don ma yin pa gcig nas gcig du 'phel bar 'gyur bas 'di dag
translated: Therefore, this composition with an altruistic intention for those who are not suitable vessels is like someone with poor digestive power eating heavy food.üîΩ

original: la ma byas na legs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: la ma byas na legs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not good to do this for those who are not vessels, just as it is not good for someone with weak digestive power to eat heavy food.

original: de bas na de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas pa chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi gtam rnam par nges pa'i bdud rtsi'i ro myang bas bskyed pa'i sred pa can kho na'i mdun du yongs su mgu bar bya ba'i phyir bshad na mdzes pa yin no
