analyzed: de bas na de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas pa chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi gtam rnam par nges pa'i bdud rtsi'i ro myang bas bskyed pa'i sred pa can kho na'i mdun du yongs su mgu bar bya ba'i phyir bshad na mdzes pa yin no
translated: Therefore, it is only fitting to explain this to those who are thirsty for the taste of the nectar of certainty in the Dharma, the reality of things, which is generated by the experience of the reality of things that is directly perceived.

original: // de bas na 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las dman pa la lhag par mos pa rnams la chos zab mo 'chad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: // de bas na 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las dman pa la lhag par mos pa rnams la chos zab mo 'chad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba yin par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the noble Multitude of Jewels says that it is a downfall for a bodhisattva to explain the profound Dharma to those who are devoted to the inferior.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams la 'di ltar de dag shin tu bsngags par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams la 'di ltar de dag shin tu bsngags par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Why is it that ordinary beings do not praise them in this way, and do not abandon them?

original: spong bar yang mi 'gyur ba ga @133a * //
analyzed: spong bar yang mi 'gyur ba ga @133a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are not ordinary beings,

original: la yod ce na /üîΩso so'i skye bo ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la yod ce na / so so'i skye bo ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: 'di ltar 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, it is inconceivable,

original: bsam du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: inexpressible, and so on.

original: 'di yang snga ma bzhin du bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po ni bstan par 'gyur ba'o ;
analyzed: 'di yang snga ma bzhin du bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po ni bstan par 'gyur ba'o ;
translated: Here, as before, the first word ‚Äúinconceivable‚Äù is the teaching,

original: / lhag ma tshig gnyis ni 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: / lhag ma tshig gnyis ni 'chad pa yin no //
translated: and the remaining two words are the explanation.

original: yi ge kha cig las 'di ltar bsams pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsam du med pa zhes 'byung ste der ni bdag gis rtogs pa zhes bya ba khong nas byung ngo //
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las 'di ltar bsams pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsam du med pa zhes 'byung ste der ni bdag gis rtogs pa zhes bya ba khong nas byung ngo //
translated: In some texts, it appears as ‚Äúinconceivable, inexpressible,‚Äù and there it is understood as ‚Äúinconceivable, inexpressible, and so on.‚Äù

original: bsam du med pa bsam gyis mi lang ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam du med pa bsam gyis mi lang ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äú Inexpressible‚Äù and ‚Äúinconceivable‚Äù are as before.

original: de dag thams cad kyis ni so so'i skye bo rnams las khyad par du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis ni so so'i skye bo rnams las khyad par du bstan pa yin te /
translated: All of these are taught as being different from the ordinary person.

original: 'di lta ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: It is thus: the knowledge of the inconceivable.

original: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa dang / 'phags pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'chad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa dang / 'phags pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'chad par bzhed nas /
translated: The Lord having said that, the noble one, wishing to explain the inconceivable,

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab cing bsam du ma mchis pa 'di lta bu 'di la byis pa'am mkhas pa su zhig bsngags pa'am /üîΩspong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab cing bsam du ma mchis pa 'di lta bu 'di la byis pa'am mkhas pa su zhig bsngags pa'am / spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: said, ‚ÄúLord, in this inconceivable Dharma, which is not to be conceived, what fool or wise man would praise or disparage it?

original: de dag rjes su bsngags shing spong bar byed na ni stong pa nyid de'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir chos 'di thams cad don dam pa yin par zhen par 'gyur ro //üîΩde bas na gang yang dag par bsngags pa'am /
analyzed: de dag rjes su bsngags shing spong bar byed na ni stong pa nyid de'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir chos 'di thams cad don dam pa yin par zhen par 'gyur ro // de bas na gang yang dag par bsngags pa'am /
translated: If they praise or disparage it, then because it is included in emptiness, they would be attached to the idea that all these dharmas are the ultimate.

original: spong bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: spong bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no praise or disparagement at all.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgra dang don gnyis mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / sgrub pa dang sel ba yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgra dang don gnyis mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / sgrub pa dang sel ba yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that the word and the object of intrinsic reality are two, and because affirmation and negation are not tenable.

original: gzhan yang byed pa po la sogs pa'i bye brag bsngags pa la sogs pa thams cad brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang byed pa po la sogs pa'i bye brag bsngags pa la sogs pa thams cad brtags pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, all the distinctions of the agent, etc., such as praise, etc., are imagined.

original: de yang don du yod pa ma yin pa des na thams cad yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de yang don du yod pa ma yin pa des na thams cad yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: And since they do not exist in fact, therefore all are not real.

original: de bas na byis pa rnams kyi bsngags pa sgrub pa dang 'gog pa la sogs pa de dag ni log pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal tsam byed par zad kyi /
analyzed: de bas na byis pa rnams kyi bsngags pa sgrub pa dang 'gog pa la sogs pa de dag ni log pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal tsam byed par zad kyi /
translated: Thus, the praise, affirmation, negation, etc., of the childish are mere false conceit.

original: gang gis ci yang bsngags par byas pa dang / bkag pa med do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis ci yang bsngags par byas pa dang / bkag pa med do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that is praised or negated.

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab par bstan na ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin par smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab par bstan na ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin par smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: If all things are taught to be inconceivable, then it would be said that ordinary beings are inconceivable just like the TathƒÅgatas.

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not tenable.

original: de ltar med @133b pa yin na ni de dag phan tshun du bye brag 'ga' yang yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes kha cig dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar med @133b pa yin na ni de dag phan tshun du bye brag 'ga' yang yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes kha cig dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Some fear that if they do not exist in that way, they would not be different from each other at all.üîΩTo dispel that fear, the sutra states:

original: 'jam dpal ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi lang ba de ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba yin nam zhes dris te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi lang ba de ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba yin nam zhes dris te /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, just as the tathƒÅgatas are inconceivable, so too are ordinary beings inconceivable.üîΩWhat is this?

original: ci yin nam zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ci yin nam zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: This is a remainder.

original: yang na tshig zur gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshig zur gyis smras pa'o //
translated: Or it is a statement in a corner.
